executive_summary: To help employees stay at the forefront of business innovation while opening nearly 1,000 new locations per year, McDonald’s China decided to use AI to elevate all levels of customer service, quality, and operational excellence. In partnership with Microsoft, McDonald’s China established an AI Lab to catalyze its AI journey. The AI Lab team chose to use Microsoft Azure AI to support a full set of intelligent solutions based on large language models, natural language interaction, generative intelligence, and machine learning on the Azure cloud platform. Putting its initial focus on augmenting training at the company’s education center, Hamburger University, the team empowered students with AI assistants, enhanced search, and document translation. Now, these AI tools are helping McDonald’s China rapidly optimize efficiency across the organization.

title: ABN AMRO boosts Employee Net Promoter Scores by 46% and lowers costs by 40% with Dynamics 365.
executive_summary: ABN AMRO, one of the largest banks in the Netherlands, had to contend with a fragmented Customer Relationship Management (CRM) landscape. Previous CRM tools had a high cost of ownership, kept data siloed, and were not aligned for the use of cloud-based architecture. The bank embraced Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service and Sales and has lowered total cost of ownership for its customer engagement platform by up to 40 percent, improved its eNPS (employee net promoter score) from 4.8 to 7.0, improved productivity, and helped make the most of its data with a highly interoperable, cloud-based solution.

title: A secure and compliant version of ChatGPT: Otto Group builds its own in-house AI solution using Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: Efficient knowledge management is crucial for the success of any company—no matter whether the goal is to develop new products or provide the information necessary to ensure good customer service. In the past, Otto Group relied on a number of different tools such as FAQ documents or wikis to get the job done. But now, this global retail company and service provider is putting AI into overdrive: ogGPT (Otto Group GPT)—an in-house solution based on Azure OpenAI Service—currently has 26,000 employee users, who are exploring where the tool can accelerate and simplify day-to-day operations and internal processes.

title: Air India harnesses AI for operational excellence with Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: With a remarkable 90-year history, Air India is not only the flag carrier of India, but a symbol of the country’s aviation excellence and technological prowess. At the heart of the airline’s vision is a transformative technological journey, most recently marked by the incorporation of Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365 into multiple departments. Notable is how Air India is weaving AI and Copilot into its operations with a custom-built plugin for Copilot in Microsoft Teams. This innovative step, a testament to Air India’s commitment to digital evolution, unlocks a new realm of operational insights. With the ability to converse with AI in Microsoft Teams, the Copilot plugin not only provides critical data on flight punctuality and operational hurdles, but also empowers proactive, collaborative decision making.

title: Bumrungrad International Hospital optimizes SAP systems by moving to Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Compassion, comfort, convenience, and coordination are guiding doctrines for Bumrungrad International Hospital’s daily practice. The hospital’s SAP S/4HANA system, an enterprise resourcing planning system that manages accounting and finances, was a vital part of daily operations over which it had little control. Making a timely move to Microsoft Azure gave the organization more consistent system availability, more visibility into its SAP S/4HANA system, and a more reliable disaster recovery solution.

title: Kronos and Microsoft Azure deliver a holistic sporting software experience
executive_summary: Every sporting event depends on technology to make it run smoothly. However, the technology used in some international sporting events is old-fashioned and requires an upgrade and more user-centric features. Event delivery entities have been looking for a system that could offer data quality and maintenance services to integrate custom cloud services with their chosen technologies and tools. Kronos, a software company and supplier of events management technology, built a cloud-based platform to deliver successful events while being able to meet the specific requirements of its customers and ever evolving technological demands in the sports world.

title: Wipro invests USD $1 Billion in AI, trains 200,000 employees on GenAI principles with Microsoft Copilot
executive_summary: Artificial Intelligence (AI) has long been a focus area for Wipro, the global IT and consulting business, catalysed by a USD $1 Billion dollar investment in 2023. Today, 200,000 Wipro employees have been trained on the principles of GenAI and the organization remains committed to using the technology to help deliver value to customers faster and improve outcomes across the business.

title: Hargreaves Lansdown achieves transformational benefits with Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Hargreaves Lansdown is the UK’s number one platform for private investors, employing over 2,000 people. They are trusted by more than 1.7 million clients who together invest over £120 billion. The business was keen to explore the potential of artificial intelligence and, especially, Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365. The response from users has been fantastic, with improved accessibility and significant productivity savings.

title: Amadeus empowers its teams to focus their time and skills on value-added tasks with Copilot for Microsoft 365
executive_summary: As a company providing solutions to the tourism and hospitality industry, Amadeus operates in 190 countries. Created in 1987 by four European airlines, Amadeus has expanded its reach beyond flight booking, into a diverse range of travel solutions. Today, it is a leader when it comes to the technological solutions behind our travels.

title: Much faster and more efficient: Digital simulations at Schaeffler with Azure HPC
executive_summary: At Schaeffler, experiments with prototypes are a thing of the past. The motion technology company now relies on digital simulations to examine how a component or system will behave under certain conditions. Recently, there has been such huge demand for these simulations that the old on-premises landscape simply no longer had sufficient computing capacity. Help arrived in the form of high-performance computing (HPC) in the cloud. Using a new solution based on Azure HPC and some software provided its partner Rescale, Schaeffler is running more simulations than ever before—and with unprecedented speed and efficiency.

title: Demirören accelerates security operations of diverse sectors with Microsoft XDR and data security
executive_summary: Demirören is a leading conglomerate in Türkiye that covers industries like heavy metals, media, real estate, education, technology, and gaming. To secure its large breadth of data operations, the company deployed Microsoft extended detection and response (XDR) and data security solutions. In recent years, it rapidly upgraded its technological infrastructure, enhancing collaboration and adding detection and response capabilities to better enable remote work. By deploying Microsoft security solutions, Demirören reduced complexity in its security stack, significantly boosting productivity. Demirören’s partnership with CloudCan enabled it to further optimize cloud environments, leading to substantial cost savings and better decision-making.

title: EKZ workplace becomes “overwhelmingly positive” with Microsoft Surface devices
executive_summary: One of Switzerland’s largest energy suppliers, Elektrizitätswerke des Kantons Zürich (EKZ), wanted to provide its 1,400 employees with a more modern device experience, and to eliminate the high costs of their legacy device-management strategy. Microsoft Surface devices with Windows 11 Pro enable more flexible and productive work environments for EKZ employees, while Windows Autopilot simplifies the configuration, deployment, and ongoing management of the devices with a zero-touch experience for IT.

title: Cancer Council NSW fights cancer securely with Intune and Microsoft Defender for Endpoint
executive_summary: To better meet the needs of Australians fighting cancer and to prevent disease in the future, Cancer Council NSW upgraded its technology. The organization worked with Microsoft partner cubesys to strengthen its security posture and better manage employee devices. Now, Cancer Council NSW has the confidence its teams can better support people in the field securely.
products: Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Defender

title: Empowering excellence: Sonepar leverages Microsoft Dynamics 365 to offer the best omnichannel experience
executive_summary: How to ensure a swift, impactful digital transition towards omnichannel processes when a firm is implanted in 40 countries? This is the challenge faced by Sonepar. This independent, family-owned company specializes in Business to Business (B2B) distribution of electrical products, solutions and related services. Founded in 1969, Sonepar is the global leader in the market.

title: Siemens Healthineers China expedites product time to market with Microsoft Dev Box
executive_summary: Siemens Healthineers China develops new image applications for online systems to help doctors with remote consulting for patients. Developers were using local workstations to develop and test for multiple platforms, but just setting up each platform could take days—time better spent on development and testing. Healthineers began piloting Microsoft Dev Box in 2023. It enabled them to prebuild multiple bespoke dev and test environments in the cloud, enabling developers worldwide to collaborate and complete projects faster.

title: HUBER+SUHNER accelerates data analysis from weeks to minutes with Azure Data Explorer
executive_summary: HUBER+SUHNER, a leader in electrical and optical connectivity, implemented Microsoft Azure Data Explorer (ADX) with Option 4.0’s support. The result? A unified data architecture that has led to data analysis speed shrinking from weeks to minutes, enabling the company to resolve issues immediately and trace them back to their origin. With a single source of truth for the company’s globally distributed team, the company is setting the stage for advanced analytics and empowering its analysts to see the big picture.

title: Vestas moves to Azure high-performance computing for reliability, performance, and scalability
executive_summary: With more than 40 years of experience in wind energy and wind turbines installed in 88 countries, Vestas strives to be the global leader in sustainable energy solutions. The company requires vast amounts of computing power to perform turbine simulations that ensure the proper configuration and placement of turbines and wind farms to maximize energy output and prolong equipment life. Vestas’s on-premises supercomputer couldn’t keep up with an extensive simulation queue, resulting in business delays. By moving to Microsoft Azure and Azure high-performance computing, Vestas has improved reliability and capacity while reducing maintenance overhead and costs. This is opening new product and service opportunities while helping ensure a greener future for the planet.
products: Azure HPC

title: City of Utrecht supports secure collaboration and smarter city services with the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: One of the four largest urban centers in the Netherlands, the City of Utrecht is experiencing rapid growth, putting pressure on city services and driving leaders to pursue digital transformation. City leaders shifted the organization to a remote-first work environment with Microsoft 365 E5 and are migrating on-premises data to the Microsoft Cloud. The new cloud foundation improves data security and compliance, allows for flexible partnerships with outside organizations, improves accessibility for the public, and provides tools to create new smart city services.

title: Kantar Adopts Windows 11 Enterprise to Build the Foundation for Copilot and AI
executive_summary: To achieve its vision of delivering an employee experience that rivals the simplicity and ease of use of the best consumer experience, Kantar moved from on-premises to cloud-based Intune endpoint management. In preparation for its deployment of Windows 11 Enterprise, the company spun up Windows 365 Cloud PCs—and is harnessing the power of generative AI with Copilot. In addition to reducing costly, time-consuming IT processes, these benefits enabled Kantar to boost productivity for employees—translating an improved employee experience into impactful outcomes for its clients.

title: Bahrain’s Information & eGovernment Authority sets example of future-facing business continuity with Microsoft 365 and Azure
executive_summary: The Kingdom of Bahrain’s Information & eGovernment Authority (iGA) is on a mission to redefine public service. From struggling with on-premises infrastructure to achieving nearly 100% information availability with Azure Backup, the authority has been leading transformation in the Gulf region. iGA’s Cloud First policy and adoption of cloud solutions—the first in the Middle East—streamlined operations and saved thousands of work hours, setting a new standard in digital transformation.

title: Backbase seeks to usher in a new era of engagement banking with its Grand Central platform and Azure API Management
executive_summary: Backbase, a leading force in the banking industry, is spearheading the future of banking through its revolutionary Grand Central platform powered by Azure API Management and the leading banking domain model BIAN. With commitment to innovation and customer-centric solutions, Backbase is empowering financial institutions to navigate the evolving landscape of banking with agility and efficiency.

title: Nordomatic builds a smarter future with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Nordomatic, headquartered in Stockholm, is the leading independent Building Management System (BMS) integrator in Scandinavia. More than 900 employees in 20 offices provide the world’s largest and most demanding real estate owners with smart building technologies, from security and privacy equipment to heating, cooling, and lighting systems. Nordomatic has been a pioneering and innovative company since its founding in 1967. Reinforcing the company’s mission to accelerate an open and sustainable future, Ola Reppling, COO, says, “My mantra is ‘Rigidity at the core and flexibility at the edge,’ meaning maintaining a solid foundation while adapting to evolving circumstances is the key to deliver value for Nordomatic and our customers now and going forward.”

title: dentsu optimizes collaborative workflows with Microsoft Teams Premium
executive_summary: Global creative media company dentsu reduces time spent on repetitive tasks and ensures its global employees get the most out of every meeting with Microsoft Teams Premium and Microsoft Copilot for Microsoft 365.

title: Dyno-Rod reduces friction in the field and improves outcomes with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Dyno-Rod has been expertly clearing drains, fixing burst pipes, and providing a range of plumbing solutions, including leak detection and radiator repair/replacement, for households and businesses across the United Kingdom since 1963. Known for personalized service and its familiar orange vans, the privately held business was acquired by the Centrica group in 2004 and is now part of British Gas and Scottish Gas. Dyno-Rod has one of the UK’s largest plumbing and drains forces. Its network of over 1,100 certified engineers, 54 franchisee businesses, and local support teams serves over 1 million customers per year—consistently scoring 4.7 stars out of 5 in satisfaction surveys.

title: Audi is reimagining endpoint management and security with Microsoft Intune
executive_summary: Renowned for its automobiles and motorcycles in the premium and luxury segments, as well as technological leadership, the AUDI AG embarked on an IT transformation with Microsoft Intune to streamline device management and enhance security. With Intune, Audi aimed to simplify the user experience, reduce IT dependencies, and ensure secure, seamless access to resources. This strategic shift enabled the migration of 40,000 devices to a unified management platform, enhancing operational efficiency and user satisfaction without compromising personal settings. Audi’s initiative showcases its innovation and sets a standard for secure, efficient workplace transformation in the automotive industry.

title: Körber uplevels pharma factories with cloud-based PAS-X MES SaaS using Microsoft Cloud for Manufacturing
executive_summary: Körber is helping customers become future-ready with easy-to-deploy, scalable, and secure pharmaceutical production by transforming its PAS-X Manufacturing Execution System (MES) offering into an SaaS solution. This strategic enhancement is designed to meet the rising global demand for pharmaceuticals by facilitating scalable MES deployments and maintenance while reducing capital and resource expenditure. The move capitalizes on the robust stability of Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Cloud for Manufacturing, including Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), to offer a service stack to customers that enables greater flexibility and scalability. Körber customers are already reporting significant IT responsibility and initial investment reductions while being able to scale and update easily.

title: TatvaCare leverages Microsoft Azure OpenAI to transform healthcare
executive_summary: TatvaCare, a promising start-up in the Indian health tech landscape, was founded in 2020 with a mission to transform care practices. It aims to promote efficient, patient-centric care and optimize outcomes across the healthcare spectrum. Its product portfolio includes TatvaPractice, an advanced electronic medical record (EMR) and knowledge platform aimed at healthcare practitioners; and MyTatva, a digital therapeutics (DTx) application to help patients manage chronic health conditions. TatvaCare is committed to achieving a long-term health continuum by improving the quality of care at one end and enhancing the quality of life on the other.

title: Using Advanced Analytics to automate processes and prevent failures: A data platform for Clearstream based on Azure
executive_summary: Every day, Clearstream carries out more than 250,000 settlement transactions, while holding more than 300,000 nationally and internationally traded bonds, securities, shares, and investment funds in custody. That’s another way of saying that this subsidiary and central securities depository of Deutsche Börse Group carries a great deal of responsibility. In a strictly regulated industry, the company carries out its processes promptly, accurately, transparently, and securely. In the past, Clearstream used an on-premises data platform for this purpose. Today, data is made available from a central source with the help of Microsoft Azure. This ensures more efficient processes and speeds up the development of new services.
products: Azure, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, Azure Functions, Microsoft Purview, Power BI

title: Onepoint: being a consulting firm in the age of generative AI and Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: From Paris to Sydney, via Bordeaux and Kuala Lumpur, Onepoint has been supporting public and private sector players in their technological transformation for over twenty years. As both a consulting and technology firm, the company refines its expertise to keep pace with major innovations in cybersecurity, cloud computing, data science and artificial intelligence (AI).

title: SPAR helps customers make grocery savings with an Azure-based customer app
executive_summary: Austrian supermarket chain SPAR is committed to helping its customers save on their grocery shopping with the help of technology. A traditional brick-and-mortar retailer, the company is embracing digitalization and innovation by moving to the cloud – and using it to develop a new customer app that’s helping SPAR to push out more promotions and discounts while also phasing out paper-based systems.

title: Schneider Electric fast-tracks innovation with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Schneider Electric may not be a household name, but it’s the innovative force behind many of the technologies we use every day, in energy management and industrial automation. The company provides productivity-enhancing and energy efficiency solutions around the world, in homes, building, datacenters, electrical grids, and in nearly every aspect of industry. AI is nothing new to Schneider—it’s been carefully experimenting with and using the technology for more than three decades. Now that the necessary infrastructure and supporting technologies have matured to the point where AI is within reach of all of us, Schneider is ready with its own AI-enabled solutions. The company is basing its customer-facing AI solutions on a highly performant technology from a vendor it has trusted for years: Azure OpenAI Service, a solution within Microsoft Cloud for Manufacturing.
products: Azure, Azure Machine Learning, Azure Operator Call Protection

title: Roquette leverages Azure OpenAI Service in the age of generative AI
executive_summary: The mission of global family-owned group Roquette is to supply ingredients of natural origin to the pharmaceutical, food, nutrition and cosmetics industries. As a market leader, the company and its 10,000-strong workforce fulfills its mission by designing cutting-edge products capable of addressing society's health and nutrition challenges.

title: From hindsight to foresight: Wipro’s business insights journey with Microsoft Data Lake
executive_summary: Wipro is a leading technology services and consulting company focused on building innovative solutions that address clients’ most complex digital transformation needs. Leveraging our holistic portfolio of capabilities in consulting, design, engineering, and operations, we help clients realize their boldest ambitions and build future-ready, sustainable businesses. With nearly 240,000 employees and business partners across 65 countries, we deliver on the promise of helping our clients, colleagues, and communities thrive in an ever-changing world.

title: Ezra VeBitzaron redefines construction management with Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: Ezra VeBitzaron is a cornerstone of Tel Aviv-Jaffa's urban development since 1937. The company wanted to shift to the cloud to overcome integration and data flow issues faced with on-premises management systems, as well as facilitate smoother collaboration with its many contractors. After implementing Dynamics 365 Business Central, Ezra VeBitzaron saw more efficiency in its daily processes and an 11% cut in operational costs. Thanks to automation, it has also saved 75% of time spent on manual processes and made it more effective to collaborate with contractors and manage projects.

title: Quotient Ventures turns to Microsoft 365 Business Premium for productivity, collaboration, device management, and data security in a single solution
executive_summary: Mumbai-based Tilt Brand Solutions, part of Quotient Ventures, offers brand and communications services to a wide range of clients. In 2022, the young company reached an inflection point in its growth trajectory and needed to standardize ways of working, collaborating, and communicating securely. With an IT team of two, the company also needed to ensure that the solution could be managed primarily by a few users. Quotient Ventures chose Microsoft 365 Business Premium as its IT solution and hasn’t looked back. In addition to reducing costs by 40% while increasing productivity, Tilt Brand Solutions reports other, unexpected benefits, particularly in the area of security.
customer: Tilt Brand Solutions, member company of Quotient Ventures
products: Microsoft 365 Business Premium

title: Swiss Paraplegic Centre – Working with Microsoft to usher in the digital workplace, with Microsoft Teams and SharePoint Online
executive_summary: Like so many other clinics, the Swiss Paraplegic Centre had become bogged down in protracted and bureaucratic internal work processes. These processes devoured a lot of time that was then no longer available for patient care. In 2020, the Centre therefore resolved to press ahead in digitalizing the clinic’s workplaces. The result? A year later, the SPC’s IT department collaborated with Microsoft to launch the Modern Workplace project with the aim of accelerating work processes and making them more efficient. To begin with, Microsoft Teams was introduced, Microsoft Exchange mailboxes across the entire Swiss Paraplegic Group were migrated and a new intranet was set up in the cloud based on Microsoft SharePoint Online. Microsoft Power Platform was deployed to optimize, standardize and digitalize a large number of administrative processes. Effective support for day-to-day workflows and the removal of bureaucratic obstacles significantly improved satisfaction levels throughout the workforce.

title: Domino’s unites and engages a global workforce with Microsoft Viva
executive_summary: With thousands of stores across 12 markets, Domino’s Pizza Enterprises Limited has carved out a special place in the hearts (and stomachs) of pizza lovers. With a geographically diverse workforce speaking multiple languages on three continents, the fast-moving company aimed to unite its geographically diverse workforce and recognized the need for effective, centralized communication at scale. Domino’s turned to Microsoft Viva, an integrated employee experience platform, to enhance engagement, improve productivity, and foster connection among team members.

title: IWill Therapy and IWill CARE uses Azure AI to help improve clients’ mental health
executive_summary: IWill Therapy and IWill CARE, a leading online mental health care provider in India, needed to reach more clients. It created a Hindi-speaking chatbot named IWill GITA using the cutting-edge products and services included in the unified Azure AI Studio platform, incorporating the latest large language models in Azure OpenAI Service and integrated Azure AI Content Safety filters. IWill‘s scalable, AI-powered bot now provides cognitive behavioral therapy to bring mental health access and therapist-like conversations to people throughout India.

title: Nagarro powers HR operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365 to gain efficiency
executive_summary: Nagarro is a global leader in digital product engineering. With its agile and caring values, it drives technology-led business breakthroughs to help clients transform, adapt, and build. Listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange, the company enables enterprises to future-proof their business by leveraging its expertise across cutting-edge technologies and multiple industries. It has a broad international customer base, primarily in Central Europe and North America. Nagarro employs over 19,000 people across 36 countries and is growing exponentially.
products: Dynamics 365 Human Resources

title: Porsche Informatik boosts performance and security for customer-facing applications with Elastic on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Porsche Informatik needed to streamline and reduce delays across its IT operations, used by millions of customers and employees. To do so, it enlisted Elastic and Microsoft Azure cloud solutions. Today, Porsche Informatik has a more secure network that operates on a single stack thanks to Elastic and Azure Private Link.

title: PTT Global Chemical solves office work issues ‘in one go’ with Microsoft Copilot and Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: PTT Global Chemical (GC) is making strides in transforming its internal processes and empowering its employees to deliver value to customers fast. With Microsoft Copilot, the company transformed taking meeting minutes and assigning action items, streamlining what used to take hours into mere minutes. With an internal generative artificial intelligence (AI) built with Azure OpenAI Service, analyzing documents has become a breeze, saving employees a full workday.

title: How Albert Heijn is using Azure OpenAI to reduce food waste and help its customers eat healthy
executive_summary: As the Netherlands’ leading supermarket chain, Albert Heijn wants to help its customers to live a healthier lifestyle while minimizing its environmental footprint. To do that, the company is investing in artificial intelligence. With support from Microsoft, it has embarked on a series of initiatives aimed at leveraging AI – and Generative AI in particular – to do everything from customer personalization to demand forecast and food waste projects. These efforts have radically transformed operations at Albert Heijn – further strengthening its role in the Dutch retail sector and making it easier for its customers to change their lifestyle.
products: Dynamics 365, Power Automate

title: Groupama envisions mutual AI with generative AI and Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: For over 100 years, the Groupama Group has been focusing on timeless humanist values to enable as many people as possible to build their lives with confidence. It relies on communities based on mutual assistance, that are human and close to people, optimistic and responsible. The Groupama Group, one of the leading mutual insurance groups in France, developed its insurance and service activities in ten countries. It counts 12 million members and customers and 31,000 employees worldwide, and an annual revenue of 15.9 billion euros.

title: Beiersdorf has a clear view of its sustainability progress—thanks to Microsoft Azure, Power Platform, and a central data corpus
executive_summary: To set the company on a path that clearly benefits the environment and society, Beiersdorf launched its CARE BEYOND SKIN Sustainability Agenda, which features specific sustainability targets: achieve an absolute reduction of 30 percent in greenhouse gas emissions by 2025 along the entire value chain versus 2018 and make all packaging refillable, reusable, or recyclable by 2025. In order to make progress along this path transparent and measurable, precise KPIs are needed to obtain accurate data that reveals levers with maximum impact on these targets. Beiersdorf has therefore initiated a dedicated Sustainability Digitalization Program that uses a data analysis platform based on Microsoft Azure and Power Platform.

title: Idemitsu Kosan says goodbye to ADFS through switching authentication infrastructure to Microsoft Entra ID in pursuit of diverse work styles
executive_summary: Idemitsu Kosan is known as a company that manufactures and sells fuel oil such as gasoline, kerosene, light oil, and heavy oil, but is actually engaged in a wide range of businesses, including manufacture and sale of basic chemicals, such as olefin (ethylene, propylene, and butadiene) and aroma chemicals, and lubricating oil. In recent years, in order to achieve carbon neutrality, Idemitsu Kosan is working on the generation of synthetic fuels that are free of carbon dioxide emissions, manufacture of sustainable aviation fuel (SAF), and use of ammonia as a fuel.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra, Microsoft Intune

title: Zafin empowers banking innovation through product modernization with Microsoft Cloud for Financial Services
executive_summary: One of the most complex dilemmas in the banking industry to date is how to modernize 40-year-old systems while still maintaining product innovation. And banks encounter innovation barriers that prevent them from adapting to market shifts toward personalized bundles and offerings. Zafin is utilizing Microsoft Cloud for Financial Services to transform banking by innovating the way a financial institution provides products and pricing to its customers without compromising its modernization journey.

title: DynamicWeb helps retailers simplify e-commerce and boost bottom lines with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: DynamicWeb is transforming the retail industry with its innovative Microsoft-powered solutions. By seamlessly integrating various systems like inventory management, customer relationship management, and financial operations, it's changing how retailers do e-commerce. From boosting BHG Department Stores' sales to enabling Pet Lover Centre to process thousands of orders daily, DynamicWeb is directly impacting retailers’ bottom lines. With plans to launch more AI-driven services and make its solutions available on the Azure Marketplace, DynamicWeb is set to redefine e-commerce.

title: Business law firm Fidal designs a new future of work with 2,000 new Surface Laptops
executive_summary: Fidal is France’s largest independent business law firm, with more than 2,300 global employees. To help support more flexible, highly secure work, Fidal chose to deploy Surface Laptops (4 and 5) across the business, 2,000 devices in total. Today, employees are working more productively, securely, and flexibly from anywhere.
products: Microsoft Intune, Surface Laptop

title: Lenovo sales team transforms globally and closes faster with Dynamics 365 Sales
executive_summary: Lenovo, a global powerhouse in technology solutions that change the world, from laptops, tablets, and phones to servers and network systems, has been a major supplier to the electronics and data storage industry for nearly 40 years. Lenovo continually innovates, developing next-generation products and services for customers ranging from consumers to multi-national enterprises. More than 77,000 Lenovo employees serve 180 markets around the world.

title: BBK moves from past to future, reshaping its home décor retail business with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Polish company BBK S.A. helps to create elegant, functional interiors through its selection of home décor and textile products under the home&you and Essex brands. Due to new strategic directions and digital disruptions, BBK prioritized investments in modern technologies, focusing on cloud-based solutions. One of the first choices made was Microsoft Dynamics 365. The move streamlined operations across 130+ stores and ensured business continuity for BBK. The result: a company set towards a culture where innovation thrives and every member contributes to BBK’s success.

title: End-to-end digitalization of the daily routine at UKBB - with Microsoft 365 E5
executive_summary: The challenges faced by University Children’s Hospital Basel (UKBB) are daunting indeed: Rising cost pressure and a general shortage of specialist labor in healthcare create an acute need for more efficient processes and simplified communication structures. In response to this situation, UKBB decided to implement a ground-breaking digitalization strategy – and chose Microsoft as its strategic partner. “Zero trust” is the fundamental principle behind the hospital’s approach to IT. Essentially, this means that every service–be it in device management, Azure services or collaboration–is implemented only after it has been tested and subjected to a rigorous security assessment. Adherence to this principle ensures that all solutions and methodologies always comply with the strictest security requirements. As a result, the solutions from Microsoft are enabling the comprehensive modernization of the workplace, improving internal communication, and freeing up more time for hospital staff to devote to their patients.
products: Azure, Azure Arc, Microsoft 365, Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft 365 Enterprise, Microsoft Purview, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Full steam ahead to a digital future: The Flurina chatbot based on Azure OpenAI Services
executive_summary: Rhaetian Railway (RhB) has a long and illustrious tradition. Not least thanks to the spectacular routes it covers, it commands deep international respect: Customers from around the globe plan their trips on the Bernina and/or Glacier Express months in advance. Yet in light of this long-standing tradition and such high esteem, the company is naturally responsible for looking ahead in good time and charting its course to a successful future. RhB has therefore set itself the goal of being a technological pioneer in the rail space. Armed with a comprehensive innovation and digitalization strategy, it is seeking robust answers to the most pressing challenges of our time. One concrete example is the AI chatbot Flurina, which RhB developed in collaboration with Microsoft partner ParetoLabs. Based on Microsoft Azure OpenAI, the chatbot complements RhB’s existing service channels while also easing the burden on human staff.

title: Power transmission operator ELES gains agility with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Ensuring the lights stay on requires more than competence; it calls for innovation. ELES, guardian of Slovenia's electric power transmission, embodies this spirit. Yet, the company faced a challenge: an inflexible, outdated enterprise resource management (ERP) system. Enter Microsoft Dynamics 365—an evergreen, future-proof solution bringing ELES departments together, fostering efficiency and collaboration. By consolidating data from multiple sources, ELES can make informed decisions quickly. “Given any network or energy supply changes, we can swiftly adapt, maintaining our services,” says Tamara Slapar, Deputy Information and Communications Technology Director at ELES.

title: Dutch mental healthcare nonprofit, Reinier van Arkel, addresses long waitlists with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: As in many parts of the world, in the Netherlands an increasing demand for mental health services combined with insufficient numbers of caregivers leads to a lag in getting care. Mental health care nonprofit Reinier van Arkel is working to better meet the needs of clients with a new Microsoft Dynamics 365-based waitlist platform. The system automates and digitizes the client waitlist, from referral to beginning of treatment, so clients can get specialized support.

title: Macquarie Cloud Services protects Cafs’ sensitive data with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Cyber-attacks impact any industry at any given time. Potential data leaks lead to password changes, identity theft, and card cancellations. However, for some organizations, the stakes are even higher. There are a few reasons for this, including the perception that many lack the funding or skills to maintain and secure data. Organizations are struggling to keep up with the ever-evolving cybersecurity landscape.

title: CareStack redefines business outcomes for dentistry leveraging Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: CareStack is an end-to-end digital health platform in dentistry that connects dentists, payers, and patients seamlessly and provides them with intelligent tools to improve patient health outcomes and enhance operational efficiency for providers while reducing the total cost of care for payers. Their product philosophy is to do more features, build more intelligence, and handhold our customers at every step so that they get more time, control, and money.
products: Azure, Azure Developer Tools, Visual Studio

title: Telkomsel customer support teams speak volumes—with help from copilot based on Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Telkomsel, one of the largest digital telco companies in Asia, faced a “good problem to have”: burgeoning sales of its products and services. But the company knew that its customer support team could easily be overwhelmed by sharply rising demand. Many issues in the customer service agents’ long queues could quickly be solved with a boilerplate response. Telkomsel had tried a chatbot for such requests, but the original version lacked the personal touch that is essential in Indonesia. The company created its now overwhelmingly popular “Veronika” virtual assistant with Microsoft Azure OpenAI. With Veronika handling repetitive, mundane calls, Telkomsel customer support teams are as excited as Telkomsel customers, who access support whenever and however they like.

title: Telstra dials in elevated customer service with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Telstra is Australia’s leading telecommunications and technology company, offering a full range of communications services throughout the nation and beyond. The company’s ongoing innovation keeps pace with surging technological progress, making for constantly evolving services and products. Telstra’s frontline staff and customer service agents require a vast technical knowledge base in the face of this increasing complexity. The company saw an opportunity to help them respond to customers more quickly and effectively with the support of generative AI. So it developed two cutting-edge generative AI tools based on Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service. Even early in rollout, the Ask Telstra and One Sentence Summary tools are delivering promising results, with 90 percent of employees using One Sentence Summary reporting time savings and increased effectiveness, resulting in 20 percent less follow-up contact. Eighty-four percent of customer service agents using the Ask Telstra solution agree that it has a positive impact on customer interactions.

title: Managing documents with the help of AI: docunite ensures greater efficiency with Azure Cognitive Services
executive_summary: Managing real estate also means managing piles of documents relating to each property in a way that’s always complete, transparent, and up to date. But reality often paints a vastly different picture: files are stored in a variety of systems, and both internal and external stakeholders require their own versions of the documents at varying points in the process. That’s why docunite harnessed the potential of Azure Cognitive Services to develop a solution that bundles all the industry’s requirements and automatically processes and classifies documents. The result is greater efficiency in the kind of document management required in the real estate industry.

title: Sasfin Bank enhances legal team with Azure-based, AI-powered Contract Corridor solution
executive_summary: Sasfin Bank Limited's Group Legal team, headed by Howard Brown, embarked on a transformation journey to enhance the bank’s legal operations. Taking document management head-on, Sasfin Bank’s legal team found a game-changing solution in Legal Interact's Contract Corridor. Built on Microsoft Azure, the platform doesn't just centralize 20,000 documents; it also uses artificial intelligence (AI) to analyze contract clauses, making post-signature management a breeze. Questions like 'What does this confidentiality clause mean?' are instantly answered, while Power BI dashboards provide real-time snapshots, moving from guesswork into data-driven decision-making.

title: Arada boosts efficiency and customer engagement with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Armani Beach Residences at Palm Jumeirah, Aljada, and Masaar—these are just some of the premium living spaces by Arada, a trendsetter in the UAE's real estate sector. Arada needed to bring its various departments together onto a single platform, enabling collaboration and efficiency. By choosing Microsoft Azure, Dynamics 365 Fin Ops, and Microsoft 365 E5, Arada enabled the seamless integration of its back and front office functions. By making customer and internal information and insights easily accessible, it has empowered its team to serve customers faster and make informed decisions. Using the cloud platform has also led to lowered infrastructure and maintenance costs.

title: Nottinghamshire County Council strikes the right balance of governance and innovation with Microsoft Teams Phone
executive_summary: Nottinghamshire County Council consolidated its telephony contracts and infrastructure into a single solution and chose to migrate to Microsoft Teams, working closely with the FastTrack team and leveraging its Unified Support contract. Governance and efficiency have improved. Teams Phone and Teams Rooms are facilitating true hybrid working. The council is now well-placed to pursue further innovation and digitalisation.

title: One NZ democratizes data access, enabling instant customer support with Microsoft Fabric Real-Time Analytics
executive_summary: New Zealand’s largest mobile carrier, One NZ, adheres to its central value—customers. To give nearly 1,000 users a real-time, tailored view of customer data, it upgraded to Microsoft Fabric Real-Time Analytics (RTA) within less than two weeks. The new platform elevated One NZ’s customer service and added depth to its analytics, transforming raw data into actionable insights. Empowered teams can now make accurate, data-driven decisions and respond to customer inquiries nearly twice as fast as before.

title: Genus PLC builds a best-of-breed business solution with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Genus PLC (LON:GNS) is a world-leading animal genetics company. It uses leading-edge research techniques, innovative technology, and world-class support services to help farmers around the world produce meat and milk more efficiently and sustainably. This work enables customers to enhance their commercial success while increasing the world’s supply of safe, affordable, and high-quality animal protein. Genus serves more than 50,000 customers in more than 75 countries, primarily through Genus ABS (focusing on dairy and beef cattle) and Genus PIC (focusing on pigs). The company employs more than 3,500 people around the world.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Field Service, Dynamics 365 Finance, Dynamics 365 Human Resources, Dynamics 365 Sales, Power Apps

title: Centrica creates data platform with Azure HDInsight and Power BI
executive_summary: Centrica, an international energy services and solutions company, serves millions of UK and Ireland consumers and businesses with the supply of electricity and gas, services, and solutions through leading energy brands, including British Gas and Bord Gáis. Headquartered in Windsor, Berkshire, Centrica transitioned from an on-premises Hadoop data platform to Azure PaaS as part of their data modernization strategy. During this transformation, they established a new data platform with the aims of consolidating data, fostering scalability, and driving cost-efficiency. This platform not only promotes collaboration and streamlined data access for the development of data products, but also significantly contributes to lowering operational costs, reducing the overall TCO and improving performance and scalability. As a result, data processing and analysis accelerated, transforming time-intensive tasks into immediately available assets.

title: Cognizant makes performance management more effective and meaningful with Microsoft Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: Cognizant, one of the world’s leading professional services companies, works with businesses to make everyday life even better—for their employees, their customers, and the communities they serve. The company leverages IoT, AI, software engineering, and the cloud to digitize the products, services, and customer experiences of its clients; automate their business processes; and modernize their technology infrastructure. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant has a rapidly expanding footprint that extends from India and China to Europe, North America, South America, and the Middle East. It helps clients across industries envision, build, and run innovative digital enterprises.
customer: Cognizant Technology Solutions India Pvt Ltd
products: Azure, Azure AI and Machine Learning, Azure Machine Learning

title: Siemens Teamcenter and Microsoft Azure solve the tough challenges with a modern PLM
executive_summary: With Siemens Teamcenter, customers can have full visibility up and down the product lifecycle, from planning, to manufacturing, to purchasing. Deployed on Azure, Siemens offers an adaptable Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) system that connects people and processes that previously were isolated. With the scale, security, and reliability of Azure, Siemens is giving its customers an edge over the competition.

title: Bank of Cyprus increases collaboration while reducing costs with Microsoft 365 and Teams Phone
executive_summary: Enabling a complex network of departments and associates, Bank of Cyprus needed a better way to communicate. The Bank decided to make Microsoft Teams its go-to platform where employees seamlessly transition between collaboration tools and telephony services, leveraging on Microsoft 365 and Teams Phone. This pivot not only streamlined operations but also enhanced employee efficiency and provided opportunities for further cost reduction. With the anticipated cost reduction in network infrastructure, reduction in electricity consumption, and a significant decrease in annual CO2 emissions, the bank sets a new standard in banking efficiency and environmental responsibility.

title: MHP unlocks big data with Microsoft Azure to effectively manage tons of grain
executive_summary: As parent company of a leading international food and agrotech group, MHP is the top European chicken production company according to WattPoultry. With headquarters in Ukraine and production facilities both in Ukraine and in the Balkans, logistics is MHP’s top priority. Needing to strategically distribute 2 million tons of grain and oilseeds between different storage locations, it was decided to automate its processes. With a solution built on top of Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Power BI, MHP can do millions of calculations within minutes, considering factors like proximity to fields and storage capacities. This helps the MHP eliminate human error, lower costs, and boost profits. With more computing efficiency on the cloud, calculations take 15 minutes instead of two weeks, saving the company USD200,000 every year.

title: NETZSCH Group creates single source of truth with Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform
executive_summary: Traditionally, the NETZSCH Group has operated its three main business units independently. The company recently began exploring how AI and IoT data could provide new avenues for growth. As part of that process, it also began looking for a way to unify its siloed data. Adopting the Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform, NETZSCH Group consolidated its data and developed efficient means of refining data quality and sourcing reliable insights. The solution could also lead to the development of new data-as-a-service offerings.

title: mBank strengthens cloud capability through upskilling with Microsoft Learn
executive_summary: mBank, one of Poland’s most innovative banks, is preparing to move its applications to the cloud. To make the most of the migration, the bank has also begun upskilling employees in this area and implementing a comprehensive learning program with Microsoft. With over 40 percent of IT personnel having benefited from the courses, the employees can strengthen their cloud capabilities. “Now that our team knows cloud technologies inside out, we can make sure that everything goes according to the plan,” says Adam Ksit, IT Deputy Director at mBank.

title: Finance in the fast lane: AHAM Capital digitizes operations with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: In a transformative journey, AHAM Capital, one of Malaysia's top asset managers, has boldly embraced digitization by shifting its operations to the Microsoft Azure cloud. This strategic pivot has expedited customer onboarding, transactions, and enhanced customer experiences. The company has digitized 75% of customer transactions and seen a drastic increase in data accuracy. With the right foundation for scalability and flexibility, AHAM Capital is set to form new partnerships with digital players and reach new markets.

title: ASOS uses Azure AI Studio to surprise and delight young fashion lovers
executive_summary: United Kingdom–based ASOS is a destination for fashion lovers in their 20s, that continuously explores technology options to enhance the customer experience. The company delivers inspiration to its customers, along with a catalog spanning thousands of products through powerful computing capabilities and a vast recommendations engine built on Microsoft Azure. With the recent prevalence of generative AI platforms like ChatGPT, ASOS recognized a triple opportunity to expand its business model, enrich its technology infrastructure, and meet the modern tech expectations of its young customers. ASOS used Azure OpenAI Service and Azure AI prompt flow with ChatGPT language models to rapidly develop and test an Azure OpenAI-powered customer experience that helps customers discover new looks.

title: Visma: shaping the future of the software sector by innovating with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Visma is a leading European software provider based in Norway. The owner of more than 170 companies across the continent, Visma sees cloud technology as key to its success and that of its entire ecosystem. Over the past few years, it has been pushing for cloud adoption both at an internal level and across its wider network – encouraging all companies in its group to embrace the cloud they prefer, at their own terms. Microsoft Azure has been a pivotal part of this process. At Visma, it has formed part of a multi-cloud platform and beyond, and it’s getting selected by hundreds of other companies in the Visma group as primary cloud provider.

title: Children 1st protects families across Scotland with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Children 1st offers whole-family support across Scotland to ensure children are safe, secure, and loved. The nonprofit needed to update its CRM so frontline workers can better record and use up-to-date information. With Dynamics 365, Children 1st tracks current cases, empowers frontline staff to spend more time building relationships with families, and measures impact to communicate with supporters.

title: Grupo Bimbo bakes in end-to-end data security and compliance with Microsoft Purview true to its “deeply human” values
executive_summary: With operations around the globe, more than 100 well-loved brands, and 145,000 employees (associates, in Grupo Bimbo parlance), Grupo Bimbo is a major player in the consumer goods industry. Its leadership strategy includes rigorously protecting its trove of recipes and R&D assets. Most importantly, the company must care for one of its most precious assets: its sterling reputation. Not only is the international bakery lauded for its commercial success, its “deeply human” ethos makes Grupo Bimbo a sought-after employer. Its vast store of sensitive data calls for visibility and highly effective safeguards to ensure compliance with regulations in the many countries where Grupo Bimbo operates. The company answered these requirements with the Microsoft Purview family of data security, governance, risk, and compliance solutions. This visibility sparks an array of benefits: improved data security, compliance, greater efficiency for cybersecurity teams, and—critically—increased protection against data loss and business conduct violations while safeguarding the privacy of every Grupo Bimbo associate.

title: Brooke Action for Working Horses and Donkeys grows to help equines with the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: Brooke decided to move to the cloud to empower its globally dispersed teams and avoid replacing its end-of-life on-premise IT infrastructure. A shift to Microsoft Azure saved the nonprofit six figures and provided insights on future cost savings, too. By rolling out Microsoft 365, dispersed employees can access the tools and resources to support even more working equines around the world.

title: With Microsoft Azure, Terragon helps businesses leverage insights and target customers with the right messages at the right time
executive_summary: Terragon, a pioneer in Africa's MarTech sector, is redefining how businesses engage their customers. Using artificial intelligence and mountains of data, companies can send consumers the right messages at the right time with AI-powered insights. Picture this: a Bank customer engaging with their favorite app (game, news, entertainment, sports etc.) attempts to make an in-app payment; Registering the customer’s action the Bank (through Terragon’s software) is able to engage that customer and help them instantly facilitate a seamless payment process with the least amount of friction (by identifying that customer, using their phone number as their ID across platforms in the cloud) thereby adding value to the consumer’s experience. Terragon’s move to Microsoft Azure improved its security posture and turbocharged Terragon’s operations, slashing deployment times from about six weeks to just a week. After the move, the company could deliver notifications to end-users in half the time.
products: Azure, Azure Compute Gallery, Azure Functions, Azure Service Bus

title: NewDay reinvents its business model with new platform based on Azure Cosmos DB
executive_summary: NewDay revolutionized the credit industry in the UK by being an inclusive and responsible lender. NewDay realized that the financial marketplace had an appetite for technology that could power brands to directly engage with customers to provide credit. Enabled by Azure Cosmos DB and other Azure services, NewDay is providing tools and technology to support other companies’ building payment services and credit solutions.

title: Designers Resource connects sales, finance, and operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: Designers Resource Textile Pvt Ltd, an Indian home textile leader, addressed challenges in order fulfillment and remote work during the pandemic by adopting Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. This solution streamlined operations, connecting sales, finance, and operations seamlessly. General Manager Navin Sankhala attests to its value, citing improved management and streamlined operations. Results include a 15 percent operational cost reduction and a 20 percent sales increase.

title: STERNET brings visibility, collaboration, and speed with Dynamics 365 Sales
executive_summary: STERNET, a Polish distributor and factory service of electric drives and industrial automation, decided to modernize its customer relationship management (CRM) and take advantage of the cloud. It partnered with OneDynamics to implement Dynamics 365 Sales. For STERNET, it was crucial to identify a global-standard solution that would evolve alongside the company and serve as a wellspring of inspiration.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Field Service, Dynamics 365 Sales, Dynamics CRM, Microsoft 365, Power BI

title: CTT—Correios de Portugal migrates to Azure to be AI-ready and more secure
executive_summary: Even 500-year-old businesses can make room for innovation. CTT—Correios de Portugal realized its existing IT environment was not supporting its business effectively. Bottlenecks and delays prevented the company from meeting its needs during peak seasons, leaving it challenged to give its customers the best possible service.  CTT chose to migrate its critical workloads to Microsoft Azure, gaining AI readiness, 15% cost savings, security, and the flexibility to meet new challenges.
products: Azure, Azure Arc

title: B.TECH scales retail operations and slashes time-to-market by 30 percent with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: In the fast-paced world of retail, B.TECH isn't just keeping up; it's setting the pace. The Egyptian retail giant, specializing in household appliances and consumer electronics, has used its digital transformation arm b_labs to build a competitive advantage. With Microsoft Azure, B.TECH tackled scalability head-on and boosted service availability to 99.9 percent. Gone are the days of back-office panic during high-traffic periods like Black Friday. The retailer is now riding a wave of operational agility with a 30 percent cut in time-to-market. B.TECH has opened its doors to continuous improvement and innovation by embracing the cloud.

title: Akbank empowers staff to search through 10,000 records in seconds with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: Akbank, one of Türkiye's largest banks, has transformed its customer support operations using Azure OpenAI Service to improve employee and customer experience. Previously searching through answers in a 10,000-article knowledge base, Akbank staff now conversates with an AI chatbot. Generating correct answers 90 percent of the time, chatbot allows customer representatives to easily save up time, in time of need. This enhances quality and accuracy and helps customer support agents save three minutes in every interaction, freeing them up for more proactive service.

title: With Microsoft Teams Phone, 3,300+ stores of Migros Türkiye are more connected than ever
executive_summary: Migros Türkiye, a leading supermarket chain in Türkiye, revolutionized its frontline operations. The retail powerhouse introduced Microsoft Teams and Teams Phone to 6,300 users across all its locations. This move redefined store managers’ communication and training in over 3,300 stores. Migros Türkiye’s digital leap enhanced productivity, security, and visibility, realized 30% cost savings, and seamlessly connected different business units all geared towards providing an exceptional customer experience.

title: A dash of speed and agility: Tiryaki Agro transforms operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Tiryaki Agro, a leading agricultural products supply chain company worldwide, has been dedicated to providing healthy, reliable, and sustainable agricultural products since 1965. Confronted with the limitations of its legacy ERP system, Tiryaki Agro shifted to Dynamics 365 Finance and Supply Chain. This move enhanced system responsiveness and streamlined reporting, enabling Tiryaki Agro to speed up its operations. Today, generating 12-month financial reports takes 30 minutes instead of a full day. Tiryaki’s team can collaborate on the fly, rely on more transparent and holistic financial data, and cut infrastructure costs.

title: IFAD enhances food systems and agriculture opportunities in fragile rural communities with help from Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: With a global mission to eradicate poverty and hunger in some of the world’s most fragile rural communities in developing countries, IFAD (International Fund for Agricultural Development) works hand in hand with governments to fund projects and innovative practices that enable small-scale producers to develop sustainable agricultural practices, transform food systems, and build resilience in the face of some of the biggest global challenges. IFAD needed a better way for its global teams and partners to access and share critical information from and to the remote locations they work in. It wanted a solution that could support seamless configuration and security management, along with the equitable adoption of new tools. Using Microsoft Azure OpenAI Service, Azure AI Search, and Power BI, the organization built Omnidata, a centralized analytics platform that connects data, dashboards, visualizations, and analytics powered by machine learning and AI. The solution gives all personnel fast, direct access to critical data in every region IFAD serves, plus training in analytics and machine learning so they can actively create new tools to address specific day-to-day challenges.

title: Camfil harmonizes processes with Dynamics 365 to bolster sustainability and profitability
executive_summary: Camfil has helped people breathe cleaner air for more than half a century. As a leading manufacturer of premium clean air filtration solutions, with more than 30 production facilities and nearly 6,000 employees, the Sweden-based company provides commercial and industrial systems for air filtration and air pollution control in more than 35 countries. Camfil’s mission is to protect people, processes, and the environment by designing, developing, and delivering solutions that combine clean air with energy efficiency in a sustainable and profitable way.

title: Canopius enables data & AI innovation by building a strong foundation with Azure
executive_summary: Insurance business Canopius needed to upgrade its technical infrastructure. They chose to migrate away from dual datacentres to Microsoft Azure, leveraging native tooling, including Azure VMware Solution.

title: Standard Bank of South Africa expands use of Power Platform to enterprise applications
executive_summary: Standard Bank, the largest bank in Africa, has developed over 1,500 Power Platform solutions for a variety of business needs, including enterprise applications for finance, operations, and HR. A Center of Excellence supports over 1,500 citizen developers across the bank’s global network. The bank is also looking to leverage the generative AI capabilities in Microsoft Copilot Studio and other Power Platform products.

title: Hastings Direct migrates Guidewire and other applications to Azure VMware Solution, increasing performance by 1.6 times
executive_summary: Hastings Direct is an insurance company that presents 500,000 quotes a day to roughly 4 million customers for home and vehicle insurance. The company undertook an initiative to transition to a cloud-first, modern workplace and win more business. To improve its market share and deliver better, faster customer journeys, the company moved its workloads to Microsoft Azure VMware Solution. The company migrated one of its core applications, Guidewire, from their on-premises data center to run on Azure VMware Solution. By migrating Guidewire and their entire data center to Azure, Hastings Direct can take advantage of the scale, resilience, and innovation benefits that come with a modern infrastructure. Hastings Direct increased performance by 1.6 times and now handles adjustments 4 and 5 times faster. It has seen a continual reduction in major incidents and positioned itself to take advantage of cloud-native capabilities and innovation opportunities.

title: Legal & General increases safety, security, and business agility with Azure SQL DB
executive_summary: Founded in 1836, Legal & General is a leading financial services group and major global investor, with sustainable finance and a zero-carbon future at their core. The company promotes what they call “inclusive capitalism,” an aim to build a better society for the long term by investing customers’ money in things that make life better for everyone.

title: E.ON turns to Windows 365 to deliver a scalable, reliable, and modern cloud solution for flexible work
executive_summary: E.ON, one of Europe’s largest energy companies, boasts some 48 million international customers. As part of its drive to reduce on-premises infrastructure, E.ON chose Windows 365 to replace an existing on-premises virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) solution that was difficult to scale and costly to maintain. By introducing Windows 365, E.ON empowered more employees to work from anywhere. The business simplified management with Microsoft Intune and supports Windows 11 on all Cloud PCs for a harmonized environment. E.ON will also evaluate Windows 365 Frontline to extend Cloud PC offerings to its call center workers.

title: DMK reduces IT administrative effort by 50% and optimizes operations with ITProCloud Hydra for Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: With an annual turnover of 5.5 billion Euros, DMK Deutsches Milchkontor GmbH (DMK) is a leading player in the dairy industry and one of the largest suppliers to German food retailers. DMK wanted a comprehensive solution for managing Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop to allow the company to focus on its core business of processing milk products of the highest quality. DMK chose ITProCloud GmbH, a Microsoft partner with expertise in building and deploying solutions on Microsoft Azure such as ITProCloud’s Hydra management software for Azure Virtual Desktop. By deploying Hydra, DMK significantly reduced administrative efforts by 50 percent and Azure costs by 20 percent.
products: Azure Virtual Desktop

title: PayU GPO verifies customers faster with AU10TIX’s Azure-based solution
executive_summary: In financial services where milliseconds matter, PayU Global Payment Organization (GPO) took a decisive step to accelerate its customer onboarding. PayU provides payment solutions for over 450,000 merchants and counting. Hence, the need for a swift and error-proof identity verification workflow is high. That’s where AU10TIX came into play. The firm boosted PayU's Know-Your-Customer (KYC) process with its Microsoft Azure-based Identity Verification (IDV) solution. ID verification has been reduced to an average of six seconds, making the entire process more efficient and customer-friendly. The partnership also brought scalability, enabling PayU GPO to smoothly manage influxes of new customers in the most intense periods with Azure's flexible infrastructure.
products: Azure, Azure API Management, Azure App Service, Azure Compute Gallery, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Event Hubs, Azure Functions, Azure Monitor, Azure SQL Database, Azure Stream Analytics

title: Galp Energia: Keeping critical services secure using an xDR Platform with M365 E5
executive_summary: Portuguese energy company Galp is committed to powering the lives of thousands of people and businesses around the world. To do this, the company relies on a huge IT network that spans three continents and ten countries. Keeping such a set of critical services secure requires a comprehensive security platform specifically designed to protect it from cyberattacks. Today, this is made possible by a suite of Microsoft products (as part of a holistic platform) that are helping it to secure its operations while also fostering digital literacy across its network.
products: Azure, Azure Compute Gallery, Azure Virtual Desktop, Microsoft Defender XDR, Microsoft Purview

title: Serving customers 78% faster: VOCALLS’ voicebots supercharge call handing with Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: VOCALLS, a Prague and London-based pioneer, is reshaping customer service with its AI-powered voicebots. Relying on Microsoft Azure AI technologies, VOCALLS automates over 50 million interactions per year. Its happy customer, Estafeta, has seen myriad benefits: a 78% reduction in average handling time aside from a 120% increase in answered calls. Today, Estafeta’s customers receive immediate support instead of a 10-minute wait, leading to stellar customer satisfaction scores.

title: Steering sales: Otocash.com enhances customer segmentation and targeting with Azure
executive_summary: Discerning real customers from casual inquirers is no easy feat. Otocash.com, a platform for buying and selling of used cars in Türkiye, turned to Azure Machine Learning to achieve just that. Today, a machine algorithm is doing all the heavy lifting, segmenting customers and determining their likelihood of selling cars. As a result, the project boosted customer conversion rates by 20 percent and improved sales offer efficiency by 30 percent. On top of it, sharpened customer segmentation led to a 14-percent uptick in vehicle purchases.

title: Qatar Post processes thousands of documents daily and runs smoother postal services with Power Automate
executive_summary: Qatar Post has redefined postal services for the digital age, using Power Automate and Azure Cognitive Services to automate its processes. Partnering with SquareOne, an expert in robotic process automation, Qatar Post has automated the processing of more than 1,000 dispatch documents daily. It extended automation to retail services and even parcel sorting using autonomous mobile robots (AMR). Real-time service quality dashboards and automated reports help management keep track of operations. The impact is massive: heightened efficiency, increased accuracy, and saved valuable time for all employees.

title: SPAR ICS enhances shopping and optimizes supply chain with Cloud for Retail
executive_summary: SPAR ICS—the independent IT unit of SPAR Austria Group—aims to make shopping seamless and efficient for SPAR customers. Building on a years-long relationship with Microsoft, SPAR ICS recently used Cloud for Retail to create and release the scalable, manageable, and highly secure SPAR app to enhance the SPAR shopping experience. Performance has been excellent, even at times of peak demand. SPAR ICS also created an award-winning, AI-enabled demand forecasting system with Azure Synapse Analytics and is moving it to Microsoft Fabric. With the new system, SPAR Austria Group is optimizing its supply chain and achieving 90 percent inventory prediction accuracy.

title: MONETA Money Bank enhances customer care with NTT Czech Republic solution and Feedyou Platform, powered by Microsoft Azure AI
executive_summary: Is your credit card blocked? No worries; MONETA Money Bank’s voicebot, Tom, can take care of it in 96 seconds. MONETA Money Bank, a leader in the Czech Republic's banking sector, has revolutionized the way it interacts with its 1.5 million customers. Customer center MONETA Money Bank built by NTT Czech Republic uses an AI-driven voicebot, powered by Feedyou Platform and Microsoft Azure AI, to converse fluently in the complex Czech language, and can gather customer concerns and perform simple tasks like adjust card limits. As a result, the bank cut call center operational costs by 10 percent, while increasing customer satisfaction.

title: The Domino's Difference: Uniting more than 100,000 frontline workers with Microsoft Teams and Viva Engage
executive_summary: Collaboration is a team sport at Domino’s Pizza Enterprises Limited (DPE), the largest master franchisee for the United States Domino’s Pizza brand in the world. The company’s culture revolves around the motto “sell more pizza, have more fun,” translating into a dynamic employee experience that encourages hard work, boldness, and ambitious goals while emphasizing connection with colleagues and celebrating victories together.

title: University of Sharjah leaps ahead into AI-enhanced IT security with Microsoft Sentinel, Azure, and Defender for Cloud
executive_summary: UAE’s University of Sharjah is blazing the TechEd trail, keeping sensitive research projects, student records, and online classes highly secure while also saving on manpower and system downtime. In a game-changing cybersecurity move, the University transitioned from a cumbersome manual platform to Microsoft Sentinel. When correlated with Defender and Azure, it covered 70 percent of threat vectors overnight and automated 20 percent of security use cases within 48 manhours. With AI-driven defense against thousands of daily alerts, the University has swiftly moved from complexity to confidence, handling 80 percent of security operations with a standard system administrator.

title: Domino’s Pizza Enterprises slices identity by role for seamless, highly secure access with Microsoft Entra ID
executive_summary: Like its generously topped pizzas, Domino’s Pizza Enterprises Ltd. (DPE) manages an internal identity roster that features enormous diversity in role, variety, and sheer volume. As a global powerhouse with Franchisee Partners in Australia and New Zealand, Asia, and Europe, it must manage those identities across multiple international borders. In an initiative to simplify its IT landscape through consolidation and reduce costs, DPE replaced its previous identity management system, Okta, with Microsoft Entra ID. Just four months after deployment, team members experienced convenience like never before, and DPE cut licensing costs and raised IT team productivity. Most importantly, the company keeps morale high through its nontraditional inclusion of frontline workers in its corporate information workspace, Microsoft Viva. Now with Microsoft Entra ID, everyone is in the know with seamless and safer access.

title: TomTom brings AI-powered, talking cars to life with Azure
executive_summary: TomTom changed how drivers reached their destinations with its navigation solution and has recognized that today’s drivers want more than the best route. Therefore, TomTom created Digital Cockpit, an immersive in-car infotainment system. Automobile manufacturers can customize it to the look and feel of their brand, cutting costs by up to 80% with a more efficient, sustainable approach. TomTom is using Azure OpenAI Service, Azure Cosmos DB, and Azure Kubernetes Service for seamless control and conversations by the drivers.

title: E.ON democratizes data analytics for 12,000 employees, generates key reports in minutes instead of days
executive_summary: E.ON provides energy networks and infrastructure for 48 million customers across Europe. Helping power a continent is a big responsibility, and the company needs up-to-the-minute data to continue making the strategic decisions that keep the business at the forefront of the industry. As of the second half of 2023, nearly 12,000 enthusiastic E.ON employees use Power BI to propel decision-making, ushering in a new era of data democratization throughout E.ON. Those employees pair the data visualization tool with Microsoft Teams to support the nimble collaboration required to make smart, timely decisions.
products: Microsoft 365 Enterprise, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID, Power BI

title: Al Babtain Group enhances security, analytics, and productivity with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Al Babtain Group, a leading Kuwaiti conglomerate, ventured into a digital transformation. Their aim? To supercharge efficiency and spark innovation across their expansive array of sectors. With Microsoft 365 E5 and Azure, it elevated its security from rudimentary to robust, scoring an impressive 80 Microsoft Secure Score. With an integrated, scalable environment that includes Dynamics 365 and Power Platform, AI Babtain Group has streamlined workflows, empowered employees while enabling quick and informed decision-making.

title: RepsMate empowers businesses to create super agents by leveraging Azure's AI superpowers
executive_summary: Fresh on the Romanian startup scene, RepsMate is already making waves and attracting big names. Its goal is simple: to help customer service and sales agents better understand and serve their clients. How? With an Azure-powered AI assistant that provides answers to challenging questions that agents face. The technology has enabled customers to halve the size of the supervisory teams, enhance agent efficiency, and elevate customer satisfaction. A member of the Microsoft for Startups program, RepsMate has taken advantage of Microsoft’s networks, support, and guidance, as well as published its app on the Azure Marketplace, gaining unparalleled traction in Eastern Europe.

title: Hellenic Bank transforms market analysis using Power BI, offering business customers unmatched insights
executive_summary: Hellenic Bank, a leading Cypriot financial institution, has changed the way companies think about business intelligence. Where businesses used to rely only on in-house sales numbers, Hellenic Bank worked to provide a wider view. Using Power BI, the bank designed their Commercial Intelligence tool which gathers and analyzes card transaction data in an anonymized and aggregated manner.
