By digitally revamping its data architecture to align with evolving business requirements, it gained enhanced performance and analytics. As a result, the company saw a 15 percent increase in productivity and heightened customer trust.

title: Commercial Bank of Dubai: backing the ambitions of the UAE with Microsoft Azure and cloud innovation
executive_summary: "Supporting the backbone of the UAE economy requires scalability," said Thomas Cherian, CIO at the Commercial Bank of Dubai, an institution that has fueled the nation’s aspirations of sustainable prosperity for over half a century. With that in mind, it has migrated its critical systems to Microsoft Azure, used Microsoft 365 to improve internal collaboration, and adopted Dynamics 365 to deliver more personalized services. Its cloud-first approach has helped improve customer experience, build trust with enhanced security, and sustain remarkable growth in transaction volumes.

title: CitiusTech leverages Microsoft Teams for a more engaged and productive workforce
executive_summary: CitiusTech Healthcare Technology Private Limited (CitiusTech) provides a range of technology solutions and services to healthcare and life sciences companies, to help them navigate an increasingly digitally driven industry. It provides offerings across consulting, engineering, healthcare solutions, products, analytics, and AI, to enable organizations in the healthcare sector to reinvent themselves, deliver better outcomes, and have a positive impact on patients. The company partners with healthcare and life sciences organizations across the world, accelerating digital innovation and driving business transformation. Boasting an impressive track record of over 130 satisfied clients and more than 5,000 successful deployments, CitiusTech is at the forefront of powering the future of healthcare by facilitating the industry's digital transformation journey.

title: INPEX Migrates AVEVA PI System to Azure for Enhanced Data Analytics Promoting Sustainable Energy Development
executive_summary: INPEX, known for enabling sustainability for the energy industry, has migrated its IoT data management software, AVEVA™ PI System™, from on-premise servers to Microsoft Azure. The company's system operations have not only been streamlined with the move to a cloud-based IoT platform, but also allows a variety of possibilities. These include data visualization, business insights, and in-house app development through integration with Microsoft 365 E5. Azure is now empowering the company’s drive for its digital transformation strategy.
products: Azure, Azure ExpressRoute, Microsoft 365 E5, Power Automate, Power BI

title: Kotsovolos transforms operations, brings sustainability, and boosts efficiency in just six months with Azure-powered solution
executive_summary: Kotsovolos-Dixons South East Europe is one of the leading electrical and electronics retailers in Greece. Managing about 100 stores and an inventory of thousands of products per store, it has embarked on a digital transformation journey aimed at revolutionizing its operations. The company asked Microsoft partner Yodiwo to devise a dynamic digital replica of each store, operating in real time. Using Plano360, Yodiwo’s all-in-one retail optimization platform powered by Azure, Kotsovolos managed to increase the efficiency of its premises and operations, as well as the adherence to planograms. It has also enhanced collaboration and paved the way for future AI applications.

title: Quintet Private Bank drives trust and security across its customer base using Microsoft Sentinel and Microsoft 365 Defender (XDR)
executive_summary: As one of Europe’s leading wealth management institutions, Quintet Private Bank knows just how important data protection and cybersecurity are to establish trust amongst its customers. While devising a cloud strategy, the company saw an opportunity to build a future-proof SOC (Security Operations Center) powered by Microsoft Sentinel and Microsoft 365 Defender (XDR). Created in collaboration with partner NVISO and Microsoft, the platform has radically transformed the way Quintet approaches security – helping it to stay even more on top of its customers’ data and assets.

title: Breakthru’s microbreak app for Teams makes self-care a movement at NHS, organically reaching 85% of NHS Trusts
executive_summary: The National Health Service (NHS) in the United Kingdom is Europe's largest employer, with 1.6 million healthcare workers. Like many in the healthcare field, NHS had employees who avoided taking breaks – choosing to put patient care above their own wellbeing.
products: AppSource, Microsoft Teams

title: Efficient processes for a sustainable energy, heating, and mobility transition: SWM relies on Azure IoT, artificial intelligence, and big data analyses
executive_summary: Stadtwerke München (SWM), the municipal utilities company serving Munich, has made it its mission to drive every aspect of the city’s energy, heating, and mobility transition forward. Making this happen hinges on establishing smart connectivity for all areas of infrastructure. This is the only way to collect the relevant data in real time, make processes transparent, and harness real added value and optimization potential in a sustainable way. To this end, SWM relies on INSIGHT—a data-driven digital transformation solution it developed in-house and based on Microsoft Azure IoT, big data analyses in the Azure cloud, and artificial intelligence (AI).

title: Westpac transforms IT and enables secure, inclusive, flexible work with Windows 11 Enterprise and Autopatch
executive_summary: Westpac, one of the largest banks in Australia, wanted to improve support for its more than 40,000 people, including its hybrid workforce, by transforming its IT environment. In 2023, the bank chose a solution based on Windows 11 Enterprise E5 and Microsoft cloud services which has since improved user experience for staff and supported secure flexible work that is inclusive of all work styles.

title: GEMS Education optimizes financial and procurement operations across 120 entities with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: GEMS Education was established in 1959 in the United Arab Emirates to put a quality education within the reach of every learner. Today, GEMS Education is one of the world’s largest K-12 private education providers, striving to empower students in more than 60 schools in the MENA region alone via innovative curricula and learning strategies. As part of its objectives to enhance its capabilities, GEMS Education partnered with Microsoft Technology partner, InTWO, to move from Dynamics AX2012 to Dynamics 365 and enhance productivity. As a result, users have faster and easier access from anywhere and a secure environment for financial operations, procurement processes and collaboration with vendors.
products: Dynamics 365 Finance, Power Apps, Power Automate

title: RIA innovates its Bürokratt solution, in collaboration with Microsoft, to run on cloud services like Azure
executive_summary: The Information System Authority of Estonia (RIA) coordinates the development, safe implementation, and administration of the state IT infrastructure in Estonia. To make it easier for the country's citizens to access information and services from various government bodies, the organization developed an open-source communication assistant named Bürokratt that securely connects state institutions. Based on a jointly developed Distributed Message Rooms (DMR) solution, citizens will be able to access vital government services in a matter of seconds as opposed to days. And in the spirit of open government, the code base of Bürokratt Assistant and the DMR are available in GitHub to be used by governmental groups and partners who wish to replicate the solution.

title: Okinawa FG achieved DX & New Service Launch with Teams and Azure PaaS in just 4 months by in-house development and use of Low-Code.
executive_summary: Based in Okinawa, The Bank of Okinawa has been operating its banking business over the past half century. In 2021, its 10 group companies constituted Okinawa Financial Group, which is accelerating its initiatives for regional DX. They are intending to support regional business operators in resolving their issues by fully utilizing ideas, know-how incubated through internal DX promotion as well as various services. Okinawa Financial Group, which had been utilizing Microsoft products such as Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Surface for some time, established “Microsoft Base Naha” on the first floor of its head office in collaboration with Microsoft. Furthermore, they have been working on internal development of a new digital service “more series” intended for improving efficiency of in-house development and customer services. The more series is Japan’s first case in customer financial service that linked Microsoft Teams and Azure Communication Services. The combination of low-code development using Azure PaaS and no-code development utilizing Microsoft 365 allowed for quick development that took only four months. With respect to what effects the more series have created and how it would contribute to Okinawa region, we asked the background of the initiatives and future prospects.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Azure Communication Services, Microsoft 365, Bookings, Microsoft Teams, Power Automate

title: Hepsiburada teams up with Toloka and makes product search as easy as it gets with Azure-based solution
executive_summary: Envision the exhilaration of a shopper when their product search unlocks the perfect find – this is the realm of retail where Turkish Hepsiburada aimed for nothing short of excellence. To revolutionize its search capabilities for the millions of products available on its e-commerce platform, Turkish Hepsiburada teamed up with Serbian Toloka and developed a solution based on Microsoft Azure. The result was a 9-percent increase in search quality. Hepsiburada is now one of the leading Turkish e-commerce platforms.

title: GEMS Education optimizes financial and procurement operations across 120 entities with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: GEMS Education was established in 1959 in the United Arab Emirates to put a quality education within the reach of every learner. Today, GEMS Education is one of the world’s largest K-12 private education providers, striving to empower students in more than 60 schools in the MENA region alone via innovative curricula and learning strategies. As part of its objectives to enhance its capabilities, GEMS Education partnered with Microsoft Technology partner, InTWO, to move from Dynamics AX2012 to Dynamics 365 and enhance productivity. As a result, users have faster and easier access from anywhere and a secure environment for financial operations, procurement processes and collaboration with vendors.

title: Setting Sail for Smooth Journeys: How Setur's Azure Open AI Chatbot Transforms Travel
executive_summary: Buckle up for a travel revolution! Setur, the renowned Turkish tourism giant, is rewriting the rules of travel planning. With Microsoft Azure OpenAI, Setur has landed a new conversational chatbot that's changing the way we explore the world. By harnessing Microsoft Azure OpenAI, Setur has introduced a conversational chatbot that revolutionizes travel planning, offering unparalleled personalization. This innovative solution caters to Setur's 60,000 daily users, providing instant, customized responses in multiple languages, all powered by AI intelligence.
products: Azure, Azure Operator Call Protection

title: UiPath accelerates human achievement with Azure OpenAI Service
executive_summary: From automating unit testing for developers to streamlining copy-paste actions, UiPath constantly seeks innovation to ignite human potential through automation. The company has been a pioneer in AI-powered automation with products like Communications Mining as well as Document Understanding that auto-triages customer communications and prioritizes and routes underwriting requests. UiPath has helped increase transaction throughput by sevenfold and saved one insurance industry customer more than 90,000 hours through more efficient operations. UiPath and Microsoft are working together to take these results to the next level and revolutionize industries with the power of generative AI using Microsoft Azure OpenAI service.
products: Azure, Azure Operator Call Protection

title: Netstar achieves impeccable connectivity for its telematics with Azure solutions
executive_summary: Netstar is a leading provider of vehicle tracking and fleet management solutions in South Africa, Australia, and select African countries. With its legacy on-premises hardware struggling to keep up with day-to-day operations, the company migrated its workload to Microsoft Azure. Netstar partnered with NBConsult and Microsoft to ensure the process was seamless, with zero downtime for customers—despite migrating in its peak month. This move resulted in excellent connectivity and tighter security for Netstar's telematics, enhancing its service offerings.
products: Azure, Azure VMware Solution, Dynamics 365, Microsoft 365

title: Haleon connects employees with Microsoft Viva
executive_summary: Haleon is the result of the combination of three consumer health businesses, GSK, Novartis, and Pfizer, over the last decade. The tool set we inherited as part of the separation had limitations from a regulatory and compliance perspective to be available in China. We realized that actually we can use Viva Engage in China and we realized that it's a great opportunity to integrate the market into the ecosystem where we can collaborate further across the company. It just makes you feel like you're part of a bigger team all working towards the same goal, which is to deliver better everyday health with humanity.

title: Complex can be easy: NORMA Group manages international supply chains with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: NORMA Group serves 10,000 customers in 100 countries as a leading engineered joining technology solutions supplier from 27 production sites and numerous sales offices worldwide. NORMA clamps, connectors, and fluid systems can be found in nearly all well-known automotive and industrial companies. NORMA Group has grown organically, entering new markets and regions, and through acquisition. This resulted in a disparate process landscape with eleven different ERP systems within the Group.

title: Renewi deploys Elastic Observability on Microsoft Azure to optimize performance of business-critical applications
executive_summary: Renewi is a leading waste-to-product company that focuses on extracting value from waste rather than disposing of it. The company wanted to improve its operational efficiency, customer service, and environmental impact by using data and analytics more effectively. Renewi chose Elastic, a leading platform for search-powered solutions, to help it achieve its goals. Elastic’s solutions are supported and enhanced by Microsoft Azure, which provides a reliable, scalable, and secure cloud infrastructure for Elastic deployments. With Elastic on Azure, Renewi gained real-time insights into its waste streams, optimized its routes and processes, and reduced its carbon footprint.
products: Azure

title: Peel Region enhances productivity, collaboration, and security using Microsoft 365 and Security solutions
executive_summary: Peel Region went through a digital transformation that increased productivity while facilitating collaboration using Microsoft solutions. Peel Region depends on its employees to provide services to more than 1.5 million residents. Therefore, it wanted to improve experiences for both employees and residents by modernizing its technology. Employees were already using Microsoft 365 for various tasks, and the region realized that Microsoft 365, in addition to other Microsoft solutions, can make it easier for employees to collaborate remotely. Peel Region’s IT team also enhanced security, preventing 10,000 emails with viruses or malicious URLs over the course of 12 months.

title: Low-Code: a tool for employee commitment
executive_summary: Developing high-performance business applications with little code is the promise of "Low-Code", an approach that makes it easier for everyone to handle technology. Zoom in on IKEA France's approach, which relies on Power Platform technology to engage and develop its talents.

title: Securing consumers' rights: ANPC eliminates bureaucracy and boosts efficiency with Azure
executive_summary: In its commitment to empower consumers, Romania's National Authority for Consumer Protection (ANPC) embarked on a transformative journey to digitize its operations. Tasked with transitioning its workforce to paperless workflows, ANPC implemented the intuitive Azure-powered app, Regista. This innovative solution revamped document and workflow management, saving two work hours daily and up to US$4,000 annually while delivering enhanced services to consumers.
products: Azure

title: Cornwall Council uses Microsoft Dynamics in its contact centre to optimise the citizen experience
executive_summary: Cornwall Council has an ambitious digital strategy that includes creating a single view of the citizen. To achieve this, the council has chosen to build its digital platform for the future using a combination of Microsoft technologies, including Dynamics 365, Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Power Platform. Having used Dynamics 365 Customer Insights to assure the validity of a “golden record”, Cornwall Council has now deployed Dynamics 365 Customer Service in its contact centre to advance both the employee and citizen experience.

title: Windows 11 Pro gives a competitive advantage to an ancient craft
executive_summary: Hakutsuru Sake Brewing Co., Ltd. has been creating fine sakes in Kobe, Japan since 1743. When the company transitioned to flexible work styles, they needed a way to streamline security management across their 22 locations around the world. Secure-by-default Windows 11 Pro devices enabled their 500+ employees to outperform anywhere while freeing up their IT team to focus on strategic business initiatives.

title: Windows 11 Pro lets SUSI&James transform business communication
executive_summary: SUSI&James’ goal is to transform business communication with AI. Their voice assistant can interact with customers and take action in a remarkably human way, hence the term “digital employees.” The company deploys machine learning, natural language processing, and deep learning to handle a range of communication-heavy tasks—and not just within the confines of an office. While test-driving a vehicle, for example, the driver can speak naturally to an Al-powered co-driver while focusing on the road ahead. The co-driver records driving maneuvers, captures abnormalities, and logs test data in real time, all while increasing driver safety.

title: Windows 11 Pro lets the music play on
executive_summary: Based in New South Wales, TMRW Music Group is one of Australia’s leading independent music and entertainment groups, covering recordings, publishing, and live events in the field of electronic music. The company runs music events and festivals, manages venues, and books over 2,000 gigs a year. They represent major Australian electronic artists like PNAU, Fisher, and Hot Dub Time Machine, as well as some of the world’s leading music brands, including Ministry of Sound.

title: Discover why ING banks on Windows 365 to improve management and performance for a remote workforce
executive_summary: ING is a leading global bank empowering people to stay a step ahead in life and in business by bringing mobile-led digital experiences to customers worldwide. To optimize operations ING replaced their on-premises virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) with Windows 365 Cloud PCs to meet the needs of employees wherever they work. The bank can easily manage Cloud PCs with its existing IT team and reduce costs by eliminating 1,200 servers, helping to facilitate ING’s pathway to net zero carbon emissions. Windows 365 is fast and simple to deploy, and remote employees appreciate seamless access and remote collaboration. The solution is improving agility and providing the bank with a model for a worldwide, cloud-powered future.

title: Hokkoku Bank enhances customer service and transforms its business with the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: Hokkoku Bank has served communities within the Ishikawa Prefecture in Japan for eight decades establishing a reputation of trust and superior customer care. But with its critical systems and tools on-premises, the organization wanted to move its operations to the Microsoft Cloud. Working with Microsoft, Hokkoku Bank embarked on a digital transformation journey that included embracing innovations powered by Azure, Microsoft 365, and Teams across the organization. The changes are helping the bank open lines of communication across previously rigid roles, freeing employees to provide better customer experiences by making formerly siloed information more accessible.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365

title: Windows 11 Pro gives a competitive advantage to an ancient craft
executive_summary: Hakutsuru Sake Brewing Co., Ltd. has been creating fine sakes in Kobe, Japan since 1743. When the company transitioned to flexible work styles, they needed a way to streamline security management across their 22 locations around the world. Secure-by-default Windows 11 Pro devices enabled their 500+ employees to outperform anywhere while freeing up their IT team to focus on strategic business initiatives.

title: ​​Hokkoku Bank reimagines banking innovation, saves 10 percent on costs with Azure and the Microsoft Cloud​
executive_summary: Hokkoku Bank needed to modernize and keep pace with technological advances, but as a regional bank, its resources were limited. The bank laid the initial groundwork for modernization by moving its entire on-premises estate to Windows Server. This created a seamless path to full cloud transformation on Microsoft Azure. Currently, most of the bank’s operations run on Azure, and it plans to move to a fully cloud-based estate. By adopting a wide range of Azure solutions, Hokkoku Bank has been able to stay competitive, reduce infrastructure costs, and streamline processes for greater efficiency.

title: Windows 11 Pro powers Universe Power Systems
executive_summary: Founded by Jeyalakshmi Venkatanarayanan in 1997, Universe Power Systems sells all kinds of power-related products, from UPS systems to batteries, stabilizers to server racks, transformers to inverters. Based in Bengaluru, India, the company provides green power solutions to customers across various segments like IT, healthcare, and government. Their innovations include end-to-end power and automation solutions for data centers.

title: Windows 11 Pro lets HUG HUB bring insurance into the digital age
executive_summary: London-based HUG HUB wants to transform insurance into a self-service, customer-friendly platform. The company uses Windows 11 Pro devices along with cloud services to keep their employees productive and protected. Layers of built-in security enable their remote developers to build great software while keeping their sensitive customer data and source code secure.

title: Windows 11 Pro lets Calgary Sports focus on their fans
executive_summary: Founded in 1980, Calgary Sports and Entertainment Corporation is a professional sports and entertainment company based in Calgary, Alberta, Canada. The company owns and operates five franchises across hockey, football, and lacrosse: the NHL’s Calgary Flames, the WHL’s Calgary Hitmen, the NLL’s Calgary Roughnecks, the CFL’s Calgary Stampeders, and the AHL’s Calgary Wranglers. They also manage the Scotiabank Saddledome and McMahon Stadium; both venues attract large audiences for sporting events, concerts, and conventions.

title: Hilti empowers its diverse workforce with Workday for Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Hilti is a world leader in the design and manufacture of cutting-edge technologies, hardware, software, and services for the professional construction industry. With 32,000 employees in more than 120 countries, Hilti serves roughly 280,000 customer contacts each day developing products and solutions that drive productivity, safety, and sustainability in construction. With a diverse workforce spanning office-based, field-based, and operation environments, Hilti needed a solution to provide employees with a more simplified, flexible way to complete key tasks—no matter their location. Through the successful adoption of Workday for Microsoft Teams, employees can now quickly and easily request time off, share feedback, and check in and out without ever having to leave Teams. Not only does this save employees time, increase engagement, and improve productivity, but it also enables them to focus on their purpose of making construction better while delivering a better customer experience.

title: Brazilian court TRF1 transforms citizen service with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: With over 17,000 employees, The Federal Regional Court of the 1st Region (TRF1) makes up one of the largest courts in Brazil. Headquartered in Brasília, TRF1 has jurisdiction over the Federal District and 12 other Brazilian states. When the COVID-19 pandemic struck, ensuring Brazilian citizens had access to judicial services amid lockdowns and restrictions became critical. For TRF1, this meant a complete digital transformation and modernization of its internal systems, guaranteeing access, security, and privacy for citizens. In partnership with the Microsoft Brazil Customer Success Team, Studio 365 successfully supported the development and release of the TRF1 Virtual Support Desk, an online service platform for Microsoft Teams that provides safe virtual assistance to citizens. Since its launch in June 2021, the Virtual Support Desk has processed over 1.2 million citizen service requests and has been utilized by more than 3,000 service agents.

title: Mazda deploys Azure Virtual Desktop to realize a secure desktop environment and accelerate its digital transformation initiatives
executive_summary: The huge global wave of digital transformation (DX) is sweeping through the world of manufacturing, a pillar of Japanese industry. One automobile manufacturer in particular, Mazda Motor Corporation, has quickly caught onto this trend by promoting DX initiatives. Mazda has constructed a virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) based on Azure Virtual Desktop to create a system that allows the company to enable full digital utilization.

title: PLDT pioneers AI-powered customer care with WIZ.AI voice AI solution on Azure
executive_summary: The Philippines’ largest telecommunications provider PLDT became the first company in the telco industry to expand its existing suite of customer service channels with a voice artificial intelligence solution. PLDT deployed the Talkbot Pro, a product of Microsoft partner WIZ.AI, via a contract with PLDT’s ICT subsidiary, ePLDT, to assist the collections team in delivering hyper-personalized customer experiences. The solution resides securely on ePLDT’s Azure Stack Hub, which ensures data compliance and sovereignty. As a result, the company has had a boost in efficiency, increased collections revenue, and streamlined back-end operations.

title: PETRONAS drives quality decision-making with fast, easy access to intelligent data hub built on Azure
executive_summary: The dynamic Malaysian energy group, PETRONAS, has produced and delivered responsible and sustainable energy solutions globally since 1974. With more than 300 subsidiaries and operations in over 100 countries, PETRONAS has amassed an extensive wealth of data across its integrated value chain since its incorporation, making data a key business asset to drive strategic value. In 2020, PETRONAS embarked on its data transformation journey with the objective of making data available and accessible to everyone at the company through the Enterprise Data Hub (EDH), a unified enterprise platform supported by Microsoft Azure at the core. This platform has empowered employees with accelerated knowledge extraction and enabled enterprise analytics at scale, supporting PETRONAS’ ambition of becoming a data-driven organization.

title: Infosys powers digital transformation of sales with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Infosys embarked on a digital sales transformation journey to be a live enterprise with agility built into the core to stay ahead of the game. With the primary objective of transforming sales experience across the entire sales cycle, it identified specific interventions across every touch point where sales operate, from lead generation to order booking, by creating a data and insight-driven ecosystem.
products: Dynamics 365, Microsoft Teams, Outlook, Power Apps, Power BI

title: Carlsberg secures 25,000 devices globally with GYTPOL Validator hosted on Azure cloud
executive_summary: Founded in 1847, Carlsberg Group is one of the world's leading brewers. Yet, it faced challenges in managing its hybrid cybersecurity infrastructure. To create a more robust security posture, Carlsberg partnered with the Israeli company GYTPOL to deploy the GYTPOL Validator, which discovers and remedies device misconfigurations swiftly without disrupting business operations. As a result, Carlsberg has gained robust security and the peace of mind to continue pursuing innovation.

title: Celebrating innovation and diversity: Rodion Pedia gives every child a space to thrive with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: From its inception in 2003, Rodion Pedia has harnessed digital innovations to foster personalized and inclusive learning experiences for every child. Using Microsoft 365, teachers adapt teaching to the different needs of students: from cultivating sensitivity and solidarity between students, building knowledge and developing skills, to providing appropriate learning support for students with different learning readiness. The school has transformed the dynamic of learning, allowing students to expand their intellectual horizons, collaborate with their peers, and succeed inside and outside the classroom.

title: XContent lowers its customers’ cloud spend up to 32 percent with CloudMonitor
executive_summary: XContent Business Solutions is a trusted Microsoft Azure Cloud Service Provider, offering comprehensive solutions and technological innovations to address business challenges and foster growth. An evaluation of XContent’s cloud estate and those of its customers uncovered the need to understand and optimize resources to deliver unparalleled value to clients. By white labeling CloudMonitor as part of CloudSource, XContent achieved an all-encompassing perspective of the Azure framework, which in turn helped its customers to optimize their cloud spend, in some cases saving up to 32 percent.
products: Azure, Microsoft Teams, Power BI

title: Northvolt powers the energy revolution with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: N/A

title: HEINEKEN connects employees with information across the company using Azure AI services
executive_summary: HEINEKEN wants to explore the capabilities of AI across the organization in a way that builds on past experience and takes advantage of the latest developments. The company has begun using Azure OpenAI Service and its built-in ChatGPT capabilities to build chatbots for employees, while also using other Azure AI services to bring innovation to existing business processes. Employees are thrilled about the possibilities of AI and have been suggesting a wide variety of use cases. Heineken has begun developing some of them and plans to roll out more over time.
products: Azure AI and Machine Learning, Azure AI Document Intelligence, Azure AI Speech, Azure Operator Call Protection, Microsoft Teams, Power BI

title: Marlo Farma makes pet care and veterinary pharmaceuticals distribution a walk in the park with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: For three decades, Marlo Farma, Serbia's top distributor of pet food and veterinary pharmaceuticals, has been innovating and growing. But its previous ERP system struggled to keep pace, causing purchase inaccuracies and decreasing customer satisfaction. Working with Microsoft partner GoPro, Marlo Farma migrated to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. The result: a 30 percent rise in logistics and warehouse efficiency, real-time insights supporting decision-making, and most importantly, happier customers and healthier pets.

title: Barnsley Hospital improves patient and clinician experience with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Barnsley Hospital NHS Foundation Trust schedules more than 300,000 outpatient appointments per year, an increasing number of which are offered as video consultations. The video solution deployed at speed during the pandemic met an immediate need, but the Trust knew there was potential for improvement. It chose a new, integrated platform using Power Platform and Microsoft Teams for video consultations.

title: From “DX x Work Style Reform” to “DX x Data-Driven Management” - The current state of TIS’s “Internal DX” with Microsoft products.
executive_summary: TIS, part of the TIS INTEC Group, is developing its business into one of Japan’s IT leaders. As a business partner for over 3,000 companies in a wide variety of fields including finance, industry, government, and distribution services, the company delivers IT services to support their growth strategies. Today, is TIS leveraging industry knowledge and IT construction capabilities accumulated for over 50 years to support the DX (Digital Transformation) of society and companies, and is proactively developing its own DX as well.

title: From Vision to Reality: Expediting the Journey Towards 1 Million AEON Mobile App Members
executive_summary: AEON has become a popular department store in Hong Kong since its establishment in the city. In 2017, AEON embarked on its digital transformation journey with the launch of the AEON App and e-membership program. However, challenges remained in terms of functionality and user experience. To tackle these challenges, they utilized Microsoft Azure's scalability and security to revamp their app in 2022. As a result, they have experienced a significant 65% increase in their membership.
products: Azure Cloud Services, Azure Monitor

title: Aberdeen City Council helps more vulnerable people by taking a platform approach with Dynamics 365 Customer Service
executive_summary: Aberdeen City Council, a governmental organization with nearly 8,000 employees in northeastern Scotland, is dedicated to the mission of providing citizens with the social care and resources they need to live safe and fulfilling lives. But the Council faced roadblocks to providing Aberdeen residents with this care. Social workers had to gather information on vulnerable citizens through a variety of methods, and workers struggled to assemble a clear picture of the overall needs of citizens as well as plan future care. The Council rolled out Dynamics 365 Customer Service to unify how it collected data and to provide data transparency to all workers, leading to faster service, a better understanding of citizen needs, and more than two million pounds saved annually on manual data collection.

title: Sanofi uses the industrial metaverse to revolutionize training and operational efficiency
executive_summary: Sanofi is a leader in the development and manufacturing of both prescription and over-the-counter medications. To meet an increased demand for Sanofi pharmaceuticals, the Paris-based organization needed to find a way to make its production lines more streamlined while training and onboarding more operators. Sanofi launched a pilot project in it packaging workshop in Lisieux, France to work in the metaverse using Microsoft HoloLens 2 with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Guides and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Remote Assist. The aim was to streamline employee training procedures, enhance operator efficiency, and integrate a digital approach within the manufacturing environment. Using HoloLens 2, Sanofi has reduced training time for new operators from eight weeks to six weeks. The organization is also using HoloLens 2 for remote maintenance and troubleshooting, enabling quicker resolution of equipment issues. With the success of the pilot, Sanofi is looking to expand the solution across its value chain, with a specific emphasis on data analysis.

title: Rimac Group invents ground-breaking new technologies relying for security and productivity on Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Rimac Group, a Croatia-based company, “challenges convention and pushes technology to the edge of possibility” by developing and manufacturing hypercars and building new technologies for electric vehicles. As the company has grown from 600 employees in 2019 to more than 2,100 employees in 2023, the need for further enhancement of the Group’s security posture was identified. With help from its implementation partner Combis, it made its IT ecosystem more secure and efficient based on Microsoft 365 E5. The company has upgraded its detection and response capabilities and can now onboard new employees faster.

title: OMERS builds a data delivery platform in 20 percent of the typical time, unlocking self-service analytics using Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: OMERS Administration Corporation (OMERS) is a Canadian pension plan with 560,000 members and more than C$124 billion in net assets as of December 31, 2022. As an organization that regularly uses multiple apps, OMERS needed a unified solution that would bring together near-real-time insights from information stored across apps. A Fusion Team created an integrated cloud data and analytics solution with Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Power BI to implement a finance data strategy and reduce manual analysis. This solution now serves as a blueprint for scaling across the enterprise, supporting a finance transformation toward data-based decision-making at all levels in the organization.
products: Azure, Azure Synapse Analytics, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Purview, Power BI

title: An education and training tool that utilizes MR and digital twin technologies to improve engineer skills to ensure expressway safety
executive_summary: The expressway network of Japan has been constantly expanded since the 1960s and its total road length is currently over 10,000km. On the other hand, more than half of the expressway network has been used for over 30 years and aging of structures such as road surfaces, bridges, and tunnels has emerged as a social issue. The dwindling number of expressway maintenance and management engineers in line with the decline in the productive population is also one of the significant challenges.

title: PMC Hydraulics Group migrates to the cloud and transforms with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: PMC Hydraulics Group (PMC), with roots all the way back to 1957, is the leading Nordic provider of complete solutions in the PMC—Power, Motion, and Control—segment. The company designs, develops, builds, and markets everything from hydraulic components for lifting tables to complex, turnkey hydraulic systems for wind power and the offshore industry. The company has operations in Sweden, Finland, Denmark, Poland, Estonia, Latvia, China, and India, with sales around the world.

title: BSi modernizes delivery proof with KPoD digital signatures and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance, reducing errors by 80 percent
executive_summary: In the convoluted and competitive landscape of the steel distribution industry, BSi Steel, one of South Africa's leading steel distributors, faced a formidable obstacle in maintaining a precise and up-to-date record of truck deliveries to its valued customers. BSi's truck drivers relied on manual paperwork to obtain customer signatures, which served as proof of delivery. However, this outdated and inefficient process led to several challenges, including errors in data entry, time-consuming administrative tasks, and increased operational costs. To overcome these obstacles and enhance its delivery process, BSi Steel implemented KAISPE’s digital signature capture solution, KPoD, that works in tandem with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance. The result has been a streamlined delivery process, an 80 percent reduction in errors, and an overall improvement in the efficiency of BSi’s supply chain management system.

title: Employee register tool on Azure for lively inter-employee communication — Mitsui Fudosan’s approach shows best solution to PaaS utilization
executive_summary: As a comprehensive urban developer, Mitsui Fudosan engages in a wide range of real estate businesses such as offices, shopping malls, homes, logistics facilities, hotels, and resorts. It is also active in implementing digital transformation, with the Digital Transformation Division playing a key role not only in facilitating modernization of internal systems, but also in promoting business innovation in the areas of office buildings and commercial facilities, etc. by setting missions such as cloud promotion, system advancement, and BPR promotion. When the relocation of its Head Office in FY2019 happened, the company launched its efforts for the activation of inter-employee communications. The company adopted “FACEWALL,” an online employee register tool provided by RANA UNITED, and built a system using Azure PaaS services.

title: Confiz Catalyzes SJS International's Digital Transformation with D365 Finance and Operations
executive_summary: SJS International, an eminent player in the beauty industry since 1998, offers a diverse range of cosmetics, personal care, and lingerie products across the globe, including popular brands like Rivaj and RIOS. With a huge network of 20,000+ stores, 5+ e-commerce platforms, and 65+ distributions for famous brands, SJS International is determined to pursue growth. However, their legacy system posed challenges, affecting financial visibility and supply chain operations. To address these issues, SJS International partnered with Confiz and implemented D365 Finance and Operations, to unlock its full potential and drive growth.

title: Coles accelerates from monthly to weekly application deployments with Azure
executive_summary: To create an outstanding e-commerce experience that digitizes and modernizes shopping for customers on every channel, leading Australian supermarket brand Coles sought a partner to help streamline development processes and efficiently integrate updates and feedback. Whether customers are in-store, online, or engaged in a hybrid experience with their mobile app, Coles is committed to creating and delivering a consistently great experience, backed by data and insights. As they continue to expand their e-commerce capabilities, they leverage Microsoft solutions to empower their development and engineering teams.

title: Bond Brand Loyalty améliore les performances en toute sécurité, accélère l’intégration des clients de 20 % en utilisant Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Bond Brand Loyalty (Bond), a customer experience, loyalty, and growth firm, used Microsoft Azure to scale to more than 2 petabytes of transactions while maintaining security and privacy. The company, which operates programs with more than 100 million members, manages rewards programs by keeping track of points, rewards, and customer communications. To deliver seamless customer journeys, Bond processes billions of rows of data every day. The company recognized the need to strategically shift to the cloud and enhance its technology with Azure. Bond built a modern offering with Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Data Factory, and Azure Synapse Analytics. Now the company is scaling its business globally to serve thousands more customers.
products: Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Machine Learning

title: Nestlé innove dans ses stratégies de croissance grâce à Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Founded in Lausanne, Switzerland, in 1866, as the Anglo-Swiss Condensed Milk Company, today Nestlé is the world’s largest consumer packaged goods and retail multinational, employing more than 275,000 people. From originally providing milk and infant food products, the company now has more than 2,000 brands in 188 countries. Nestlé products include frozen and prepared foods, beverages, sweets, supplements, and pet foods.

title: Arthur D. Little maximizes human capital, scans complex documents in seconds with Azure AI services
executive_summary: Consultants at Arthur D. Little often work with complex, unsorted document formats, creating a large, unwieldy amount of unstructured data. The firm wanted to tap into technology to improve its search capabilities and unlock its collective intelligence. Using Microsoft Azure AI resources, the firm built a solution that combines natural language processing with content and contextual search, getting consultants fast access to the information they need. It does so while maintaining data confidentiality and maximizing human capital. The game-changing solution has already helped the firm’s consultants prepare for client meetings faster and curate content for presentations in 50 percent less time. Soon, the firm will further advance its value to clients by offering them its Azure AI–based knowledge management solution.

title: Meliá Hotels International creates a cohesive culture across properties with Microsoft Viva and Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Today, employees expect workplace technology that reflects the simplicity of the technology they use at home, including intuitive user interfaces and simple sign-on procedures. With Teams, Fuster and her colleagues saw a way to bring employees a modern technology experience at work, while still maintaining the strong security that is vital for a global business. Through Viva Connections, Meliá has reimagined how its employees receive information about the business and made it easier for all of them to find manuals, HR information, and other company resources.

title: Enhancing education: AUEB helps students compete in the job market with Microsoft Learn for Educators
executive_summary: With a rich history of over 100 years, Athens University of Economics and Business (AUEB) is the leading business school in Greece and one of the top universities in Southeast Europe. Its Department of Management Science and Technology (DMST) turned to Microsoft Learn for Educators to enhance its curriculum and offer proper training in today’s cutting-edge technologies and IT applications such as Microsoft Dynamics 365, Power BI, and Azure. These efforts enabled more than 80 percent of DMST/AUEB’s students to secure jobs before graduation, jumpstarting their professional development.
customer: Athens University of Economics and Business (AUEB)
products: Azure, Dynamics 365, Power BI

title: Mazars in Indonesia increases administrative efficiency by 20% and boosts compliance with Checklist and Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Mazars in Indonesia, an audit, tax, and advisory firm, faced the challenge of managing recurring tasks and strict deadlines in its accounting and tax services. To avoid penalties and customer dissatisfaction, it needed an integrated system to streamline workflows and track task progression in real time, while ensuring consistency and compliance across the organization. Checklist, a powerful tool designed to work within Microsoft Teams, provided the solution. With Checklist, Mazars achieved improved collaboration, streamlined communication, and enhanced task monitoring. The result was increased operational efficiency, reduced administrative effort and cost, and a surge in customer satisfaction.
products: Microsoft Teams

title: AXA chooses Azure to offer next-generation digital services and transform its customers' healthcare journey
executive_summary: To meet the ever-evolving customer expectations, AXA, one of the world's leading insurers, has leveraged the power of Azure technology and the expertise of Microsoft and Healthanea to develop value-added services that integrate digital and physical healthcare journeys, while offering patients proactive support, from the detection of their first symptoms through to their medical treatment. The result is a platform, which connects hospitals, pharmaceuticals, heath tech solutions, insurers and more to provide patients with improved and frictionless access to healthcare.
products: Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: Epiroc advances manufacturing innovation with Azure Machine Learning and Azure Data Factory
executive_summary: With its headquarters in Sweden, Epiroc is a leading manufacturer of rock excavation equipment. The company sources premium steel and then processes it at locations across the globe to produce drilling tools and equipment for the mining and construction industries. Epiroc also provides round-the-clock equipment service and technical expertise for its customers. Epiroc wanted to improve and automate complex processes at its manufacturing locations worldwide to ensure consistent quality of the steel used in its products. With the help of Microsoft, Epiroc created an ESML AI Factory on Microsoft Azure. The company was able to get it up and running within 60 hours. The scalable solution gave Epiroc’s manufacturing teams across the globe the ability to share data, best practices, and create consistent, repeatable processes to ensure the highest quality steel—and equipment—while increasing efficiencies and reducing waste.

title: Aker BP transforms its data and operations with Microsoft Azure Data Manager for Energy
executive_summary: One of the largest independent energy companies in Europe, Aker BP is engaged in the exploration, field development, and production of oil and gas on the Norwegian continental shelf. As an energy industry leader, the company places operational excellence at the core of all its endeavors, recognizing that a robust operational framework lays the foundation for growth and empowers employees to do their best work. To improve processes and develop digital tools, Aker BP chose to work with Microsoft to reach the full potential of its data to meet its operational excellence goals, facilitate informed decision-making, and experience transformative impact. In harnessing the power of Azure Data Manager for Energy to analyze vast amounts of energy-related datasets, applications, and cloud services, Aker BP will gain valuable business insights to increase operational efficiency and reduce data evaluation time.

title: A look at Proterial's data governance—building a data analytics platform with Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI
executive_summary: Proterial, Ltd. began reforming its business operations through a digital transformation (DX) initiative in FY2021. As part of this initiative, the company launched a project in August 2021 to establish a data lake platform to enable the visualization of management information by consolidating business data scattered across the company, while promoting the development of data governance. Microsoft's data analytics solutions, including Azure Synapse Analytics and Microsoft Power BI, were selected to help realize the data lake concept.

title: Thanks to Microsoft Azure, Alstom can provide its customers with high-performance, secure and scalable digital services
executive_summary: In a world where the decarbonization of industries is at the heart of public policy, the development of ever more sustainable means of transportation appears to be one of the key responses to this major challenge. Provided we make it attractive and we continually reduce the energy consumption associated with its activity, which is inherently more sustainable.
products: Azure API Management, Azure Application Gateway, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Brabant Water delivers refreshing improvements with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Brabant Water, established in 2002 from the merger of two smaller water utility companies, has a reputation for excellent water quality and reliability of service. One of 10 water utility companies in the Netherlands, the company provides drinking water to 2.6 million people in the province of North Brabant. The company is responsible for collecting water from natural sources, guarding its safety, building and maintenance of networks, and installation of meters, valves etc. to homes and businesses in its municipality.

title: Quality knows no limits: FRÄNKISCHE Industrial Pipes automates pipe production processes with Azure IoT
executive_summary: More and more, industrial companies expect their suppliers to provide a window into production. Gathering and sharing real-time information is becoming a standard part of requests for quotations and thus a success factor for suppliers. The answer lies in connected factories. One company showing how this works is FRÄNKISCHE Industrial Pipes. This SME makes pipes, accessories, and system components for the construction, civil engineering, automotive, and manufacturing industries. And it is investing in connected production with the help of Azure IoT. During production, FRÄNKISCHE Industrial Pipes continuously collects data on which machines, tools, or even workstations have processed a particular raw material or component—including quality assurance purposes. This has led to quicker detection of production errors and a further leap in quality.

title: AGMC introduces Azure-powered Pulses.ai solution to locate cars in seconds
executive_summary: AGMC, the exclusive BMW Group importer for Dubai, Sharjah, and the Northern Emirates has hundreds of cars coming in and out of their facilities on a daily basis. The company faced the challenge of efficiently locating and moving vehicles at its largest service center. Together with Pulses.ai, AGMC created the Sphere 360 solution—an artificial intelligence-driven recognition solution built on Microsoft Azure. It has since transformed its logistics and operations. Today employees are no longer wasting time looking for cars, and customers are happier because of the reduced waiting times.

title: Public sector efficiency: Ashghal reaches more people with Microsoft Teams Phone
executive_summary: Serving as the bedrock of Qatar's infrastructure growth, the Public Works Authority, Ashghal, is at the heart of the nation's infrastructural development. To facilitate smoother collaborations and conduct meetings online at convenience, Ashghal transitioned to Microsoft Teams Phone. This maintained critical operations during the COVID-19 pandemic. By centralizing and organizing key documents, projects, and conversations, the solution has also enabled Ashghal to streamline workflows and accommodate 3x more meeting attendees.

title: Panasonic Connect Adopts Azure and GitHub to Transform to a Cloud-Native Development Culture
executive_summary: With the purpose to “Change Work, Advance Society, Connect to Tomorrow,” Panasonic Connect Co., Ltd., a company engaging in a wide range of businesses from supply chain management to entertainment, takes on the challenge to transform the development culture. Being a traditional Japanese large company with approx. 28,500 employees, Panasonic Connect inherits the philosophy of the founder, late Konosuke Matsushita, and the effects of business division system. Following Panasonic Connect’s acquisition of Blue Yonder, significant difference in development cultures between the two companies brought a “sense of danger.” To overcome the differences, they decided to pursue a cloud-native development culture. As a platform and tool for change, Panasonic Connect adopted Microsoft Azure and GitHub. This article describes how Panasonic Connect has worked on the transformation of its development culture.

title: The Northern Alberta Institute of Technology modernizes PeopleSoft in Microsoft Azure, improving resiliency and performance
executive_summary: The Northern Alberta Institute of Technology (NAIT) is a polytechnic institute in Alberta, Canada. In late 2019, it decided to modernize its Oracle PeopleSoft business application suite to improve the user experience and reduce system outages at peak times. The institute had previously moved its public website to Microsoft Azure, and its IT team brought in Microsoft to migrate PeopleSoft to the cloud. NAIT moved from a feasibility study to full deployment in about 18 months, reducing downtime and freeing IT personnel to work on strategic business goals. The migration transformed the dynamic between senior leadership and the IT team, as both could now focus on enhancing the higher education experience through technological innovation.

title: Orca Security combines the power of GPT-4 with the security and reliability of Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Agentless cloud security pioneer Orca Security has always sought to provide exceptional service to hundreds of enterprises worldwide. It was the first security provider to integrate OpenAI’s GPT API into its solution, enabling customers to quickly respond to security alerts with AI-generated instructions. This brought about the challenge of ensuring data privacy and compliance. Orca Security bridged this gap with Azure OpenAI Service, securing customer data, guaranteeing a 99.9 percent uptime and full regulatory compliance, and backed by Microsoft's strong support.
products: Azure, Azure Operator Call Protection

title: memoQ streamlines global translation services with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Efficiency, scalability, and high accuracy differentiate memoQ’s translation management software from others in the market. However, the company faced scalability challenges with its rented physical server setup, leading to inefficiencies in deployment and infrastructure management. memoQ’s solution? Shifting to Microsoft Azure. Now, automated deployments and secure, compliant data management are the new norms. Using Azure not only fortified memoQ’s localization software but also brought about operational efficiencies, enabling the company to build customer loyalty and boost recurring revenues.
products: Azure, Azure AI Services, Exchange Server, Microsoft Entra ID, Power BI, SQL Server, SharePoint, Visual Studio

title: Eurowag achieves instant access to actionable data with Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: With a vision to streamline the road transportation industry, Eurowag, a leading force in the sector for more than 25 years across Europe, found its challenge in data centralization. The company’s existing on-premises solution was no longer adequate to meet its needs for more growth and business acquisitions. It looked for an agile, scalable product, which the company found in Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics. The solution delivered in real-time analytics, giving Eurowag faster, more reliable access to crucial data, enabling proactive decision-making and a shift in perspectives.
products: Azure Stream Analytics, Azure Synapse Analytics

title: ABN AMRO Bank optimizes financial crime detection with Azure Data Explorer
executive_summary: "Banking for better, for generations to come"—this mission drives ABN AMRO Bank, a Netherlands-based financial institution committed to vigilance against financial crime. With financial crime on the rise, the bank realized that it needed a new approach to handle its vast transactional data. Embracing technology, it employed Microsoft's Power BI and Azure Synapse Analytics to increase efficiency. The major improvement, however, came with the bank’s use of Azure Data Explorer (ADX). With ADX, ABN AMRO revamped its due diligence process by increasing its speed in and capacity for handling billions of transactions.

title: British Columbia’s Provincial Health Services Authority improves healthcare through better data access, insights with Azure
executive_summary: When Provincial Health Services Authority (PHSA) began seeing the need to deliver faster, more comprehensive health insights to healthcare workers across British Columbia, it took action. Old, unstandardized requests were slowing data analysis and the sharing of insights. To standardize and speed data access, PHSA moved its healthcare analytics platform to Microsoft Azure, creating a readily accessible data analysis platform that is scalable and secure. Data requests that once took many months now take only days. Because of the sensitive nature of health data, PHSA has worked closely with Microsoft to make sure health data never leaves Canada and is kept highly secure.
products: Azure, Microsoft Purview, Power BI, SharePoint

title: Tecnicas Reunidas cuts costs and builds a highly secure digital energy future with Azure Arc
executive_summary: Global engineering and energy innovator Tecnicas Reunidas needed to improve its security posture and increase efficiencies across its expanding footprint of both on-premises and cloud environments. The company adopted Microsoft Azure Arc, along with Microsoft Security solutions, to help its IT team to unify its deployments and establish central control over the company’s hybrid infrastructure and apps. Tecnicas Reunidas enhanced its security posture while saving costs, gaining data analytics, and forging new paths for innovation and efficiency as part of its efforts to achieve net zero carbon emissions.
products: Azure, Azure Arc, Azure Logic Apps, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Sentinel, SQL Server, System Center

title: Virtual inspections optimize carbon footprint: Siemens Energy uses Microsoft Teams to simplify acceptance testing for its energy solutions
executive_summary: In 1867, Werner von Siemens discovered the dynamo-electric principle, setting things in motion that would make Siemens Energy one of the world’s most important suppliers of energy solutions. One-sixth of global power production is based on this company’s technology. In the past, Siemens Energy customers would travel thousands of kilometers to inspect and approve the solutions they ordered before initiating the complex process of shipping them. Today, Siemens Energy uses Microsoft Teams and HoloLens 2 to create virtual test beds that make these long journeys superfluous. This saves money and reduces the carbon footprint of the company and its customers.

title: With Azure AI, TIM is a pioneer in the implementation of a synthesized voice service to increase customer satisfaction and retention
executive_summary: TAIS, the company's virtual assistant, is supported by Azure and is able to meet the needs of TIM’s customers with the ability to change the speed and intonation of its voice, as well as speak in 140 different languages. Through its pioneering actions, TIM modernized its telephone answering service, reduced costs, and was able to get closer to its mission of becoming the mobile carrier most beloved by customers.

title: SA Power Networks makes rooftop solar smarter
executive_summary: SA Power Networks has invested to provide increased network hosting capacity for rooftop solar. A significant share of renewables on its electricity distribution network comes from excess solar energy exported into the power grid from customers’ rooftop solar panels. To dynamically manage the volume of exports, in addition to avoiding waste or damage to the system at peak generation times, the utility developed the Flexible Exports solution, using Azure IoT for monitoring. In a trial of Flexible Exports, the average customer more than doubled their exported energy. Data collected over the internet from participant households also provides the utility with better network visibility at street level to help improve performance and safety.
products: Azure, Azure IoT Hub

title: Teams and AI chatbots work together to create a streamlined digital helpdesk by leveraging query data
executive_summary: The adoption of "chatbots" that can automatically respond to user queries is accelerating across all businesses. While operational efficiencies and cost reductions are expected, the true value of this tool goes beyond that. The Business Support Department of the Business Innovation Division at Nippon Telegraph and Telephone East Corporation (NTT East) began business processes to improve the quality of human responses and share knowledge by integrating Microsoft Teams and AI chatbots. The company is taking the first step toward an effective digital experience by digitizing the familiar help desk response.
customer: 東日本電信電話株式会社 (NIPPON TELEGRAPH AND TELEPHONE EAST CORPORATION)
products: Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Teams Phone

title: Hilo helps Quebecers optimize energy use by predicting demand at peak times with Azure Data Explorer
executive_summary: Hilo is a Quebecois smart building initiative to optimize energy consumption during peak demand periods. At its core lies a solution that collects millions of data points from hundreds of thousands of IoT devices every minute to help customers reduce power demand and save costs on electricity bills. The collected big data streams into Azure Data Explorer (ADX) service, where it is analyzed and visualized on custom dashboards. They provide real-time insights into energy levels and trends, allowing Hilo to realize its mission at any scale reliably, and at a fraction of the cost compared to the previous analytical service.

title: Fifty thousand nature shots in two days: The Bavarian Forest National Park is simplifying its wildlife monitoring with Microsoft Azure and AI
executive_summary: It’s a picture of biodiversity: 14,000 species living on more than 25,000 hectares. To safeguard this diversity for the future, camera traps are used to continuously monitor wildlife populations in the Bavarian Forest National Park, central Europe’s oldest and largest forest preserve. The traps capture some 1,000 images a day of anything that moves, such as animals and plants. The images are then analyzed and categorized for research purposes and population surveys. Previously a very time-consuming task involving manual sorting, the same volume of data can now be processed in just two days—thanks to MegaDetector, Microsoft Azure, and automatic categorization by artificial intelligence. As a result, insights are gained faster, paving the way for even more species conservation.

title: ComAp drives global collaboration and innovation for improved sustainability with the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: ComAp is a world leader in intelligent control solutions for decentralized energy resources. The company has been supplying power-management solutions to end-customers like banks, hospitals, commercial complexes, and datacenters for more than 30 years. With more than 500 employees spread across 13 global locations and a network of more than 70 distributors, Czech Republic–based ComAp supplies energy control systems to customers worldwide.
products: Azure, Azure API Management, Azure Machine Learning, Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Finance, Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Microsoft Entra ID, SharePoint

title: Herbelin leverages data collected by Dynamics 365 Business Central to deliver world-class watches
executive_summary: The jewel of French craftsmanship, the company bets on data and the Business Central, Power BI, and Power Apps tools to boost its sales and rationalize its production chain. It has a clear objective: to achieve an increase in revenue of at least 15 percent in the coming years.
products: Dynamics 365 Business Central, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Power BI

title: DealHub revolutionizes global sales engagement with Microsoft-powered CPQ
executive_summary: DealHub provides an all-in-one solution for managing companies' sales engagement touchpoints worldwide. Its cutting-edge configure, price, quote (CPQ) solution is powered by Microsoft Azure as the hosting service and operates within Microsoft Dynamics 365 for an intuitive user experience. By making the Microsoft-powered platform available on Azure Marketplace, DealHub offers businesses a comprehensive, easy-to-use solution that addresses multiple needs throughout the sales process while elevating digital customer experiences.
products: Azure, Azure Marketplace, Dynamics 365 Sales

title: SA Power Networks reduces datacenter footprint by around 30 percent with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: SA Power Networks understands the urgency of preparing for the future. As the key distributor of electricity to most of South Australia and its population of 1.7 million people, the company builds, operates, and maintains the crucial distribution network. And it takes that responsibility seriously. Not only does SA Power Networks deliver power dependably, but it also aims to deliver power safely and sustainably while supporting the shift to a net–100 percent renewable energy system. To support the seismic shift happening in the energy sector, from fossil-fueled power to renewables like rooftop solar, the company needed to rebuild its digital infrastructure. SA Power Networks required agility, scale, and data integration capabilities to complement and drive the innovation of its power distribution strategy, and it found what it needed in SAP on Microsoft Azure.

title: Générale pour l’Enfant leverages Power Apps and new technologies for its business applications
executive_summary: Since 1987, the Générale Pour l’Enfant group’s objective has remained the same: to imagine and design children and toddlers’ clothing that is comfortable, playful, and high-quality. This ambitious approach shared by all employees makes this family-based business a major player in children's fashion through its three flagship brands: Sergent Major, Du Pareil Au Même, and Natalys.
products: Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI

title: Sage improves retention 30% with employee listening powered by Viva Glint and Viva Insights
executive_summary: Sharon Oley, Customer Services Director at Sage, oversees 500 colleagues who maintain the great customer support that the payroll, HR, and finance software provider has become known for. “We’re very focused on giving the customer great access and a great experience,” she says. Key to that standout customer experience is a frontline workforce of engaged employees who buy into Sage’s people-focused, supportive workplace culture. For a global business operating in a hybrid world, however, keeping a finger on the pulse of organizational culture can be a challenge. “We use Microsoft Viva Glint and Viva Insights to gain real-time insights into how employees are feeling and workplace behaviors,” says Oley. “We understand the importance of listening to employees.”
products: Microsoft Viva, Microsoft Viva Glint, Microsoft Viva Insights

title: Unbanked no more: CWallet empowers migrant workers to access financial services with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: For migrant workers in Qatar, accessing financial services can be hugely challenging. That’s where CWallet comes in—”We want to foster inclusivity and bring full financial services to an underserved community and to microbusinesses,” shares Co-founder and CEO of CWallet Michael Javier. With Microsoft Azure, the company has built a secure fintech platform that is trusted among its customers and set up for strong business continuity.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure DDoS Protection, Azure Firewall, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Modernizing the public sector: EKOME adopts the cloud for effective and secure work with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: From introducing investment incentives to improving media literacy, the National Centre of Audiovisual Media and Communication (EKOME) is a hub of Greece's audiovisual industry. Aspiring to champion the country’s digital transformation strategy, the institution turned to the General Secretariat of Information Systems for Public Administration (GSIS) to adopt Microsoft 365 E3. As a result, it has enabled staff mobility, and saved almost 10 hours weekly on administrative tasks. Its cloud strategy has also placed it in the world’s 10 percent most cyber-secure companies in the sector.

title: SGS rides the headwinds of green energy with Azure IoT solution that optimizes wind turbine capacity
executive_summary: SGS, a leading global testing, inspection, and certification (TIC) company, has created a competitive advantage for itself in the burgeoning green energy market in China. Combining its expertise in TIC with Microsoft Azure cloud services, SGS developed an intelligent device for wind turbines that uses Azure IoT Edge and IoT Hub to deliver continual, real-time oil condition data for wind farm operators. With OCM-Online®, SGS customers gain predictive analysis of their expensive assets’ condition, reducing the risk of unplanned downtime and costly interruptions to wind energy generation. And SGS has a new, extensible service offered on a subscription basis to boost cash flow that’s applicable to other industries with similar application scenarios. With OCM-Online®, green energy development is part of the winds of change at SGS.

title: Aurobay rebuilds its entire IT environment in less than two years with Azure
executive_summary: After splitting from its parent company, powertrain solution supplier Aurobay had to rebuild its entire IT environment. It needed to keep some on-premises workloads and applications, but it still wanted to modernize and be cloud native where possible. The company adopted a hybrid cloud strategy using Microsoft Azure and solutions like Microsoft Entra ID, Azure Arc, and Intune to streamline and enhance management of its infrastructure and empower application teams to run cost efficiently on their own. With more than 70 percent of its deployment complete in a year and a half, Aurobay can set up new applications and put in group policies much faster than on-premises while expanding to include Azure AI services and Azure Machine Learning.

title: Transforming Nan Fung Property Management’s Waste Disposal Patterns into Sustainable Strategies
executive_summary: A pioneering force in Hong Kong's community development for over four decades, Nan Fung Property Management (NFPM) focuses on delivering exceptional property and facility management, and upkeeps services to uplift the quality of residential, recreational, and work environments across over 80 managed properties. Lately, it has placed a greater emphasis on improving its Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) performance in light of new government policies such as the waste charging scheme, which may take effect in 2024. With stakeholders demanding transparency and accountability more than ever, NFPM realized the criticality of having accurate ESG reporting capabilities to reinforce its ESG commitment. Amid new ESG expectations, innovation and technology are now keys to accelerate sustainability goals, and NFPM understood the needs to quickly rearchitect its value chain to keep up with the changing times.
products: Azure SQL Database, Power BI Embedded

title: Dialog Information Technology builds a better backup strategy with Azure and Metallic
executive_summary: When Dialog Information Technology, one of Australia’s leading technology services companies, wanted to decommission its physical offices and lay the foundation for moving its on-premises datacenters to the cloud, it chose to build an enhanced business continuity and disaster recovery strategy around Microsoft Azure. It’s now managing backups of its expansive Microsoft 365 environment using Metallic, a Commvault data protection solution built on Azure. Not needing to build and manage its own dedicated backup infrastructure has led to cost and time savings like 95 percent faster Microsoft 365 backups, an AUD20,000 reduction in annual licensing costs, and AUD50,000 less in upfront costs with Metallic. It’s also given Dialog an opportunity to grow its business and envision a seamless and highly securely future in the cloud.
products: Microsoft 365, Planner, Microsoft Teams, Power BI, SharePoint

title: Hamad Medical Corporation uses Microsoft Sentinel as part of its commitment to patient safety
executive_summary: Hamad Medical Corporation (HMC) is the leading healthcare provider in Qatar. It was looking for a security information and event management (SIEM) solution. “Our vision was to deliver security without compromising access and usability. We also wanted to ensure patient and corporate confidentiality at all times,” says Richard Storey, Executive Director/ Acting Chief of Health Information and Communication Technology at HMC. With Microsoft Sentinel, HMC gained 360-degree, real-time visibility over cybersecurity, making proactive responses faster for supporting staff to access information.
products: Microsoft Sentinel

title: The Caribbean Development Bank built a new platform uniting their client processes in a secure and modern way with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: With the support of Microsoft Partner COREFIN and their solution for Lending and Banking, the CDB faced a digital transformation demanded by a broad strategic decision. With a full Microsoft stack, the Bank was able to fully automate processes, reduce costs, have a fully integrated platform, and perform real time data analysis.

title: Supply chain insights with just one click: ALTANA pools knowledge in graph database built on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Knowledge transfer is essential for the success of a company—not only when experienced employees are retiring and it’s necessary to preserve and pass on their many years of expertise. Chemical company ALTANA started early on to consolidate the knowledge of its purchasing department in a central location. To do this, the company is relying on a graph database, Microsoft Azure, and PRODYNA, a member of the Microsoft Partner Network. The EMPOWER platform solution not only minimizes time and effort, increases performance, and enables price predictions with a deviation of only 5 percent, it also brings more transparency to sustainability data in the supply chains.

title: Bank Credit Dnipro secures banking services for customers with Microsoft Azure amidst instability
executive_summary: Founded in 1993, Bank Credit Dnipro (BCD) is a leading Ukrainian financial institution committed to anticipating and answering the needs of tomorrow. When Ukraine faced external conflict in 2022, BCD rushed to preserve its infrastructure and banking services for customers. With the support of Microsoft and partner Kyivstar, the bank embarked on a rapid digital transformation powered by Microsoft Azure. The solution has enabled secure card processing for 65,000 cardholders and stable remote working possibilities. BCD now operates with a robust failover mechanism, bolstering financial security and ensuring business continuity.
products: Azure, Azure Site Recovery

title: 10x efficiency: Atera enables better IT management with its AI-powered IT Platform
executive_summary: "Empowering IT professionals to reach 10x IT efficiency" is the vision of Atera, a software company based in Tel Aviv, Israel. Its AI-powered IT Platform with Azure OpenAI Service integration provides an all-encompassing view of IT activities, proactively identifying issues and offering immediate solutions. The AI engine also allows end users to troubleshoot and auto-resolve tickets without IT intervention. With this, IT professionals can focus on critical tasks, reducing the first response time to zero and enhancing IT teams' capacity exponentially. Atera's AI-powered IT Platform isn’t just a product, it is a gamechanger for IT management worldwide.
