title: Sustainable juice ingredients: Eckes-Granini creates more transparency in their supply chain with Azure and Power BI
executive_summary: Eckes-Granini is Europe’s largest producer of name-brand fruit juices and owner of well-known ranges such as hohes C and granini. The company has set itself an ambitious task: to ensure that by 2030, all the raw ingredients for its juices are sourced sustainably. Making this goal achievable meant bringing transparency to supply chains with a view to visualizing the various players involved. Quite a challenge for the procurement team. The solution was to create a Data-Warehouse based on Azure and use Power BI to create precise visualizations of supplier data. As a result of this transparency, almost 70 percent of all juice ingredients now meet sustainability standards. This methodology will also answer most of the questions that might arise from the Supply Chain Due Diligence Act.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Database, Intelligent Data Platform, Power BI

title: Sportisimo accelerates international growth with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Sportisimo, the leader among Czech sporting goods retailers, is expanding the number of customers within and beyond its national borders. In the past, opening a new branch abroad involved complex integration and alignment of disjointed software systems. Adopting Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance has cleared the way for a smooth expansion into other markets. With simplified technology stack, Sportisimo now needs only three to four months to expand to a new country from an ERP perspective, down from 14 months before.

title: King Steel powers the global shoe industry’s green transformation with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Taiwanese shoe equipment manufacturer King Steel faced growing customer demands for sustainable and recyclable shoe products from global brands like Nike and Adidas. That’s when CEO Jim Chen started to take the company on a path towards a "transparent supply chain" model, enabling greener practices through leveraging Microsoft's Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability services. These tools enabled seamless digital transition and data collection, fostering innovation and efficiency within the organization. With Dynamics 365 Business Central and Power Platform, employees created applications that accelerated business processes, allowing for a green transformation that both enhanced King Steel's sustainability performance, and also improved operational efficiencies and customer relations.

title: Live Tech Games massively scales its gaming platform with Microsoft Azure during the FIFA World Cup
executive_summary: Live Tech Games is on a mission to create unique, massively multiplayer mobile gaming experiences that people genuinely want to be a part of. To achieve this, Live Tech Games runs live social tournament games. At set times (for example, 7 PM each evening), a push notification announces the game is starting, and users play live against each other at that moment. Live Tech Games also runs games that are televised live in event halls and pubs after live shows and sporting events to help draw in large audiences from across the United Kingdom. In September 2022, Live Tech Games began working on Knockout, a new football trivia game in which players go head-to-head in three rounds televised at the end of each match of the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar.
products: Azure, Azure Container Instances, Azure Service Bus, Azure SignalR Service

title: TKC uses Windows 11 and Dynabook to help protect PCs from cyber-attacks
executive_summary: TKC has developed specialized information systems and services dedicated to accounting firms and local governments. These systems are required to adapt quickly to changes and to have high social responsibility standards. Together, Windows 11 and Dynabook help protect PCs from cyber-attacks by detecting and recovering attacks to the BIOS and preventing the spread of infection. These security advancements enable TKC to provide support through information and communication technology (or “ICT”), making broad contributions to the development of the Japanese economy and local communities.

title: Cranfield University deploys Elastic SIEM on Azure to protect vital IT infrastructure and support revenue opportunities
executive_summary: Cranfield University, a postgraduate university focusing on science, engineering, design, technology, and management, uses large volumes of data from different sources for research and needs to keep its security infrastructure compliant with business partner requirements. Seeking to accelerate compliance with partners, Cranfield turned to Elastic Cloud powered by Microsoft Azure, enabling the university to analyze data, automate processes, and protect systems across the enterprise.

title: Home Trust increases performance, reduces time to market with Azure VMware Solution
executive_summary: Home Trust Company faced a costly and time-consuming upgrade project for its datacenter exit. Moving forward, it sought to increase reliability and resilience and reduce operating costs with a managed VMware solution. The Canadian financial services institution exited its cloud-hosted solution running VMware and is now 100 percent in Microsoft Azure. It’s using Azure VMware Solution to tap into significant ease of management, seamless scalability, and cost savings. With Azure VMware Solution, the company improved performance over its former on-premises solution, and it can bring products to market faster than before. The IT team is now considering new, innovative ways to expand the business and modernize applications in Azure.
products: Azure, Cost Management, Azure Databricks, Azure NetApp Files, Azure VMware Solution, Power BI

title: CTT - Correios de Portugal migrates to Azure to immediately reduce costs by 15 percent and increase flexibility
executive_summary: Since its inception in 1520, CTT - Correios de Portugal has moved with the pace of change to keep the people of Portugal connected in an ever-changing world. That spirit of innovation is alive and well today. As postal services face challenges globally, CTT continues to reinvent itself to remain a trusted service provider for its customers. However, years of growth had saddled the company with a costly patchwork of on-premises digital systems that were a challenge to manage and an obstacle to the development and deployment of new services. To overcome these impediments, CTT undertook a cloud-first strategy and set out to migrate its workloads to Microsoft Azure.

title: REVA University races ahead in its digital transformation journey with Microsoft
executive_summary:
REVA University (REVA) is among the top private universities in Bengaluru, Karnataka, India, aiming to transform students into future-ready professionals. Established in 2013, this forward-looking University offers more than 70 programs in various disciplines delivered by highly qualified faculty members, cutting-edge infrastructure, and a focus on research and innovation. The university also provides a vibrant campus life with opportunities for sports, cultural events, and community service initiatives.
REVA is approved by the University Grants Commission (UGC), All India Council for Technical Education (AICTE), and accredited by the National Assessment and Accreditation Council (NAAC). According to the QS Asian University Rankings 2023, compiled by Quacquarelli Symonds, the global higher education analyst and compiler of the QS World University Rankings, REVA is ranked sixth among private universities in Karnataka and 47th in India.

title: Se montrer sous son meilleur jour dans Microsoft Teams : L'Oréal et ModiFace introduisent le maquillage numérique dans les réunions
executive_summary: Jeff Houghton, Chief Executive Officer of ModiFace, describes his job as, “the coolest in the world.” At ModiFace, a company that creates augmented reality technology for the beauty industry, Houghton and his colleagues spend their days bringing futuristic technology to everyday situations. “I get to take something that’s so digital, so cutting-edge, and make that tangible for people,” says Houghton. In a sign of its commitment to creating exceptional digital experiences, global beauty company L'Oreal acquired Modiface, enabling it to bring world-class digital try-on capabilities to its customers. “ModiFace partners with more than 30 L’Oréal brands in more than 100 countries, and we work with over 50 retail partners. Our goal is to meet customers wherever they are,” says Houghton.
products: Microsoft 365 Enterprise, Microsoft Teams

title: DTEK revamps debt management with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: In a period of deep instability, Ukraine's largest energy provider D.Solutions, a subsidiary of DTEK Holdings, faced an overwhelming cashflow crisis—its uncollected accounts receivables were the biggest it has ever been. To solve this, DTEK and D.Solutions used Microsoft Power Platform to segment its customers and create tailored debt repayment plans that enabled both the companies and the Ukrainian people to move forward. This resulted in an impressive 90 percent improvement in debt collection. DTEK emerged victorious not just in financial stability, but in its innovation and resilience as well.
products: Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Power BI

title: Marks & Spencer enhances its customer loyalty program with Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: Marks & Spencer is a leading British retailer bringing high-quality food, clothing, and homeware to millions of customers around the world at great value. With 959 stores across the UK and 100+ websites serving customers in the UK and abroad, the company generates and is trusted with a vast amount of data. Its customer loyalty program, Sparks, has more than 17 million members in the UK and Ireland. Marks & Spencer uses machine learning and data science workloads to gain customer insights and take actions to build brand loyalty, like recommending products based on past purchases, sending loyalty emails to rewards members, and creating targeted campaigns. The previous solution for data science workloads relied on many manual processes, and Marks & Spencer wanted a faster, less labor-intensive way to get models into production. The company turned to Azure MLOps v2 Accelerator to speed up development and deployment time, reduce manual processes, and improve the continuous integration/continuous delivery (CI/CD) process. This also helped reduce errors and failures in machine learning model production that will ultimately lead to better customer experiences.

title: The Civil Aviation Authority achieves a “perfect” migration from GOV.UK PaaS to Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The CAA ran its drone education and registration service on GOV.UK PaaS. When the UK Government announced it would decommission the platform, the CAA needed to move fast. It chose to migrate onto Microsoft Azure which was swift and hitch free, with the CAA succeeding in creating a templated approach which can be followed by other organisations. Today, the CAA enjoys efficiencies in skills, security, cost and ease of management. The tight integration with other Microsoft products, such as Dynamics 365, and the potential to use Azure Kubernetes will power further development.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights - Data, Dynamics 365 Sales, Microsoft Sentinel

title: ​​City of Brampton enacts first-class security, reduces alert noise by 70 percent with Microsoft Security solutions and Difenda Shield​
executive_summary: The City of Brampton exemplifies how to resist modern-day cyberthreats with a scalable, “do more with less” defense strategy. It rolled out a coordinated set of Microsoft Security solutions, engaging Difenda, a Microsoft Intelligent Security Association member, for managed security services. Difenda deployed and optimized Microsoft Sentinel as the linchpin solution for overall infrastructure visibility, using it in concert with Microsoft Defender for Office 365 and other Defender solutions to provide sustainable security. The City of Brampton enjoys the benefits of data-driven decision-making and a proactive security posture, creating a safer digital environment for citizens while optimizing taxpayer dollars.

title: Iberia Express reduces distribution costs by 75% with Airplane Solutions and Microsoft Azure services
executive_summary: Spanish airline Iberia Express, whose 20-plus planes fly to more than 40 destinations, wanted to reduce its costs and maximize efficiency. The low-cost carrier had a contract with a traditional distribution provider, and it had a very high cost per pricing transaction. Iberia Express worked with Microsoft partner Airplane Solutions and implemented its Air Pricing solution, which utilizes numerous Microsoft Azure services. Air Pricing saved Iberia Express 75 percent on distribution costs while improving system performance and provided a solid infrastructure for developing new commercial and marketing offerings for customers.
products: Azure API Management, Azure Application Insights, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure DNS, Azure Data Explorer, Azure Event Grid, Azure Functions, Azure Storage

title: Quintain brings properties to life with help from Simply Dynamics and Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Quintain is a property development and asset management company that was established in London in 1992 and is now recognized as a significant industry expert in developing major urban regeneration programs. Its Irish operation was founded in 2019, becoming the third-largest residential mixed-use developer in the country. To meet the challenges associated with such rapid expansion, Quintain turned to Simply Dynamics for help implementing a new financial management system based on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central.

title: Hindware powers digital transformation with Microsoft technology
executive_summary: Somany Impresa Group (Hindware), home to one of India’s most iconic brands, has five leading companies under it namely – Hindware Limited, Hindware Home Innovation Limited, AGI Greenpac, EVOK and TRUFLO. A market leader in building products and a fast-growing player in the Indian consumer appliances segment, it is also present in the packaging products and retail businesses, catering to the modern Indian consumer’s ever-changing needs. With its keen focus on leveraging technology to offer better products and services, it also supplies IoT appliances in some categories, such as water purifiers, water heaters, chimneys, and air coolers.
products: Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Analytics, Microsoft 365, Power BI

title: Autotechnics relied on SoftwareOne in times of crisis
executive_summary: Autotechnics, one of the largest spare parts distributers in Ukraine, needed a more resilient infrastructure to keep their data accessible to customers, even during times of crisis.
products: Azure, Azure SQL Database, Azure Site Recovery

title: Telefónica takes control of connectivity data for 10M+ home routers with an Azure IoT–based platform
executive_summary: For 99 years, Telefónica has thrived as a telecommunications provider by exploring the use of the latest technology to streamline business growth and satisfy customer demand. The company recently built a new service delivery and communications platform called Home Advanced Connectivity (HAC) that enables operations and customer services teams for the first time to have real-time, bidirectional data flows between customers’ in-home gateway devices and the Telefónica cloud at scale. Developed on the Microsoft Azure IoT platform, HAC simplifies and enhances connectivity management by overcoming technical barriers previously posed by third-party agents that were required to run on the routers. Today, 4.5 million devices process 6.5 billion messages per day, with plans to easily scale to 20 million devices in the next few years. The solution has streamlined device management across this huge install base and enabled new opportunities to rapidly develop and deliver new value-added services.
products: Azure, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, Azure Event Hubs, Azure IoT Hub

title: SVA leverages Azure Migrate and Modernize to help its clients
executive_summary: SVA is an owner-managed system house in Germany whose mission is to find the best possible IT solutions for its clients. SVA has been able to leverage the Microsoft Azure Migrate and Modernize with its clients, as it provides a great argument for taking that leap and starting to modernize its applications. SVA identifies well-matched deployment opportunities that decrease costs and increase efficiency and reliability for customers across finance, healthcare, and government industries.
products: Azure

title: Windows 11 Pro fuels growth and breakthrough technology at Techspace
executive_summary: Techspace anticipates greatly expanding its business of providing workspaces and technology infrastructures to fast-growing technology companies. The Techspace finance team uses Microsoft Power BI to provide executives with the data-fueled intelligence that allows them to make the right decisions as they create the future of the company. Since finance team members started using Dell laptops running on Windows 11 Pro, they find it much easier to capture and visualize the data they need, which in turn helps the company forge ahead. Instead of static reports, they provide insight through an interactive dashboard. Windows 11 Pro with Power BI running natively will play a key role as Techspace expands to additional sites, recruits employees, and empowers the existing team.
products: Excel, Power BI, Windows 11

title: Enexis adopts Microsoft Mixed Reality technology and the industrial metaverse to take a leading role in the energy transition
executive_summary: Dutch state-owned utility provider Enexis is on a mission to drive the energy transition at a national level. This, however, requires significant changes. From infrastructure upgrades to grid expansions, Enexis is largely transforming its operations – and is doing it using new technology and greater amounts of skilled personnel. To make sure that its current and future workforce is equipped for the needs of the future, Enexis has rolled out a training program centered around using Mixed Reality with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Guides and HoloLens 2. An instant success across the company – allowing trainees to master materials 40% faster than in traditional ways – the initiative has persuaded Enexis to go even further, and venture into the possibilities offered by the industrial metaverse.
products: Dynamics 365 Guides, HoloLens

title: Hamburg Commercial Bank finds cost savings, efficiencies, and improved sustainability with Windows 365
executive_summary: Hamburg Commercial Bank’s move right before the COVID-19 pandemic to untether its workforce from their desks was just in time to support the growing need for hybrid work. Now, the bank is building on this foundation and extending its device capabilities with Windows 365. With these Cloud PCs, traders and developers get right-size processing, and their devices let them pick up the next day right where they left off for greater efficiency. This has proven so effective that the bank is now making plans to roll out the solution more widely, citing reduced IT implementation and support needs plus overall cost savings, sustainability improvements, and a better overall user experience.

title: Modern Requirements revolutionizing product development with Azure DevOps and Azure OpenAI
executive_summary: For companies to meet the needs of their customers and stakeholders, business leaders create a set number of functional and non-functional requirements (Quality of Service). These requirements help product managers and quality assurance employees enhance existing products and develop new ones for their customers. Success hinges on the ability to get everyone on the same page and working toward the same goal. However, without proper tools, this process can seem outdated, slow, and prone to error. There also exists a gap in the common understanding of requirements among stakeholders, especially as requirements evolve over time and changes need to be managed.
products: Azure, Azure Operator Call Protection

title: Top security for every work step: IT security solution based on Microsoft 365 detects and reports threats at VAF in five minutes flat
executive_summary: To produce special systems and machines for the automotive industry, medium-sized company VAF relies on connectivity and digital processes. A wide range of interfaces are needed to ensure that everything runs smoothly. With cybercrime on the rise, these need to be protected. In the past, the family-owned company from Bopfingen, Germany employed numerous third-party tools for this purpose. This led to a high degree of fragmentation instead of a uniform platform—rather than enabling a proactive overview of the level of security, it required maximum administrative effort. Today, VAF—together with its partner abtis—has taken a big step forward in cybersecurity with Modern Secure Workplace, a managed service based on Microsoft 365 E5.

title: South African Board of Jewish Education’s digital transformation journey in partnership with Buzzbotics, and Microsoft
executive_summary: King David Schools, under the auspices of the South African Board of Jewish Education (SABJE) are a network of Jewish schools in Johannesburg offering PrePrimary through to High School education across five campuses in Johannesburg. King David Schools currently has 3300 students and 300 educators in our family of schools.

title: Upskilling employees paid off: MCS Group transformed operations with Power Platform
executive_summary: MCS Group, one of Mongolia's largest conglomerates, needed to swiftly respond to the technological needs of its 10,000 employees, but had limited IT resources. By embracing Microsoft Power Platform, it significantly reduced development time and costs. To foster innovation, it launched a group-wide Microsoft Power Apps and Power BI training program. Application development became so popular within the group that an internal app store was built, empowering employees to create business solutions that boost efficiency and make their lives better.
products: Microsoft 365, Power Apps, Power BI

executive_summary: To produce special systems and machines for the automotive industry, medium-sized company VAF relies on connectivity and digital processes. executive_summary: MCS Group, one of Mongolia's largest conglomerates, needed to swiftly respond to the technological needs of its 10,000 employees, but had limited IT resources. Application development became so popular within the group that an internal app store was built, empowering employees to create business solutions that boost efficiency and make their lives better.

title: TAS United protects caller data 24/7 with Azure-based Safetica data loss prevention
executive_summary: Come rain or shine, TAS United agents are there for their clients, handling customer calls around the clock. To ensure that sensitive caller information remains confidential, the company implemented Safetica's data loss prevention (DLP) solution, run on Microsoft Azure. It applies machine learning and automation features to detect and prevent data leaks and help TAS United meet strict compliance requirements. Delivered in the cloud, it eliminates the cost and hassle of maintaining physical servers while reducing the time spent on manual data monitoring by 41 percent.

title: Mexico’s Supreme Court of Justice of the Nation provides the public with digital access to the court’s historical documents with the help of Azure
executive_summary: Mexico's Supreme Court, the Supreme Court of Justice of the Nation (SCJN), digitized millions of physical files and built a legal search engine for the public using language models created with artificial intelligence and Azure cognitive services.

title: FARFETCH: paving way for the future of retail with Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: As the leading global platform for the luxury fashion industry, FARFETCH connects shoppers in over 190 countries with more than 1,400 of the world’s best-known brands, boutiques and department stores. Committed to delivering unique shopping experiences and access to the most extensive selection of luxury on a global platform, the company is relying on Microsoft technology to support its growth ambitions. Born in the cloud, FARFETCH has spent the past decade leveraging the scalability and flexibility benefits of Microsoft Azure to build its global marketplace – and then expand it using an ever-growing range of Microsoft tools including Dynamics 365 and AI. Ultimately building a huge ecosystem of innovative, sustainable and efficient solutions to reach even more customers around the world.

title: A bid for sustainability: ASCORP amplifies offers for green energy projects with Power Apps
executive_summary: ASCORP, a green energy trailblazer in Romania, faced challenges managing and standardizing its green energy projects’ bidding process. Driven by a vision of sustainability, ASCORP sought a solution to streamline its operations. Collaborating with Pepas Cloud, ASCORP developed an innovative app called Deep Quotes, on Power Apps. The solution helped ASCORP enhance its efficiency and improve collaboration by cutting down the time it takes to create an offer from 2-4 hours to five minutes.

title: UMS embraces more collaborative teaching with Microsoft 365 Education
executive_summary: Universiti Malaysia Sabah (UMS) is one of the leading higher education institutes in Malaysia. Staff and students were using apps and solutions ad hoc in conjunction with the university’s scattered legacy IT solutions. Seeking a more integrated technological approach, UMS deployed Microsoft 365 Education and transitioned to using Microsoft Outlook for email, Microsoft OneDrive data storage, and Microsoft Teams for communications. The move has helped the institute refocus its attention on student-centered learning.

title: Payoneer saves months in setting up call centers to offer speedy financial services using Cloud PC solution
executive_summary: For nearly 20 years, Payoneer has been a trailblazer in the global digital economy. The financial technology company empowers businesses with a platform to manage their financial transactions and funds, and to pay and get paid internationally in different currencies. Guy Winberg, the Global IT-Corp Group Manager, was looking for a more cost-effective and time-saving solution for deploying new and maintaining the company’s network of call centers. For this, Winberg and his team transitioned service agents to Windows 365 Cloud PCs, which enabled Payoneer to combine the power and security of the cloud with the versatility and simplicity of a PC.

title: More power, less downtime: Fincantieri leverages ADX for turbogenerators’ predictive maintenance
executive_summary: Fincantieri, a global leader in shipbuilding and mechanical component design, wanted to shift from traditional reactive maintenance of turbogenerators to predictive maintenance with real-time remote monitoring. Using Microsoft Azure and Microsoft Azure Data Explorer (ADX), Fincantieri was able to do just that. Proactive monitoring enabled the company to postpone interventions by 25 percent and manage the storage of spare parts more effectively. The result is greater reliability and reduced downtimes for turbogenerators.
products: Azure, Azure Data Explorer

title: Varsity College scales up student lab capacity and saves IT costs with Azure Lab Services
executive_summary: Varsity College is a brand of the Independent Institute of Education (IIE), South Africa's largest registered and accredited private higher education provider. Until recently, all computer labs on the Varsity College campuses used fully on-premises equipment, requiring ongoing IT and administrative overhead to maintain. Since 2020, Varsity College has gained IT efficiencies by using Azure Lab Services, with cloud-based virtual machines (VMs) replacing the on-premises labs.
products: Azure Compute Gallery, Azure Lab Services, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Futuristic smart airports are now a reality, with Microsoft AI-enhanced security and private 5G networks by NTT
executive_summary: Microsoft has partnered with NTT to develop a smart airport solution featuring a connected 5G network and AI-enhanced security.

title: LALIGA delivers next-generation fan experiences by reimagining data and AI at scale
executive_summary: As one of the world’s largest sports leagues, LALIGA is a familiar name to soccer enthusiasts. To meet the ever-evolving demands of a content-driven entertainment enterprise, LALIGA puts fans first when developing new initiatives. In support of its over 2.8 billion soccer fans worldwide and more than 200 million followers in social media, LALIGA set strategic goals to continually evolve its digital ecosystem, creating an infrastructure to support the organization's growth. LALIGA’s partnership and move to Azure has transformed fan engagement, driven revenue growth, and created new opportunities for sports clubs, leagues, and federations.

title: Dai-ichi Life Việt Nam thúc đẩy áp dụng công nghệ mới để nâng cao năng suất thông qua các giải pháp của Microsoft
executive_summary: Dai-ichi Life, a leading life insurance provider in Vietnam, saw digital transformation as the answer to the changing demands of customers, who require fast, convenient, high-quality, and easy-to-use services. By implementing Microsoft 365 and Azure, Dai-ichi Life achieved increased operational efficiency and enhanced security. The company's new technologies reached a 20 percent adoption rate, streamlining processes and improving customer satisfaction in the process.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 Finance, Microsoft 365 E3, Microsoft 365 E5, Power Apps, Microsoft Intune

executive_summary: As one of the world’s largest sports leagues, LALIGA is a familiar name to soccer enthusiasts. In support of its over 2.8 billion soccer fans worldwide and more than 200 million followers in social media, LALIGA set strategic goals to continually evolve its digital ecosystem, creating an infrastructure to support the organization's growth. title: How Microsoft Dynamics 365 is helping Securitas to transform operations and make the world a safer place
executive_summary: Swedish security services provider Securitas is committed to keeping millions of people and organizations around the world safe by combining people with technology. As part of this mission, Securitas has rolled out a CRM platform that relies on Dynamics 365 to better support its sales teams, get greater insights via sales and customer data and foster greater transparency and collaboration across its client teams.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Sales, Microsoft 365

title: Kantar Worldpanel Plus uses Azure Databricks to produce real-time shopper insights
executive_summary: Kantar’s new Worldpanel Plus service was planned to deliver insights about UK shopper behaviour. They opted for Microsoft Azure, running Azure Databricks and Azure Data Lake with additional Microsoft security and Power Platform tools. Worldpanel Plus launched in 2018. A large sample of shoppers now upload 100,000 receipts per day. This scalable solution enables Kantar to deliver UK shopper insights to the brands with which it works.
products: .NET, Azure, Azure App Service, Azure Data Studio, Azure Databricks, Azure Event Hubs, Azure Monitor, Azure Key Vault, Microsoft Sentinel, Power BI

title: Revolutionizing healthcare: SAT Health streamlines patient support programs with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: SAT Health empowers healthcare providers with innovative and data-driven solutions. With its previous system for managing Patient Support Programs (PSP), the company faced challenges in data storage, security measures, and process scalability. Partnering with MY Synergy, SAT Health enhanced its PSP system by building it on Microsoft Power Platform and providing access through Azure Active Directory. The new MY Care solution has improved patient service delivery by healthcare professionals while maintaining high security standards and boosting staff efficiency.

title: ​​Centro Hospitalar builds up resistance to threats, analyzes 48 million logs a day with Microsoft Security solutions​
executive_summary: When Centro Hospitalar de Trás-os-Montes e Alto Douro needed a way to protect sensitive, highly confidential patient data and applications in its hybrid environment, it chose Microsoft Security solutions. The hospital system’s future-forward strategy calls for a dynamic, cloud-based security approach that will stay on top of threats and position the organization for cloud migration. It now has a centralized view of security events with Microsoft Sentinel, increasing frontline defense with Azure Automation and Microsoft Defender for Cloud. With Azure Arc to extend Centro Hospitalar’s Azure platform protections to its on-premises assets, the hospital system considers its IT security vaccinations up to date.

title: Politecnico di Milano delivers actionable workforce sentiment insights with Microsoft Graph Data Connect
executive_summary: At the Department of Electronics Information and Bioengineering of Politecnico di Milano, a solution that delivers objective, granular data concerning employee sentiment at scale is in development. With Microsoft Graph Data Connect, Leonardo Di Perna, Data Analytics Manager at Politecnico di Milano began experimenting with a system that reveals de-identified collaboration and communication data from Microsoft 365 and maps it to easily digestible Power BI dashboards. Early industry participants from the banking, manufacturing, and service sectors have lauded the tool’s utility. These insights could soon either bolster or supplant employee surveys as the industry solution for detecting human sentiment.
products: Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Microsoft Graph Data Connect, Microsoft Learn, Power BI

title: University of Bath researchers test theories and release findings faster than before with Azure HPC
executive_summary: The University of Bath wanted to upgrade its infrastructure to be able to provide access to the latest technology, including the newest types of virtual machines as they’re released. It now uses Microsoft Azure high-performance computing to empower its academic community to produce cutting-edge research and enhance course curricula at a faster pace than previously possible. It addresses its storage, monitoring, and management needs with a suite of Azure services, helping its researchers, teachers, and students benefit from new efficiencies, reduced response time for faster research results, and more opportunities to collaborate with the greater academic community.
products: Azure, Azure Blob Storage, Azure CycleCloud, Azure Disk Storage, Azure HPC, Azure Monitor, Azure Virtual Machines, Linux on Azure

title: CIAT drives innovation and productivity for national tax agencies
executive_summary: The Inter-American Center of Tax Administrations (CIAT) provides technical assistance, studies, and training to strengthen the tax administrations of its 42 member countries. In addition to its established offerings, CIAT has a strategic intent to provide advanced technology products that helps strengthen government tax administrations around the world. As part of Microsoft’s investment program into industry, it develops accelerators that outline how agencies can adopt cloud technology to drive innovation. CIAT, with direct collaboration from Microsoft, deployed the Microsoft Public Finance accelerator in Costa Rica to help free the government’s tax administration by optimizing data collection, automating routine tasks, and using machine learning strategically allocate efforts where they are needed most.
products: Azure, Azure Synapse Analytics

title: MGM in Macau uses Microsoft Teams to replace resource-heavy processes with faster, digital alternatives
executive_summary: MGM MACAU and MGM COTAI, two integrated hotel properties in the resort city of Macau, use Microsoft Teams to provide company news, customer service tips, information, and applications, all of which employees can access on personal devices from anywhere, helping them to work more efficiently and collaborate better. It’s just one example of the organization’s ongoing efforts to empower employees in all areas of the business with collaboration tools that match the fast-paced reality of the hospitality industry.

title: Bayer innovates and advances industry using Microsoft Azure Data Manager for Agriculture
executive_summary: Since 2015, Bayer has deployed its Climate FieldView technology to give farmers an essential tool, accessible through any device, to inform and support on-farm decisions. Users can adapt farming operations and increase efficiency in the field using insights from satellite imagery, IoT hardware, and other technologies, through a centralized software application. Climate FieldView’s growth in popularity brought with it increased data management needs, creating a strain on Bayer's internal resources. Bayer partnered with Microsoft to implement a new cloud-based foundation for Climate FieldView using Microsoft Azure Data Manager for Agriculture. Now, Bayer can save time, cut costs, and free up its internal resources to build the next generation of innovative, digital solutions for farmers. As a strategic partner, Bayer’s decades of agriculture expertise informed the design of the Azure Data Manager and is thus helping empower organizations to address the challenges in agriculture today.

title: Equinor takes leap forward on energy transition using Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: Norwegian energy company Equinor ASA is on a mission to drive the global energy transition with the help of innovative technologies. To do this, the organization has launched an initiative to digitalize its gas trading activities and guide decision-making processes around them using data and insights. Culminated with the creation of a machine learning platform, the project is driving long-needed cultural and digital transformation across Equinor – bringing them one step closer to their sustainable pledges.

title: Bayer innovates and advances industry using Microsoft Azure Data Manager for Agriculture
executive_summary: Since 2015, Bayer has deployed its Climate FieldView technology to give farmers an essential tool, accessible through any device, to inform and support on-farm decisions. Users can adapt farming operations and increase efficiency in the field using insights from satellite imagery, IoT hardware, and other technologies, through a centralized software application. title: Vodafone Fiji gains scale, reliability, and ease of innovation by migrating its payment platform to Azure
executive_summary: Vodafone Fiji customers send and receive money and make purchases and payments through its M-PAiSA payment platform. Hoping to gain greater scale, resilience, innovation, and compliance, and to shed maintenance efforts and costs related to its aging hardware, the company migrated its on-premises platform to Microsoft Azure. With help from partner Onsys Technologies, Vodafone Fiji’s platform is now architected with a host of Azure infrastructure services. These have helped position the company to work more efficiently, easily scale for peak demand, and more easily develop and implement new features for continuous improvement.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Azure Application Gateway, Azure Backup, Azure Blueprints, Azure ExpressRoute, Azure Load Balancer, Azure Monitor, Azure Virtual Machines, Windows Server

title: Fife Council modernizes infrastructure, reduces virtualization datacenter footprint by more than 80 percent with Azure Stack HCI
executive_summary: As one of Scotland’s largest municipal governments, Fife Council knows how to deliver what its citizens need. The council dependably and efficiently provides essential services like garbage collection, street lighting, public housing, and education to more than 370,000 residents. With that kind of mandate, Fife Council makes smart use of technology to keep its service levels high and costs low.

title: ELTRAK Group secures business continuity with Microsoft Security
executive_summary: ELTRAK Greece is the exclusive distributor for Caterpillar in Greece. To serve its customers better, the company transitioned to cloud solutions to improve productivity and management. ELTRAK Greece collaborated with Microsoft partner Office Line to use Microsoft Security, reducing its endpoint security maintenance effort by 75 percent and ensuring business continuity in its new environment. The move also helped the company achieve the ISO 27001 certification, an essential standard for information security management systems (ISMS) and their requirements.

title: Wibmo strengthens security posture with Zero Trust powered by Microsoft
executive_summary: Wibmo is a full-stack PayTech company delivering state-of-the-art solutions to make digital payments simple, secure, and fast. It is an industry leader in emerging markets and offers solutions for mobile payments, fraud and risk management, prepaid services, and a host of merchant and acquiring services. Wibmo holds PCI DSS, PCI-3DS, PCI-SSLC, ISO 27001, ISO 27701, GDPR, and SOC 2 certifications for security and privacy. Founded in Cupertino, CA, in 1999 and a subsidiary of PayU, Wibmo has strategic partnerships with over 160+ banks across 30+ countries. Furthermore, it is the largest authentication service provider in India, which is one of the world's leading digital payment markets.

title: Zurich Insurance Group gives its business units a modern, flexible customer engagement solution with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Zurich Insurance Group (Zurich) is a global insurer serving people and businesses in more than 200 countries and territories. The corporate center of the company at Zurich headquarters is responsible for adopting new tools and technology strategies and pushing them out to the various business units (BUs) and countries. With each BU operating differently based on the unique needs of its target market or country, many BUs looked to optimize processes to be able to handle more and more customer data across a centralized and flexible CRM system.

title: L’Oréal extends higher performance and supports sustainability goals with SAP on Azure within the Americas
executive_summary: For more than a century, L’Oréal has been a leading brand in the beauty industry. Its global operations span 150 countries and more than 35 brands. As part of a multi-year initiative to improve performance, lower costs, and support its sustainability commitments, L’Oréal has methodically adopted cloud technology to help scale its $41.96 billion business across geographies.
products: Azure, Azure ExpressRoute, Azure NetApp Files, Azure Virtual Machines, SAP on Azure

title: Accenture encourages a culture of innovation, empowering citizen developers with Power Platform
executive_summary: Accenture is a global professional services and consulting agency helping customers across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. Like many organizations, it had more demand than could be met by central IT, so Accenture decided to democratize and evangelize a low-code platform to empower citizen developers to solve their own problems. Recognizing the value that Power Platform had to offer, Accenture has continued to grow its Center of Excellence, and is offering all five Microsoft Power Platform products at scale. Now, Accenture sees significant savings each year with its new model, has more than 50k newly skilled citizen developers, and has reduced IT demand for short-term applications by 30 percent, giving professional developers the ability to focus on more complex projects.

title: Decentriq unlocks highly secure collaboration on the world’s most sensitive datasets with Azure confidential computing
executive_summary: Companies that work with sensitive data are often sitting on a wealth of information they’re restricted from using, but Decentriq is helping these companies tap into the value of this data—without sharing it. Founded in 2019, the Swiss company offers an enterprise-grade software as a service platform for confidential data collaboration. On the platform, participants can create data clean rooms, which are neutral spaces for multiple parties to work on joint datasets where compliance, control, and data confidentiality are enforced by advanced privacy technologies. With its data clean rooms, Decentriq is not only making data collaboration simpler, but in many cases, it’s also creating the opportunity for multiple groups to come together and use sensitive data for the first time—using Microsoft Azure confidential computing. Since migrating to the cloud and accelerating its confidential computing journey with Azure, the company has made collaboration on sensitive datasets scalable for the first time and helped customers reach a range of milestones, including doubling clickthrough rates for digital advertising. And this is just the beginning.

title: Sameday delivers a fresh employee experience with Microsoft Viva
executive_summary: Sameday, a rapidly growing Romanian courier company, aims to be the largest and most popular in the Balkans—delivering goods across Europe within 24 hours. To extend its vision of innovation to the entire company, Sameday designed an intranet that combines Viva Engage and Viva Connections. The platform streamlined internal communications and performance tracking, saving employees time and enabling the company to grow faster than its competition. With Microsoft's help, Sameday is building a strong foundation for a collaborative, meaningful, and efficient work environment.
products: Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Viva Connections, Microsoft Viva Engage, Microsoft Viva Goals, Microsoft Viva Learning

title: Radish Cooperative réduit le gaspillage alimentaire, améliore le service à la clientèle et les affaires pour les restaurants avec Azure
executive_summary: Montreal-based Radish Cooperative’s founders saw a food delivery market dominated by large digital platforms and formed a startup that offered affordable prices without sacrificing quality. They took a cooperative approach to ensure that Radish put its restaurants, couriers, and customers first. Joining the Microsoft for Startups Founders Hub, they developed a cloud-native, vertically integrated digital platform built on Microsoft Azure services. By hiring, training, and paying couriers appropriately, incentivizing restaurants as shareholders and decision-makers, and using data analytics and cloud-native tools, the cooperative and its members are thriving. Radish also offers integrated marketing, HR, and ordering services to its members to spur business and reduce food waste.

title: Softools helps customers automate business processes and maximize cloud spend investments through the Microsoft commercial marketplace
executive_summary: Softools is a fully integrated, quick to learn, powerful, enterprise-grade, no-code web application platform. It enables companies and teams with no coding skills to develop applications to digitize and automate business processes that are often unaddressed by ERP solutions and managed via spreadsheets and email or on paper.

title: Accenture encourages a culture of innovation, empowering citizen developers with Power Platform
executive_summary: Accenture is a global professional services and consulting agency helping customers across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. Like many organizations, it had more demand than could be met by central IT, so Accenture decided to democratize and evangelize a low-code platform to empower citizen developers to solve their own problems. Recognizing the value that Power Platform had to offer, Accenture has continued to grow its Center of Excellence, and is offering all five Microsoft Power Platform products at scale. Now, Accenture sees significant savings each year with its new model, has more than 50k newly skilled citizen developers, and has reduced IT demand for short-term applications by 30 percent, giving professional developers the ability to focus on more complex projects.

title: Fujitsu Japan rebuilt their solution by fully utilizing Azure PaaS! What’s the advantage of “Java on Azure” and what’s appealing about it?
executive_summary: Fujitsu Japan is accelerating conversion of their solutions to cloud. The “TradeFront” series, the company’s EDI solution offered to retailing, wholesale, and manufacturing industries, is also one of them. By 2020, the company had built a shared infrastructure on Microsoft Azure where their SaaS services can be built, and in 2022, they built a new master data management (MDM) function by fully utilizing Azure PaaS. Amidst the rapid changes in business environments, master data management is one of the keys in promoting digital transformation (DX). We interviewed people in charge to hear what advantages have been created by full-scale introduction of PaaS, what roles Azure have played and keys in promoting “Java on Azure”.
products: Azure, Azure API Management, Azure Container Apps, Azure Data Factory, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps

title: The cutting edge in hospitality: Saudi Airlines Catering Company automates 11 processes with Power Apps, with more to come
executive_summary: Saudi Airlines Catering Company has an enduring commitment to continuous improvement. Recognizing the need to modernize, its leaders embarked on a transformative journey, using Microsoft Power Apps to automate and streamline data processing operations. From digitizing manual data collection to creating a suite of business applications, the company notably reduced reliance on paper, saving the business card printing cost by replacing it with the digital business card app. Moreover, real-time dashboards empower everyone to make data-driven decisions, enabling the company to deliver value to its customers quickly.

title: DocuWare builds innovative workflow business with reliability backed by Unified
executive_summary: DocuWare, a leading provider of document management and workflow automation tools, migrated its services to Azure in 2014. Working with Microsoft Unified, it has been able to provide reliable service its customers rely on while adding innovative features. As a result, its business grew 20 percent in 2022.

title: Ridgelinez, internally practicing data-driven management, builds data utilization infrastructure by Azure and accelerates DX even further!
executive_summary: Established in 2020 as a comprehensive professional firm supporting corporate innovation, Ridgelinez built data utilization infrastructure and is accelerating internal DX practice. As the background for building the infrastructure, they have dealt with issues such as “generation of data silos” and “lack of interest accompanying obsolescence of data” when promoting an architecture fully implemented on cloud by utilizing SaaS and PaaS. How did Ridgelinez solve issues of data, which is essential for promoting DX? Here is the introduction of activities related to data-driven management at Ridgelinez and the role that Microsoft Azure has played there.

title: Arrow Vale leverages Microsoft Education to advance learning amongst underprivileged students
executive_summary: Arrow Vale, a Microsoft Showcase School, serves over 850 students in one of the most economically deprived areas of England. In the past, the school struggled with closing the learning gap between students from various socioeconomic backgrounds.

title: Ukrenergo national grid operator improves resiliency with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Ukrenergo is the national electricity transmission system operator that carries out operational and technological management of the United Energy System of Ukraine. To adapt to the era of rapid change and uncertainty, Ukrenergo decided to move forward with digital transformation. The company optimized and automated operational management processes. By implementing Dynamics 365 Finance and Dynamics 365 Operations, Ukrenergo built a transactional digital core and became more resilient in its daily operations to ensure it could adapt to changes in any situation.

title: Dutch railway builds real-time crowdedness app with Azure Cosmos DB
executive_summary: Dutch railway operator Nederlandse Spoorwegen strives to provide fast, safe, and affordable train travel throughout the Netherlands. It discovered that customer satisfaction depends, among other things, on a train’s level of crowdedness and the ability of passengers to find a seat. Building on Microsoft Azure, Azure Cosmos DB, and several other Azure services, Nederlandse Spoorwegen developed an application that delivers real-time crowdedness indicators and travel disruption alerts. Customers have enthusiastically adopted the solution, which also has the potential to improve resource utilization.

title: Locobuzz delivers the future of Customer Experience with Microsoft Azure OpenAI
executive_summary:
Locobuzz is a unified Customer Experience (CX) platform that transforms customer engagement for brands in India, South-East Asia, the United States and the United Kingdom. Headquartered in Mumbai, it delivers rich insights into customer behavior, competitor insights and performance analytics across digital channels.
It also leverages engagement opportunities and streamlines processes, which in turn drives effective business decisions, product innovation and digital growth. Locobuzz’s CX platform is used by organizations across sectors such as hospitality, telecom, automotive, BFSI, aviation and more.

title: Enhancing security and lowering costs in one go: arab national bank and Microsoft Security
executive_summary: As one of the largest banks in Saudi Arabia, The arab national bank (anb) strives to provide faster, simpler banking for commercial clients as well as consumers. The bank wanted to empower its employees to serve customers remotely through digitization, which required top-notch security. “We relied on a variety of third-party security solutions which required a lot of effort,” recounts Ala Asali, Chief Security Officer at anb. Now, with Microsoft Security as its overarching, tightly integrated security solution, anb has enhanced security operations, lowered costs, increased employee productivity with remote work and improved customer experience—with just one strategic move.

title: MTB Bank mitigates crisis with Azure VMware
executive_summary: MTB Bank faced a major challenge in ensuring business continuity amid unstable conditions in Ukraine. It partnered with LanTec and leveraged Microsoft's Azure VMware to migrate its 330 servers to a secure, isolated, and compliant hybrid cloud environment. This innovative move not only fortified MTB Bank's infrastructure, but also enhanced customer trust and reliability. By embracing new technologies and further digital transformation, MTB Bank is securing a brighter future.
products: Azure VMware Solution

title: MTN brings people together by modernizing telecoms in Africa with Azure
executive_summary: MTN, Africa's largest mobile network operator, is transforming the telecommunications landscape for its over 290 million customers. It aims to offer customers a digital experience with the help of Microsoft technologies. Under the Executive Sponsorship of the Group Chief Strategy and Transformation Officer, Chika Ekeji, MTN is streamlining its operations by leveraging Microsoft Azure. As a result, the company is strengthening its go-to-market muscle by expanding its products and services into small-and-medium-sized enterprises (SME), enterprise, and government spaces, providing all citizens in Africa access to digital services.

title: Locobuzz delivers the future of Customer Experience with Microsoft Azure OpenAI
executive_summary:
Locobuzz is a unified Customer Experience (CX) platform that transforms customer engagement for brands in India, South-East Asia, the United States and the United Kingdom. Headquartered in Mumbai, it delivers rich insights into customer behavior, competitor insights and performance analytics across digital channels.
It also leverages engagement opportunities and streamlines processes, which in turn drives effective business decisions, product innovation and digital growth. Locobuzz’s CX platform is used by organizations across sectors such as hospitality, telecom, automotive, BFSI, aviation and more.

executive_summary: As one of the largest banks in Saudi Arabia, The arab national bank (anb) strives to provide faster, simpler banking for commercial clients as well as consumers. executive_summary: MTN, Africa's largest mobile network operator, is transforming the telecommunications landscape for its over 290 million customers.
