Under the Executive Sponsorship of the Group Chief Strategy and Transformation Officer, Chika Ekeji, MTN is streamlining its operations by leveraging Microsoft Azure. As a result, the company is strengthening its go-to-market muscle by expanding its products and services into small-and-medium-sized enterprises (SME), enterprise, and government spaces, providing all citizens in Africa access to digital services.

title: Η Classter βοηθά τα σχολεία και με το παράδειγμά της εμπνέει τις τοπικές επιχειρήσεις να επεκταθούν στις διεθνείς αγορές, μέσω μιας πλατφόρμας διαχείρισης εκπαίδευσης που βασίζεται στο Azure
executive_summary: Classter's CEO Nikolaos Nikou envisioned a solution that improves global education with a state-of-the-art cloud solution at a reasonably low cost. He founded a Greek company in his hometown Kavala, and with his team help, he created an Azure-based education management platform that covers the educational and operational needs for schools of all sizes from all over the world. Classter is now helping more than 500 educational organizations to make learning more efficient, while inspiring other small businesses from Greece to go global.
products: Azure, Azure Monitor, Microsoft 365, Microsoft 365 A1, Microsoft Teams

title: MTB Bank mitigates crisis with Azure VMware
executive_summary: MTB Bank faced a major challenge in ensuring business continuity amid unstable conditions in Ukraine. It partnered with LanTec and leveraged Microsoft's Azure VMware to migrate its 330 servers to a secure, isolated, and compliant hybrid cloud environment. This innovative move not only fortified MTB Bank's infrastructure, but also enhanced customer trust and reliability. By embracing new technologies and further digital transformation, MTB Bank is securing a brighter future.

title: International CRO ClinChoice dramatically improves finance processes with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: ClinChoice is a global contract research organization (CRO) with prominent presences in China, the United States, Armenia, India, and over 20 other countries around the world. It provides clinical development services to biotech, pharmaceutical, and medical device companies. ClinChoice offers a wide spectrum of solutions for clinical development, biometrics, drug safety, medical affairs, regulatory consulting, and more. With an international client base, numerous contracts, and the complexities involved in any clinical research project, ClinChoice faced difficulties managing time, scope, and labor costs, as well as ensuring every project meets regulatory compliance in the countries it operates in. To help manage these challenges across the lifecycle of its projects, the company chose Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Dynamics 365 Project Operations to consolidate its ERP systems. With this new system, ClinChoice has a clearer picture of costs, regulatory requirements, and timelines, improving efficiency and coordination throughout their CRO projects.
products: Dynamics 365 Finance, Dynamics 365 Project Operations, Microsoft Copilot for Dynamics 365, Outlook, Power BI

title: Spanish telco builds digital assistant based on natural language bot, engages customers on new level
executive_summary: To change how it engages with customers, the multinational telco Telefonica used Microsoft Azure Bot Service and Cognitive Services to build and support Aura, an intelligent conversational agent for multiple services. With Aura, Telefonica customers can manage their products and services with the company, get real-time support, or just change the TV channel, all through natural voice interaction and personalized user experience. Telefonica used Microsoft AI technology to meet its deadlines, reduce development cost and effort, move customer loyalty to a new level, and generate new business opportunities.
products: Azure, Azure AI Bot Service, Azure AI Services, Azure AI Language

title: GardaWorld helps unite, empower its globally distributed workforce with Microsoft Viva Connections
executive_summary: GardaWorld built a customized version of Microsoft Viva Connections and called it Teams-Connect, which is helping the security company reach a long-term goal to create a sense of engagement and inclusivity for its 120,000 or so frontline security officers at customer locations around the globe. Frontline security professionals can now receive company news, find information they need, provide feedback, and communicate among their teams using the new app, which deploys on their mobile phones and connects to the broader organization through GardaWorld’s Microsoft 365 communications and collaboration infrastructure.

title: Virgin Money makes customer service faster and easier with Power Virtual Agents
executive_summary: Virgin Money is a bank in the United Kingdom that seeks to reinvent the role banking plays in peoples’ lives. It prides itself on offering differentiated, digital-first services to customers. Virgin Money sought to improve the support options for customers by reducing the need to call in to the service line. Building on the strategic partnership between Virgin Money and Microsoft, the company used Power Virtual Agents to construct a chatbot that could easily handle common problems, resulting in many queries to the chatbot being resolved without the need for a live agent and over 195,000 interactions through the chatbot each month. Future improvements include AI implementations which will make the company’s chatbot more responsive and useful for customers.
products: Microsoft Copilot Studio

title: Westpac embraces and encourages a culture of innovation with Power Platform
executive_summary: Westpac, Australia’s first bank and one of the largest banks in New Zealand, has a long history of innovating with technology to provide great customer service. Continuing in this tradition, Westpac was seeking an adaptable low-code platform that could support a broad range of user needs that was simple to configure. Since 2019, Westpac has been using Microsoft Power Platform to help streamline business operations, solve IT issues, and formally support its “citizen developers”—employees who build their own solutions to simplify processes. In under two years, citizen developers have built about 1,000 apps, which are used by 15,000 people, and IT is building in-house solutions faster with low-code tools than with traditional software development.
products: Microsoft 365, Power Apps

title: WaterAid—How technology is advancing their 2032 goal to reach 400 million more people with clean water and toilets
executive_summary: WaterAid UK is a nonprofit organization that aims to provide clean water, sanitation, and hygiene education to people in need around the world. Their mission is to transform the lives of the poorest and most marginalized people by improving access to safe water, sanitation, and hygiene. Through their federation model with seven-member regions, WaterAid is working to better connect their data to foster regional collaboration in hopes of improving fundraising and constituent engagement among other organization goals. WaterAid’s programs have helped millions of people gain access to clean water and sanitation, improving their health, education, and economic opportunities—Microsoft Cloud for Nonprofit is helping them continue their mission.

title: Signly builds with Microsoft Azure for a more inclusive future in tech innovation
executive_summary: Signly is a technology-driven startup that aims to address communication barriers faced by the Deaf community. Despite ongoing efforts to enhance accessibility, the Deaf community continues to grapple with significant challenges. Signly recognises the unique nature of sign language, asserting that it deserves recognition and promotion Signly recognizes the distinctive nature of sign language, asserting it deserves both acknowledgment and to be part of the mainstream. To address this critical need, Signly is creating revolutionary technology that assists hearing individuals in communicating with sign language users.

title: AmRest drives clarity and efficiency on a global scale with Microsoft Azure and Power BI
executive_summary: AmRest is a leading European restaurant operator with more than 2,100 restaurants in 22 countries. As the company grew, consistently collecting, analyzing, and comparing data across geographies and number of brands, became a challenge. To overcome this, AmRest relied on Microsoft Azure and Power BI to gain one source of truth across business domains, empowering its employees to assess the health of the business from a 360-degree angle.

title: National Housing Company offers fully automated smart customer journey with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The National Housing Company (NHC), a state-owned Saudi company, leads the way in real estate development with More than 7 projects and more than 20,000 housing units. NHC decided to bring efficiency and visibility to internal processes to improve its customer experience. Digital Solutions and Products Manager at NHC Munira Altamimi’s mission was to automate the entire customer journey from registration to project handover with the use of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service and Sales. By bringing more visibility and efficiency to the process, NHC has improved customer satisfaction by 95 percent and enhanced its capacity for scale.

title: Johnson Controls uses Microsoft Teams to construct a network of digital champions who drive business goals
executive_summary: Johnson Controls (JCI) is a leader in the world of smart buildings with more than 100,000 employees working to shape the future of sustainable, intelligent spaces. Given how the company made its name with leading-edge building technology, it’s not surprising that increasing its workforce’s digital skills is one of JCI’s key goals.

title: JLL gives sales teams a holistic view of client relationships with Microsoft Graph Data Connect
executive_summary: Fortune 500 commercial real estate leader Jones Lang LaSalle Incorporated (JLL), uses Microsoft Graph to turn data into insight, improve business relationships, and accelerate prospecting. The company needed to efficiently identify brokers with strong, existing client relationships without slowing dealmaking or resorting to costly and time-consuming direct pulls of its Microsoft 365 data.  JLL decided to build a solution with Microsoft Graph Data Connect and Azure Data Factory.  JLL agents now have a handy customer relationship scoring utility that delivers, at-a-glance metrics about the relationships that their peers have built with each client or prospect.
products: Azure Synapse Analytics, Dynamics 365, Microsoft Graph Data Connect

title: Swedish tooling solutions company upgrades decade-old architecture to Azure, analyzes data with Power BI
executive_summary: Sandvik Coromant is one of the world’s leading suppliers of tools, tooling solutions, and know-how for the metal working industry. The Swedish company has extensive investments in research and development, creates unique innovations, and sets new productivity standards together with customers—including the world’s major automotive, aerospace, and energy industries.
products: Azure API Management, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, Azure ExpressRoute, Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Private Link, Azure Service Bus

title: Natuzzi crafts amazing customer experiences with Microsoft mixed reality technologies
executive_summary: Italian furniture maker Natuzzi is known around the world for its innovative designs, attention to detail, and stellar customer service. To transform its white-glove customer service, increase sales conversions, and accelerate the purchase journey, Natuzzi has introduced mixed reality technology from Microsoft into its augmented store—a digital experience where customers can be inspired to design how they live and entertain, and where they can see potential purchases in the context of their own homes, positioning Natuzzi as the first store they want to visit. We invited Creative Director and Stylist, Pasquale Junior Natuzzi, to share his creative vision for how the company is disrupting the furniture industry with innovative thinking and products.
products: Azure, Azure AI Services, Azure Storage, Azure Virtual Machines, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, HoloLens, Power BI

title: Svea Solar uses Microsoft Viva Goals to power more achievement and efficiency
executive_summary: At Svea Solar, one of Europe’s leading solar energy companies, objectives and key results (OKRs) include big goals like reducing the world’s reliance on fossil fuels. Wilhelm Kugelberg, Strategy & Business Development Manager at Svea Solar, has been part of the company’s OKR effort from the beginning. His team works together to find ways to break down the company’s mission into distinct milestones and continue to expand the business. Svea Solar is hoping to add nearly 4,000 more employees in the next five years. “We’re already one of the fastest growing companies in Europe,” says Kugelberg. “We recognized that we could achieve even more if we were more goal oriented and focused.” To power its OKR ambitions, Svea Solar turned to Microsoft Viva Goals. “We use Viva Goals to make our progress and objectives more transparent and accessible to everyone,” he says. “With it, we’ve expanded our OKR effort to include new areas of the business, and we’re driving efficiency in regard to our company goals.”
products: Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Viva Goals

title: Celli Group transforms the beverage industry with powerful IoT solution
executive_summary: Celli Group’s dispensing equipment helps global beverage companies satisfy millions of people around the world every day. But Celli Group knew its customers couldn’t see critical information at the point of sale, such as product quality, equipment health, and sales. Celli Group recognized the Internet of Things as an opportunity to transform their business model while giving customers more visibility and control over their assets. Partnering with Microsoft and PTC, Celli Group created IntelliDraught—a connected beverage distribution system that turns retrofittable and Celli Group equipment into smart devices that unlock insights where beverages are dispensed. The solution improves quality, sales, service, and inventory management for Celli Group’s customers.

title: Swiss Re accelerates Java app modernization using Azure Spring Apps
executive_summary: For more than 150 years, Swiss Re, one of the world’s largest reinsurers, has used data to make the world more resilient. These days, the company uses Microsoft Azure to power a digital transformation that includes the modernization of business-critical financial systems. To speed up deployments and take advantage of the Azure ecosystem, developers traded their existing solutions for Azure platform as a service (PaaS).

title: TMI Systems’ Verto 365 harnesses the power of the commercial marketplace to scale and reach new markets
executive_summary: Verto 365 is a collaborative workplace management solution from TMI Systems. This nimble UK-based company of 20 is using the Microsoft commercial marketplace and ISV Success to make huge strides in expanding transactable offers, increasing scalability, and reaching new geographies. By taking advantage of specific ISV Success benefits and working closely with Bytes, a UK-based cloud service provider, the team behind Verto 365 has accelerated its Microsoft Teams integration and time to market.
products: Azure, Microsoft Graph, Microsoft Teams

title: Future-focused Dutch water utility counters climate change with smart use of data on Azure
executive_summary: Dutch water utility PWN streams 106 billion liters of pure, high-quality water to a million and a half citizens in North Holland. The utility monitors and maintains the health of the dunes that act as a natural filtration mechanism for 25 percent of the water, but that complicates service delivery. And running both the business side of the utility and the systems to monitor water quality requires enormous data stores. PWN found one answer for both issues: moving its SAP estate from an expiring cloud hosting provider to Microsoft Azure to meet PWN’s complex business needs. With all the data on one platform, the utility can better manage its assets, communicate with customers, predict climate change effects, and help protect against them.

title: Eurowings enhances security, will reduce operating costs by 50+ percent with Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: Eurowings, Lufthansa Group’s value airline, serves more than 40 million customers as they travel to over 100 destinations around the world. A year ago, Jens Bischof, Chief Executive Officer and Chief Commercial Officer at Eurowings, laid out a new technological vision for the company. Eurowings would begin modernizing its IT landscape with a heavy focus on cloud-first solutions. A major opportunity presented itself only a few months later when much of the company’s on-premises server farms required updating—an expensive and time-consuming process. These servers handled remote application access and authentication for thousands of external and contract employees. To add to the immediacy of the company’s need, the renewal period fell at the beginning of the airline’s busy season, just as demand for its services began to scale up dramatically.
products: Azure, Azure Virtual Desktop, Dynamics 365, Microsoft 365, Windows 11, Windows Server

title: Eurowings enhances security, will reduce operating costs by 50+ percent with Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: Eurowings, Lufthansa Group’s value airline, serves more than 40 million customers as they travel to over 100 destinations around the world. A year ago, Jens Bischof, Chief Executive Officer and Chief Commercial Officer at Eurowings, laid out a new technological vision for the company. Eurowings would begin modernizing its IT landscape with a heavy focus on cloud-first solutions. A major opportunity presented itself only a few months later when much of the company’s on-premises server farms required updating—an expensive and time-consuming process. These servers handled remote application access and authentication for thousands of external and contract employees. To add to the immediacy of the company’s need, the renewal period fell at the beginning of the airline’s busy season, just as demand for its services began to scale up dramatically.

title: EPAM helps its customers engineer the future with Microsoft Enterprise Skilling Initiative
executive_summary: A long-standing Microsoft customer and partner, EPAM Systems (EPAM) helps its clients engineer the future using Microsoft cloud solutions. The company, repeatedly awarded for its strong learning culture, nurtures employee cloud competencies through participation in the Enterprise Skilling Initiative (ESI). Available in a variety of formats, the program has already provided over 2,500 engineers with more than 5,500 Microsoft Cloud certifications. Equipped with future-oriented skills, EPAM employees can feel more empowered in their roles and better serve the increasing digital needs of their clients.

title: EFG Hermes trades 160 times faster with revamped Direct Market Access platform based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The leading investment bank franchise in frontier and emerging markets (FEM) EFG Hermes’ operates in 12 countries across four continents, delivering innovative financial products and services. To further improve the trading experience, Chief Information Officer at EFG Hermes, Mohamed Fathy,led a company-wide digital transformation. By revamping the firm’s Direct Market Access (DMA) platform on Microsoft Azure, the company managed to sped up its trading processes, increased turnover of DMA trading orders by 45%, and built the right foundation to scale up.

title: Košík.cz gains agility to expand to new markets and deliver customer satisfaction with SAP on Azure
executive_summary: With daily deliveries to about 6,000 customers, Košík.cz is one of the Czech Republic’s largest online food retailers. Operating at that scale requires serious IT support to ensure that deliveries are met and customers are happy. However, Košík.cz’s digital infrastructure was increasingly unable to meet its growing demand.

title: Arthur Health’s clinically integrated network using Microsoft Power Platform scales pilot program that reduced patient wait times by 80%
executive_summary: Arthur Health, a healthcare solutions company based in Canada, is reimagining traditionally compartmentalized models of care through a clinically integrated network approach. In 2019, Arthur Health teamed up with the Ontario Ministry of Health and Long-Term Care and University Health Network to scale a rapid-access clinic model of care for low-back pain. In a pilot, this led to sustained reduced wait times, better access to local care, and higher patient and provider satisfaction, so Arthur Health plans to expand it. Arthur Health used Microsoft partner Quisitive’s MazikCare platform and Microsoft technologies to develop a patient-centered solution that the company hopes will spark changes to primary and specialty care in Canada.
products: Dynamics 365

title: Metso: fostering a culture of online inclusion and diversity using Microsoft Accessibility Tools and Microsoft Unified Support
executive_summary: Finnish manufacturing company Metso puts its people at the heart of all it does. As part of this mission, the company recently launched a series of Unified Support training courses that aim at driving awareness on Microsoft’s Accessibility tools and how they can make the workplace more inclusive – both online and offline.

title: La ville de Kelowna améliore et optimise l’accès à ses services grâce à Azure AI
executive_summary: The forward-thinking City of Kelowna always looks for ways to deliver greater benefits to its citizens without increasing costs for them. Now that cognitive search technology and conversational AI are available, the city aims to use them in support of its 311 non-emergency municipal services help line. Sourcing real-time data and existing documentation, the solution can efficiently answer a wide range of questions. The City of Kelowna expects the solution to soon help translate complex legal documents, walk people through permitting processes, and reduce the need for repetitive work for citizens and governmental employees alike.

title: Bodibasixs optimizes production with Power BI, resulting in 25% revenue
executive_summary: Bodibasixs, a Malaysian manufacturing company of personal care and beauty products, is committed to customer satisfaction by providing innovative items and timely deliveries. Faced with data silos that hindered decision-making processes, Bodibasixs partnered with SRKK to implement Power BI for faster data collection and analytics. With different dashboards that provided reliable data quickly, Bodibasixs increased monthly revenue by 25 percent while optimizing labor costs and the size of its workforce.

title: Chop Cheong Bee pioneers smart farming in Malaysian poultry sector with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: From traditional poultry farming in the 90s to being the first e-farm to smart farming today, Chop Cheong Bee embodies the spirit of innovation. To make farming a more profitable and sustainable business in Malaysia, it developed ways to transform raw data into actionable insights. Partnering with Infront Consulting Group, Chop Cheong Bee developed a cloud solution powered by Microsoft Azure, creating something that can truly revolutionize Malaysia’s farming landscape.
products: Azure, Azure AI Services, Power BI

title: Majid Al Futtaim embraces insights driven future with Microsoft Intelligent Data
executive_summary: A relentless focus on its customers has turned Majid Al Futtaim into a real estate and retail conglomerate, and leisure destination powerhouse across the Middle East, Africa, and Asia. The grocery retail arm of this company is Majid Al Futtaim Retail, the exclusive franchisee for Carrefour in over 30 markets, and currently operating more than 460 outlets.
products: Intelligent Data Platform, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID, Azure Key Vault, Microsoft Purview, Outlook, Power BI

title: OTELZ has achieved a 40% cost advantage with Microsoft Azure products
executive_summary: Established in 2013, OTELZ has become a notable success story by combining tourism and technology. 41% of OTELZ's customers are foreigners, and the company serves a wide range of customers in numerous languages and currencies. As a result, the technologies used behind the scenes have gained even more importance. By utilizing Microsoft's Azure products, OTELZ has achieved a 40% cost advantage.

title: Watts, a creator of smart energy-tracking applications, uses Azure to help customers bring sustainability home
executive_summary: Watts, a Danish energy technology company, was inspired by EU legislation on climate change to create an energy-tracking application for domestic use. The result, Watts Energy Assistant, was the first of several products that Watts launched to help boost sustainability in the home. From the beginning, the small team utilized the Microsoft Azure platform to support all their applications and services, including Azure IoT Hub, Data Lake Storage, and Azure Databricks. Their “Microsoft for everything” approach helped the company scale up quickly to meet growing demand, reduce costs, and maintain a strict security posture, including General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) compliance. Today, use of Watts products has grown exponentially, and the business continues to grow, with more services planned for the future.

title: Developing AI models in weeks rather than months: Siemens IT relies on the Azure cloud platform for its artificial intelligence projects
executive_summary: Accurate forecasts of operating figures are a boon to any industrial enterprise, enabling them to make precise production estimates and avoid extra costs. Siemens has long used artificial intelligence (AI) to create forecasts and provide targeted support to its departments. In the past, however, the development process ate up a lot of time. To boost the efficiency and quality of these kinds of AI models, Siemens IT developed a platform based on Microsoft Azure that functions as a customizable template for the entire company. Developing and deploying AI models used to take months. With the platform [ai:attack], it can now be done in just a couple of weeks.

title: Manulife stimule le développement et réduit les coûts de 50 % grâce à Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Manulife has been helping customers make smarter financial choices for the past 134 years. The Toronto-based insurance and financial services company has a thriving global presence with operations in Canada, the United States, and Asia because it never compromises on delivering value for its customers.
products: Azure, Azure AI Document Intelligence, Azure AI Services, Azure Databricks, Azure Machine Learning, Azure SQL Managed Instance, Azure Synapse Analytics

title: Visma: paving the way for the decade of AI with Microsoft’s skilling initiative
executive_summary: Norwegian software provider Visma has seen steady growth since it was established in 1996. Today, it acquires around 50 companies a year, providing a delicate balance of autonomy and support to the businesses that join its network. To ensure that it continues to provide cutting-edge services to its 1.5 million customers, skilling and competency development are key pillars of its operational model. Launched in 2020, a Microsoft skilling initiative is helping Visma provide development opportunities for employees across its network – ensuring the company remains on the front foot for the decade ahead.

title: Heijmans: paving the way to a digital future in construction with Azure Data Analytics capabilities, IoT technology and Azure Digital Twins
executive_summary: Dutch construction company Heijmans is in a state of transition. To help meet national sustainability targets, the company is expanding its traditional approach towards becoming a digital service provider. With the support of longstanding partner Microsoft, it has used Azure Digital Twins and other Azure services to gain greater insights into existing infrastructure, such as traffic lights and bridges, and offer more efficient maintenance services. It is just the start, with plans to expand the use of data analytics services and digital twin and IoT technology to larger-scale projects, paving the way for a more sustainable future – to the great benefit of Dutch society.
products: Azure Digital Twins, Azure IoT Hub, Azure Stream Analytics

title: AVEVA gains greater visibility and enhanced management capabilities with Azure Arc
executive_summary: AVEVA develops and delivers digital tools that help companies work better, faster, and greener. Providing software solutions to industries as various and vital as the food and beverage industry, mining, manufacturing, chemicals, energy, and the utilities means that AVEVA’s IT environment needs to be as high performing and rock solid as possible. Accordingly, when the company determined it needed to better position itself for future growth by evolving from its on-premises environment to a cloud-first approach, it knew it needed a better way to centrally manage both infrastructures. AVEVA found the solution it needed with Microsoft Azure Arc.

title: Komatsu Australia achieves end-to-end automation with Power Automate
executive_summary: Komatsu Australia is the Australian subsidiary of Komatsu, an industry-leading manufacturer of construction, forestry, and mining equipment.  When the parts department at Komatsu Australia struggled to manually process nearly 52,000 invoices annually, it used Power Automate and AI Builder to automate its invoice processing workflow. The solution was developed in just three weeks, saving over 300 labor-intensive manual entry hours for a single supplier alone. Because of this success, Komatsu Australia also launched their own citizen developer program, to inspire and empower employees to build their own business solutions. The program, which has begun with its first cohort since the pilot, is helping divisions and departments across Komatsu to innovate quickly and to streamline processes and improve efficiency through automation and digitisation.

title: WorkTrips.com sprowadza obsługę wyjazdów służbowych do kilku kliknięć dzięki Azure
executive_summary: WorkTrips.com is a Polish company offering a modern platform that optimizes costs, automates processes, and provides care during business trips. To handle multiple requests at high speed and to simplify the flow of arranging business travel, it connects various Azure services via Azure Virtual Networking. Users get their trips booked on time, supervisors have less work, and companies benefit from the best offers. WorkTrips.com also benefits from simplified infrastructure maintenance and global data center availability, helping protect user data in sensitive locations.
products: Azure, Azure Application Insights, Azure Marketplace, Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Virtual Network, Dynamics 365, Microsoft Entra ID

title: TeamViewer Streamlines User Experience with Microsoft Edge WebView2 Tool Integration​
executive_summary: Striving for connection. TeamViewer provides remote access and remote control computer software that has already been installed over 2.5 billion times worldwide. Their goal is to enable remote connectivity and make the working environment much simpler for all.

title: Confused.com uses Microsoft Azure to halve analytics lead times
executive_summary: Confused.com is the UK’s longest running comparison service. With a team of 300, it serves a customer base of 15 million UK consumers. To stay ahead in a competitive marketplace, Confused.com chose to update its infrastructure by moving to Microsoft Azure and using Azure AI. Confused.com has improved marketing ROI by 10 percent, reduced the analytics lead time by 50 percent and is opening up new B2B channels to deliver its services as a service.
products: Azure

title: Al-Futtaim Group gears up for hyper-personalized customer experiences with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Al-Futtaim Group is a leading family-owned business conglomerate operating across the regional automotive, financial services, real estate, retail, and health markets, representing over 200 brands and services to customers across Asia and Africa. The company has been updating its infrastructure and migrating to the cloud in the last four years. Himanshu Shrivastava, Al-Futtaim Group’s Chief Technology Officer, believes this will enable the company to leverage data analytics across all its business lines, further fulfilling its mission of enriching people’s lives through quality services.

title: Vattenfall Streamlines sales and service, scales for sustainability and growth with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Vattenfall AB is a European energy company that has electrified industries and supplied energy to people's homes for more than 100 years. With a commitment to modernizing the way people live through innovation and cooperation, the company is determined to enable fossil free living within one generation. To provide a fully connected customer experience across its different lines of business and increase customer engagement in the company’s sustainability efforts, Vattenfall needed a way to better streamline its sales and service operations. Using Microsoft Dynamics 365 Marketing, Sales, and Service, the company created a cohesive customer relationship (CRM) system—helping employees become more efficient and improving customer engagement.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights - Data, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Field Service, Dynamics 365 Sales

title: Coşkunöz Metal Form develops applications for business processes with Microsoft Power App
executive_summary: Coşkunöz Metal Form, one of Türkiye's largest companies in the automotive sector, is developing their own applications with Microsoft Power Apps to digitalize their business processes. Barış Karaadak, the General Manager of Coşkunöz Metal Form, stated that they have implemented more than 110 projects in their digitalization journey, with 46 of them using Microsoft Power Platform and providing significant benefits.

title: Enabling safe, healthy & sustainable spaces with data-led innovative IoT platform
executive_summary: Morgan Sindall Property Services is a property maintenance provider with over 30 years of experience within the housing sector. The company provides planned and reactive maintenance to over 200,000 domestic properties.
products: Azure, Power BI

title: Natuzzi uses Dynamics 365 to redefine the luxury furniture experience with a data-first approach
executive_summary: For more than 60 years, the Natuzzi name has been known for not just quality furniture, but beauty, craftsmanship, and comfort capable of enveloping the senses. The Natuzzi Group has grown from a manufacturer of sofas and armchairs to a globally hailed creator of exceptional luxury furniture that delivers a harmonious combination of design, function, aesthetics, and ethics.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights - Data, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Field Service, Dynamics 365 Sales, Power BI

title: PwC Switzerland: Increasing business value while staying compliant using the Microsoft Cloud
executive_summary: For a long time, PwC Switzerland’s ambitions to move to the cloud were limited by strict Swiss regulations around data storage and sharing. But when Microsoft established two data centers on Swiss soil, it opened the door to the opportunities the cloud could offer. The company has since embarked on a cloud transformation journey that drives greater efficiency, enhances collaboration and is yielding new innovations every day. Using Microsoft Azure, Microsoft 365 and Power Platform, the multi-year cloud transformation program has paved the way to a cloud-native future.

title: Introducing Audio Articles: A New Service for Subscribers of Le Monde Powered by Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services.
executive_summary: Founded in 1944, Le Monde, generally considered to be the French newspaper of reference, is acknowledged in France and around the world for the excellence of its writing. It currently has 555,000 subscribers, 85% of whom are digital, and the numbers are still rising.

title: Dish TV boosts platform performance by 2x with Microsoft technology and Unified Support
executive_summary: Dish TV India Limited(DishTV) is India’s leading direct-to-home (DTH) Company and owns multiple individual brands like Dish TV, Zing, and d2h under its umbrella. The company benefits from numerous satellite platforms, including SES8, GSAT-15 and ST-2. DishTV has more than 750 channels and services, including 31 audio channels and 81 HD channels and services on its platform. The company has a vast distribution network of over 2,700 distributors and around 2,40,000 dealers across 9,300 towns in India. DishTV is connected with its pan India customer base through call centers that are spread across 22 cities and are equipped to handle customer queries all-round-the-clock in 12 different languages.

title: Nexi uses Azure App Service to modernize its FinTech apps to provide a personalized payment solution to customers
executive_summary: Nexi is a European PayTech company that helps its customers pay and accept digital payments through a complete and personalized range of simple, intuitive, and secure solutions. To simplify transactions and empower people and businesses to enjoy closer relationships and prosper together, Nexi needed a unified solution with more flexibility to allow its developers to spend much less time on infrastructure activities and provide more value on delivering products. Working with Microsoft and cVation, Nexi moved forward to implement app modernization and transformation.
products: Azure, Azure API Management, Azure App Service, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Monitor, Azure Web Application Firewall

title: Dentsu builds Azure-supported analytics platform to modernize data across the organization
executive_summary: Dentsu is a marketing and advertising network dedicated to brand partnership that delivers meaningful progress and growth through unique and innovative media campaigns and bespoke data-driven solutions. The global organization spans more than 145 markets with 65,000 employees, serving 11,000 clients.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Intelligent Data Platform, Microsoft Entra ID, Excel, Power BI

title: Solving Three Problems with SAP on Azure! Kao Achieves First Large-Scale Operation of ANF in Japan and Looks Ahead to Global Expansion
executive_summary: Kao, a leading Japanese manufacturer of consumer goods and chemicals, is working with its partner Accenture to fully integrate its global SAP systems. Kao has completed the migration of ECC 6.0 in Thailand and Singapore to S/4HANA by May 2022. The company plans to modernize all SAP systems in Asia, Europe, the US, and Japan, and to centralize codes and data globally that have been managed and operated independently in each country. As the cloud platform for the SAP system, “SAP on Azure” was chosen and the project is the first large-scale case in Japan to fully adopt Azure NetApp Files.
products: Azure, Azure Backup, Azure ExpressRoute, Azure Monitor, Azure NetApp Files, Microsoft Teams

title: Năvodari Town Hall builds on the power of Microsoft Azure to bring citizens together
executive_summary: Transparency, accessibility, responsiveness to citizen needs—these are the pillars of an open government. Năvodari’s Town Hall in Romania delivers them using the power of Regista, a Microsoft Azure-based cloud platform providing document management, registration services, tax payments, and management of public requests. As a result, Navodari’s citizens can seamlessly submit requests, track cases, and review regulations from their phone or computer. While they save hours on town hall visits, civil servants keep a close check on over 200,000 documents and work more efficiently.
products: Azure

title: Azure-based PaySpace streamlines payroll for multinational companies across continents
executive_summary: Over 11,000 companies in more than 40 countries globally trust PaySpace to manage their payroll and HR software and services. Hosted on Microsoft Azure, the cloud-native software-as-a-service (SaaS) solution brings payroll information together in a highly secure, centralized, and accessible platform. By taking advantage of the Microsoft ecosystem, PaySpace helps its customers enhance collaboration, security, and scalability. One of them is multinational bottling giant Coca-Cola Beverages Africa, which saved time and costs while ensuring compliance measures in local legislatures.

title: Grundfos extends its culture of learning to every area of its business with Microsoft Viva Learning
executive_summary: Grundfos began in a moment of self-directed learning. Nearly 80 years ago, a Danish blacksmith named Poul Due Jensen created a new, more efficient irrigation pump in his basement and started the business that would become Grundfos, a heritage manufacturing company. To this day, the company maintains a culture of learning, even as it’s grown to 20,000 global employees and expanded the scope of its products and services.
products: Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Viva Learning

title: Breville’s brewing in new markets at record pace with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Breville, the quintessential kitchen appliance brand known the world over, enhances people’s lives through exceptional coffee and culinary experiences at home. Founded in Australia in 1932, the iconic maker of internationally award-winning coffee machines and premium kitchen products is on a quest to inspire people to “Master Every Moment” through thoughtful design and brilliant innovation. Breville delivers their ever-expanding inventory to more than 70 countries, empowering people to prepare food and beverages more easily and impressively than they’d thought possible in their own homes.

title: San Raffaele University and Research Hospital transforms clinical research and delivers precision medicine using the Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform
executive_summary: San Raffaele University and Research Hospital is one of the largest of its kind in Italy, as well as a pioneer of cutting-edge translational research and technology adoption at both a national and international level. During the pandemic, the organization saw an opportunity to start using artificial intelligence to better triage incoming symptomatic patients and identify their future reaction to the virus. Fast forward three years, the pilot project has been turned into an intelligent data solution powered by AI – which San Raffaele is going to use to transform clinical research, improve the end-to-end patient journey inside the hospital and accelerate its own move towards precision medicine.
customer: San Raffaele University and Research Hospital
products: Azure AI Services, Azure Virtual Machines, Intelligent Data Platform, Azure Machine Learning

title: Strauss Group gears up to revolutionize the food industry using Azure cloud-enabled data
executive_summary: Food and beverage manufacturer Strauss Group is working to make an impact on the world through food. Yoram Sadan, Vice President, Group Chief Information Officer and Digital Officer at Strauss Group, knew that investing in technology and cloud infrastructure was essential to take Strauss’s vision to the next level and connect its many offices across the globe. With Microsoft, Strauss didn’t just find a service provider, but rather a technology partner with a shared vision of the future.

title: BWT Alpine F1 Team creates a performant, data-driven culture with Power BI
executive_summary: In the world of Formula 1 racing, championships are decided by tenths of seconds, and teams must find any competitive edge they can. For BWT Alpine F1 Team, gaining a competitive advantage required adopting technology that could uncover opportunities their opponents might miss. The team knew key answers lay in their data, but disparate sources and manual entry errors made this data unreliable. Using Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management to track the supply chain for car parts and Power BI to analyze and visualize this data, BWT Alpine F1 Team was able to build a more unified data culture that promotes accuracy and transparency.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365, Power Apps, Power BI

title: Avans University of Applied Sciences: Using Azure Virtual Desktop to deliver examinations and reduce costs by €150,000 annually
executive_summary: Avans is a multisite university of applied sciences in the Netherlands, providing tertiary education to some 35,000 students. Three and a half years ago, it began its cloud journey, incorporating Microsoft Teams, Office 365, and most recently, Azure. One significant Azure use case is Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD), which has saved Avans tens of thousands of Euros annually and made essential software available to any student with a standard laptop. AVD is now being used to deliver tests and examinations as the university continues to explore the possibilities of a cloud-based future.

title: Swift innovates with Azure confidential computing to help secure global financial transactions
executive_summary: With the rapid increase of cross border transactions, and growth in instant payment networks, the financial services industry is focusing on fighting fraud that can cost hundreds of billions annually. As the leading infrastructure provider for financial messaging services, Swift has long worked with its community of over 11,500 institutions to drive new ways to detect and catch fraudulent transactions. And now it is working with Microsoft to innovate further in the fight against financial crime. Using federated learning techniques along with Azure Machine Learning and Azure confidential computing, Swift and Microsoft are building an anomaly detection model for transactional data—all without copying or moving data from secure locations. The shared vision is that the model will become the new standard for reducing financial crime while achieving the highest level of security, privacy, and cost efficiency.
products: Microsoft Purview, Azure Machine Learning

title: Maximum flexibility in the device supply chain: Arvato accelerates workflows in the warehouse with image recognition via Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: E-commerce is booming. Manufacturers and retailers, meanwhile, are placing high demands on logistics: even pre-packaged warehouse goods need to be quickly and reliably adaptable to changed requirements. At Microsoft fulfilment centers postponement activities are completed to support greater flexibility in the geographic regions. This involves packaging and accessory changes to enable regional variations to be supported. With image recognition and artificial intelligence, Arvato ensures that no mistakes occur in the process – the new platform solution based on Microsoft Azure ensures higher throughput, reduces costs, and has the potential to be rolled out globally to other areas of Arvato.

title: MHI uses ARO to standardize systems and create common components and drives DX as a leader in engineering and manufacturing
executive_summary: As a leading engineering and manufacturing company, Mitsubishi Heavy Industries (MHI) is accelerating the use of containers. The main goal of using containers is to standardize its system development and use common components to quickly and flexibly create a development platform.
products: Azure, Azure ExpressRoute, Azure Firewall, Azure Red Hat OpenShift, Microsoft Entra ID

title: Reflecting on emotions and their impact on engaged learning: Lessons from The Stour Academy Trust
executive_summary: The Stour Academy Trust is a multi-academy trust at the forefront of providing a 21st century education for children, which services the county of Kent in Southeast England. Stour Academy educators look toward Kent’s future vis-à-vis their students. The staff and faculty in charge work diligently to create a new pedagogical model that focuses on student voice, choice, and collaboration. To help bring this vision to life Stour Academy has embraced Microsoft 365 A5, Microsoft Teams, and Microsoft Reflect, a check-in app to enhance social emotional learning and facilitate education for students across a variety of backgrounds.

title: Government Savings Bank digitalizes operations to serve customers better with Power Apps
executive_summary: Government Savings Bank aims to build a sustainable economy by eliminating poverty and reducing inequality in Thailand. To reach this goal, the bank looked into digital transformation to improve its financial services and serve Thai people’s needs. It sought Microsoft Power Apps and Power Platform’s capabilities to establish a digital branch for customers as well as optimize internal hiring, reporting, and data collection processing. As a result, operations have become agile, increasing customer and employee satisfaction.

title: ÖBB Rail Cargo Group transforms its supply chain operations with Microsoft Azure App Service
executive_summary: The ÖBB Rail Cargo Group is a leading rail logistics provider in Europe on a mission to shape the industry and set new standards in innovation using technology. To do this, the organization has embarked on a digital transformation journey centered around shifting to the cloud. The program has since led to the creation of MIKE, a digital assistant and industry-first intelligent hybrid platform designed to support end-to-end supply chain operations for ÖBB Rail Cargo Group and its customers.
products: Azure, Azure App Service

title: ÖBB Rail Cargo Group transforms its supply chain operations with Microsoft Azure App Service
executive_summary: The ÖBB Rail Cargo Group is a leading rail logistics provider in Europe on a mission to shape the industry and set new standards in innovation using technology. To do this, the organization has embarked on a digital transformation journey centered around shifting to the cloud. The program has since led to the creation of MIKE, a digital assistant and industry-first intelligent hybrid platform designed to support end-to-end supply chain operations for ÖBB Rail Cargo Group and its customers.

title: Engagely.ai delivers more natural conversations, multi-lingual support and intuitive workflows with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Engagely.ai offers modern, AI-based, full-stack Customer Experience (CX) automation solutions. It empowers clients and their customers across industries to deliver exceptional customer experiences.
products: Azure, SAP on Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Sentinel, Power Apps, Power BI

title: SENCE adopta la nube de Azure y consigue brindar un servicio eficiente en subsidios de empleo
executive_summary: SENCE adopted Microsoft Cloud solutions in order to create a tool to meet the subsidy requests of more than three million citizens. Thanks to Azure, they were able to offer a stable and efficient solution.

title: Varroc Engineering steers high productivity with SAP on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Varroc Engineering Limited (Varroc) is a tier-1 automotive component manufacturer. It supplies exterior lighting systems, powertrains, electrical and electronics body and chassis parts worldwide to passenger car and motorcycle segments. Founded in 1990, the company is headquartered at Aurangabad in Maharashtra, India. With over 30 manufacturing facilities in India, four in the European Union (EU), and one each in Vietnam and China, along with two engineering centers in India and one in the EU, Varroc has a prominent worldwide presence.
products: Azure, Azure Storage, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Halwani Brothers Egypt brings internal processes into a well-oiled machine with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Halwani Brothers Company has been one of the pioneers of the food industry in the Middle East for over 50 years. To streamline its internal processes and sustain its growth, the company’s Egyptian branch brought supply chain, commerce, human resources, and finance efforts together in Microsoft Dynamics 365 and integrated the solution with external systems. “With more automation, visibility, and accuracy, we have been able to manage our processes with fewer resources and no hassle,” says Khaled Akl, CEO at Halwani Brothers Egypt.

title: Swedbank migrates big data platform to Azure Cloud for enhanced security and scalability
executive_summary: Swedbank is a multinational bank with a 200-year history. Recently, the company took the bold decision to migrate its big data platform to the cloud in search of greater scalability and security. With Azure Databricks functioning at the core of this solution, the successful migration has brought the bank a wealth of benefits. From reduced time-to-market and cost savings to significant improvements in its ability to detect fraud – it has set the bank and its 7.7 million customers on course for a more secure future.

title: Power Apps as a bridge to SAP: Automated digital customer orders for WENKO field service
executive_summary: Founded in 1959, WENKO-WENSELAAR GmbH & Co. KG is one of the leading suppliers of innovative product solutions for bathroom, kitchen, laundry, and living with a range of over 5,000 articles. Around 500 new ones are added every year—from soap dispensers to dehumidifiers to stylish home accessories. Approximately half of these products are sold to DIY and furniture stores by the company’s field service reps. In the past, the reps would generate orders on paper or using a laptop. But now, the family-owned company uses automated processes via Power Platform and a scan app based on Power Apps. This avoids errors and shortens lead times.

title: Unilever migrates its SAP estate to Azure in 18 months, fueling unconstrained capacity for business growth
executive_summary: As one of the world’s largest consumer goods companies, Unilever and its brands are household names. To support its business needs and those of more than 3.4 billion daily consumers across 190 countries, Unilever set strategic transformational goals to modernize its infrastructure and drive growth across the company. Part of that ambitious strategy was a migration of its SAP and non-SAP environments, including its four core enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems, to Microsoft Azure. Unilever’s move to Azure has brought greater efficiency, scalability, and availability, including highly secure storage—all designed to position the company for a more sustainable and cloud-native future.

title: HSBC innovates with Microsoft Power Apps to make impressive savings
executive_summary: “Technology is helping us to streamline our customer journeys,” explains Richard Lord, MD, Regional CIO, Wholesale – Asia Pacific at HSBC. “We are streamlining transactions and reducing the time it takes for customers to get on with the business they need to do.”

title: Renewtrak builds subscription renewal platform around Azure SQL Database, serverless compute and data services
executive_summary: Renewtrak has revolutionized the subscription renewal process with a solution that provides small, medium, and enterprise organizations with subscription-based products and services. The company’s renewal management platform removes friction from the renewal process, helping ensure that customers’ subscriptions are maintained and optimized while creating a new level of ongoing customer satisfaction and engagement. Built with highly secure and compliant Microsoft Azure managed compute and data infrastructure, the Renewtrak solution serves a global community of subscription vendors and channel partners who have experienced significant improvements in accounts receivable and net revenue retention.

title: More intelligent banking and innovative customer engagement for Goals101 with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Goals101 is on a mission to make banking personalized, automated, and delightful. It is a Transaction Behavioral Intelligence (TBI) company that accelerates business growth for banks using Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Learning (ML).

title: Enhancing learning outcomes and empowering teachers with Microsoft
executive_summary: Brunei’s Lambak Kanan Jalan 49 Primary School has been at the forefront of digital transformation in education. By participating in the Digital Classroom initiative and the Microsoft Showcase Incubator Programme and relying on Microsoft 365, and Windows devices, the school has helped its 50 teachers earn the Microsoft Innovative Educators (MIEE) certification. “The program has empowered us to bring leadership, learning, and technology together and build a safe, secure, optimized, and efficient school,” shares Hajah Noorliah, the school’s Headmistress.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: SysCorp automates payroll tax calculation using KAISPE’s FlexPayroll, built on Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: SysCorp, a technology solutions provider in Uganda, has been serving the needs of small and medium-sized businesses in the region since 1988. A recent challenge for the company’s customers involved manual payroll tax calculation, which was time-consuming and prone to error. SysCorp collaborated with Microsoft partner KAISPE, whose FlexPayroll add-in for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance automated the calculation process. This resulted in a 90 percent improvement in operational efficiency, and SysCorp's customers were able to comply with regulatory requirements.

title: How the Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform enables Ahold Delhaize to drive value across its brand ecosystem
executive_summary: As one of the world’s largest food retail groups, Ahold Delhaize is devoted to improving the lives of its customers using technology. To do this, the company has embarked on a digital transformation journey that centers around boosting its loyalty and personalization programs. Powered by the Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform, Ahold Delhaize’s solution is helping to provide more personalized services to the millions of people in its customer base. All while allowing it to be more environmentally conscious and to make more of its data.

title: Taiho Pharmaceutical’s latest web conferencing solution, adopting Microsoft Teams Rooms and Logitech VC for further convenience and comfort
executive_summary: Established in 1963, Taiho Pharmaceutical Co., Ltd. (hereafter Taiho Pharmaceutical), a pharmaceutical company under the Otsuka group, is actively engaged in developing new drugs and is known as a pioneer in oral anticancer drugs. The company operates globally in two main business areas: pharmaceutical (prescription drugs) and consumer healthcare. In the pharmaceutical field, the company focuses its research and development in three areas: oncology, allergy/immunology, and urology. In the consumer healthcare field, it manufactures and sells products that are familiar and closely related to people’s daily lives, such as nutritional drinks, gastrointestinal medicines, troches (lozenges), and virus removal and antibacterial sprays.
products: Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Teams Rooms

title: Dashboard solutions from admins for admins: Dr. Oetker is continuously increasing the security of its IT infrastructure with Azure and Power BI
executive_summary: Keeping virus scanners up to date, updating operating systems to the latest version, encrypting all devices to prevent cyberattacks: to manage these tasks, companies establish extensive IT security and compliance guidelines, which need to be measured in terms of effectiveness and reviewed on a regular basis. For the IT organization at Dr. August Oetker Nahrungsmittel KG, this used to mean manually collecting security status data from multiple systems and spending two weeks sending reminders to update operating systems as well as security solutions and settings. Reducing the time it took to do this called for a comprehensive and integrated overview, plus automatic assignment, reminder, and cleanup processes. Today, it is done using aggregated data sources—local or from the Azure cloud—and central dashboards visualized using Power BI. This gives Dr. Oetker global transparency on the state of its IT landscape in a way that is user-friendly and organized according to target groups. As a result, the company can more easily keep this landscape up to date, thus increasing the security of its infrastructure.
products: Azure, Intelligent Data Platform, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Intune, Excel, Power BI, Windows 11

title: How the Portuguese healthcare sector is upskilling its workforce to provide better care using Microsoft Teams and Power Platform
executive_summary: The Portuguese healthcare sector is going through a huge phase of digital transformation. The past three years have forced it to change the way it works and operates, accelerating its transition to the cloud and the introduction of collaborative tools within its key processes and everyday tasks. In support of this shift, the Portuguese Ministry of Health has launched a six-month digital skilling initiative that aims at helping the four primary care institutions in the country to gain greater confidence around these solutions. Ultimately fostering greater collaboration and helping them to deliver better care.

title: Indonesian university creates game-changing courses for higher education with Azure-based solutions
executive_summary: Universitas Terbuka collaborating with 9 other universities in Indonesia offers open and distance learning opportunities through its Indonesia Cyber Education Institute (ICE Institute). It decided to expand its courses to offer game development, driven by the Indonesian government’s commitment to growing the country’s pool of digital talents. The company chose Microsoft Dynamics 365 for its out-of-the-box and customizable tools and the ability it provided to build in modules to create unique processes and prioritize specific customer experiences. Within eighteen months, Lynk & Co was able to ramp up a significant digital presence in Belgium, France, Germany, Italy, Netherlands, Spain, and Sweden, as well as opening social clubs designed to bring the company’s online brand to life through community focused events.

To this end, German start-up Connected Products—which forms part of fischerwerke GmbH & Co. KG—chose to base its Construction Monitoring solution on Azure IoT. Based in Baden-Württemberg, fischerwerke is a family-run SME that specializes in fixing and fastening technologies. executive_summary: Eurobank, a robust financial organization based in Greece and operating in 6 countries, embraces excellence through targeted learning and personal development initiatives for its people. title: Solutions you can bank on: Recording Insights for the financial sector—ASC Technologies offers regulation-compliant documentation in Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Investment consultations are recorded as a matter of course, as stipulated by finance laws and policy regulations such as MiFID II in Europe, the FCA rules in the UK, and the Dodd-Frank Act in the US. This means that around the world, millions of consultation recordings have to be stored, secured, and analyzed in compliance with legal provisions—otherwise, financial institutions could receive hefty fines or even lose their banking license. For online consultations that take place on Microsoft Teams, ASC Technologies AG developed its Recording Insights digital solution. Where once only spot checks were possible, an artificial intelligence (AI) named the Compliance Policy Engine makes it possible to evaluate 100 percent of recordings, simplifying compliance with legal requirements. As an expert in compliance recording for highly regulated sectors, ASC relies on Azure Cognitive Services and integration into the Microsoft Cloud for Financial Services.

executive_summary: “Through the journey with Microsoft, we have taken huge steps in terms of modernising our technology,” says Henry Lee, Head of Digital Workplace at Reed.

By moving its SAP landscape to Microsoft Azure, Hilti enabled its IT team to move any remaining server infrastructure, including Linux and Windows workloads, to the Microsoft cloud and close down its on-premises datacenter, increasing resilience, minimizing downtime, and preparing for more rapid growth.

Data is now usable across the entire group, helping to empower patients and provide better health outcomes – providing a compelling example of how a large healthcare network can harmonize data on a national scale.

A key part of that vision is making video banking as simple, seamless, and secure as possible. “We want to make sure that customers can have digital advice wherever and whenever they want,” he says.

Finding ways to enable self-service lets his team focus on enhancing business operations. “We were getting a lot of last-minute requests for Microsoft SharePoint sites from different groups across the company,” Carl says. “With our strict security and corporate branding requirements across our many organizations, we were forced to follow a manual process and do it ourselves.” But when Centrica, a leading energy services and solutions company, deployed the Collaboration Area Request (CAR) solution from the Microsoft Customer Success team, Carl got his wish.

The result: a reimagined security posture that provides enterprise-level protection at a small or medium-sized business price tag. With its Microsoft 365 productivity solutions, Azure, and Power Apps, Nordic Pet Care Group is ready to keep flourishing.

Its Track and Trace Parcel System allows internal services to track parcel deliveries and provides information to customers on the front end. Originally using a costly on-premises solution, the company needed a more scalable database to meet increased traffic and prepare for the future. With Azure SQL Database Hyperscale, Deutsche Post has achieved scalability and flexibility, reduced downtime and response time for requests, and greatly increased their number of service updates per year.

Even before the pandemic, SAP's global workforce meant distributed teams needed to collaborate effectively and lead customer engagements across regions.
