GAC’s Chief Information Officer Martin Wallgren and his team migrated the group’s on-premises data centers to the cloud and built an integrated data platform—Pegasus. By doing so, they created a platform that puts GAC in a position to offer better, quicker services to customers, which sets it apart from its competitors.
products: Azure, Power BI

title: Profi brings automation and efficiency to more than 1,645 stores with Power Apps
executive_summary: Profi, one of the largest and fastest-growing retailers in Romania, wanted to manage more efficiently its network of over 1,645 stores. Together with partner Crayon and Pepas Cloud, Profi built multiple tailored solutions. The applications were designed to streamline internal audits, eliminate errors, double auditor productivity, enhance store compliance and customer experience. Additionally, another solution brought automation and visibility to employee task management, saving team members more than 30 minutes every day.

title: Connecting with 500 million passionate fans worldwide
executive_summary: With 500 million fans worldwide, the Real Madrid Football Club is among the world’s top sports franchises. But with just a small fraction of those fans in Spain, it needed a way to connect with them—wherever they are in the world—and support their club passion. To accomplish that goal, Real Madrid engaged a Microsoft Services team for help in envisioning, developing, and deploying a global digital sports platform that was built using a wide range of Microsoft cloud services. It takes advantage of the global footprint of Microsoft cloud services to consistently deliver the very best fan experience anywhere in the world. Real Madrid can now engage one-on-one with fans, implement targeted promotional campaigns, and use data to track and analyze fan behaviors, among many other capabilities. Today, club officials report digital revenue growth of 30 percent and could not be more positive about the club’s digital future.
products: Azure, Azure AI Search, Azure App Service, Azure Cloud Services, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Data Factory, Azure Storage, Azure Stream Analytics, Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Microsoft Entra External ID

title: UK retailer, Marks and Spencer, uses Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI to drive powerful insights
executive_summary: Marks and Spencer (M&S) is a UK-based retailer that delivers food, clothing, home and beauty goods to more than 30 million customers around the world each year. Founded in 1884, the retailer now has over 1,400 stores across 57 countries and 100+ websites. Over the years, M&S has been known for product innovation and swiftly adapting to the ever-changing demands of its customers, and more recently prides itself on customer-focused digital innovation, prioritizing collaboration and technology to better serve its customers as a leading omnichannel retailer.

title: Connecting with 500 million passionate fans worldwide
executive_summary: With 500 million fans worldwide, the Real Madrid Football Club is among the world’s top sports franchises. But with just a small fraction of those fans in Spain, it needed a way to connect with them—wherever they are in the world—and support their club passion. To accomplish that goal, Real Madrid engaged a Microsoft Services team for help in envisioning, developing, and deploying a global digital sports platform that was built using a wide range of Microsoft cloud services. It takes advantage of the global footprint of Microsoft cloud services to consistently deliver the very best fan experience anywhere in the world. Real Madrid can now engage one-on-one with fans, implement targeted promotional campaigns, and use data to track and analyze fan behaviors, among many other capabilities. Today, club officials report digital revenue growth of 30 percent and could not be more positive about the club’s digital future.

title: OECD: Pushing the Boundaries of Data Sharing to Shape Better Public Policy with Power BI and its SDMX Power BI Connector
executive_summary: The Organization for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD), one of the world's largest and most trusted sources of comparative socio-economic analysis, recently established the Microsoft Power BI business intelligence tool for data visualizations. At the heart of this adoption is the idea to provide accessible evidence to support decision-making for public policies promoting prosperity, equal opportunity and well-being. A step further has been taken to accelerate the exploitation of data for policy. Let’s take a look at the newly certified connection between Power BI and SDMX.

title: Verofax bridges gap between brands and consumers with Martech tool on Azure
executive_summary: Verofax, a Martech solution company from the United Arab Emirates, specializes in transforming how brands connect and nurture direct engagement with customers with product twinning, create immersive experiences and virtual assets rewards direct-to-consumer. Verofax is built on Azure-powered technology to tag items and direct consumers into immersive digital experiences and offer virtual assets as rewards to boost customer long term value (CLTV). Fortune 500 beverage brands had applied the solution offering to give consumers a chance to win tickets to the FIFA World Cup by scanning the unique QR code on every product and having their purchase verified to access rewards. The frictionless interaction, led to over a million customers acquired, while lowering acquisition costs 20-fold and increasing conversion rates 50-fold vs under the cap or behind the label consumer promotions.

title: Microsoft 365 Empowers Smart Office and the Digital Transformation of AXA Tianping
executive_summary: A smart collaboration platform is the foundation vital to AXA Tianping’s digital transformation. The platform, instead of a mashup of multiple products, shall incorporate various solutions with a core, which is Microsoft 365.
customer: AXA Tianping Property & Casualty Insurance Company Limited
products: Exchange Online, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business, Microsoft Intune

title: Vodafone uses Azure DevOps to power agile transformation
executive_summary: “Your ability to respond, react, to stay relevant, to innovate and to compete comes down to your ability to release value to your customers as frequently as possible. That’s why Azure DevOps is such an important underpinning for business success and for cultural change,” says Ben Connolly, Global Head of Cloud Engineering & Head of Digital Engineering UK at Vodafone. “It really has revolutionised how we work.”

title: HelloTalk: The world's largest language exchange platform empowers language learners with Azure AI
executive_summary: HelloTalk is the world's largest language exchange app, founded in 2012. The app connects language learners based on their native language and the language they want to learn, allowing them to practice and exchange language, culture and more. With support for over 160 languages and users from over 200 countries, HelloTalk is a truly global platform that provides a diverse and inclusive community for language learners.
products: Azure, Azure AI Services

title: „isLucid“ kuria ir plėtoja DI susitikimų asistentą su „Microsoft Teams“ ir „Azure“ parduotuve
executive_summary: Lithuanian startup isLucid built an AI digital meeting assistant to help companies have more productive meeting outcomes.  After creating its first product for Microsoft Teams, isLucid grew its business by joining Microsoft for Startup programs, leveraging valuable expertise and resources. By introducing its app on Microsoft Azure Marketplace, isLucid gained customers from more than 40 countries in six months. The company has since helped people save up to 25 percent of time spent on meetings.

title: SEGES Innovation drives sustainable transformation in agriculture using AI and a new data science vision
executive_summary: Leading agricultural knowledge and innovation center in Denmark SEGES Innovation has one mission: to put farmers and food companies at the forefront of sustainable and innovative agriculture. To do this, the company is applying machine learning to develop models and software tailored to the needs of the farmers and partners it serves. The project has proved so successful that SEGES decided to take it to the next level –adopting a new machine learning operations (MLOps) platform that’s abstracting away repeatable tasks and unlocking more dynamic analysis, training and deployment at scale. It is all taking SEGES one step closer to its global goal: enabling sustainable farming in Denmark and beyond.

title: Teknosa detects attacks 18 times faster with Microsoft Security Solutions
executive_summary: Customers are at the heart of Sabancı Holding’s Teknosa. Based in Türkiye, the retailer offers high quality technology products and services to delight customers all over the country. Teknosa envisions to maintain its leadership in the geographies where it operates with its innovative and differential quality products and services. For this cause, Ulaş Kaya, Information Security Manager at Teknosa, ensures operations continue safely. By replacing multiple solutions with Microsoft Defender, Kaya fast checks security with one dashboard and ensures business continuity for the company.

title: MTN South Africa harnesses Microsoft Power Platform to slash fraud risk
executive_summary: Launched in 1994, MTN South Africa is a subsidiary of MTN Group, a leading emerging market operator with a clear vision to lead the delivery of a bold new digital world to our customers. We are inspired by our belief that everyone deserves the benefits of a modern connected life. The MTN Group is listed on the JSE Securities Exchange in South Africa under the share code ‘MTN’. Our strategy, Ambition 2025, is anchored on building the largest and most valuable platform business, with a clear focus on Africa. Visit www.mtn.com or www.mtn.co.za for more information.

title: Raise your organization's awareness of the importance of data
executive_summary: Executive Summary

title: Wedel Software disrupts audio advertising and broadcast radio with Azure AI
executive_summary: Wedel Software was founded in January 2000 by Raoul Wedel, although he started to invent the system more than a decade earlier when computers were first used to automate radio. Today, his company offers an AI audio advertising solution, Adthos Platform, which features over 40 AI voices, including Azure AI’s Neural Text to Speech offering, and direct publishing capabilities. The company also uses Azure AI’s Custom Neural Voice to add new talent to the list of AI voice options and helps brands quickly deliver and scale audio ads to market.

title: Raise your organization's awareness of the importance of data
executive_summary: Executive Summary

title: AG Insurance gets closer to its customers by modernizing on Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: For nearly 200 years, AG Insurance has been providing a wide range of insurance products to its customers across Belgium. As insurance customers have become more digitally savvy, companies have started to capitalize on data to provide personalized products and reduce friction, for instance, during the claims process. As AG Insurance moved in the same direction, its on-premises solution became strained from the sheer volume of data it was processing. To revitalize its platform and offer more scalability and elasticity, the organization partnered with Microsoft and Hexaware to design an intelligent data platform that allows AG Insurance to utilize accurate and timely data to enhance customer service. AG Insurance now has the tools to effectively harness customer data and build solutions that provide an improved, personalized experience to keep it at the forefront of the insurance industry.
products: Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Analytics, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: Nedbank brings 28,600 employees closer together with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Nedbank, a South African bank spread across three continents, strives to become a great digital place to work at. “Our vision is to enable our staff to work from anywhere, anytime, on any device,” says Asokan Moodley, Executive Head of End User and Communication Experience at Nedbank. To integrate staff conference calls into daily work, Nedbank deployed Microsoft Teams Phone and Teams Rooms throughout its organization. This brought more efficiency and collaboration while saving time and cost, leading to faster service and increased customer satisfaction.

title: Sagra Technology oferuje rozwiązania dla biznesu, skalując ich zasięg dzięki Azure Marketplace
executive_summary: Sagra Technology creates IT solutions to help companies better manage sales, marketing, and analytics. The company wanted to expand access to its products, notably Power Translate, a tool for automatically translating Power BI reports within seconds. After introducing the solution on Azure Marketplace, Sagra Technology enabled companies from more than 50 countries to seamlessly access its solutions with simple procurement, payments and without time-consuming process of agreement signing. Sagra Technology’s customers, such as Westfalia Fruit, a global avocado production leader, can now make data-driven decisions and easily share corporate insights without language barriers.

title: Automotive Quality Control leader HOLLEN grows business, boosts security with Microsoft 365 Business Premium
executive_summary: When automotive manufacturers and suppliers need to ensure that their products adhere to a high standard of excellence, HOLLEN technicians arrive onsite to deliver quality control services. “We provide everything from simple visual control to highly complex quality control solutions,” explains Branislav Krampl, Director of Information and Communications Technology, Internal Processes Optimalization and Marketing at HOLLEN s.r.o. HOLLEN has already experienced remarkable growth since its origins as a small, family-run business in 2001. The company expanded from a single location in a family home in Slovakia―where business meetings were held in the living room―to multiple locations, and it now operates in four countries across 14 sites. From the beginning, HOLLEN focused on quality, flexibility, and well-trained people, with a goal to be the best in the market.
products: Exchange Online, Microsoft 365 Business Premium, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Secure Score, SharePoint

title: NHS Supply Chain boosts productivity with Microsoft Surface devices
executive_summary: “Knowing what I know now, if we hadn’t made the choice we did, I would have been gutted,” says Chris Gundel, IT Operations Manager at NHS Supply Chain. “The Microsoft Surface devices are a phenomenal product.”

title: NTT Communications adds insider risk management to enhance data security with Microsoft Purview
executive_summary: NTT Communications Corporation has long focused on updating its cybersecurity risk posture against external attacks. Based on an analysis of the evolving threat landscape, the company decided to take a new approach in protecting its information assets. NTT Communications is using Microsoft Purview to provide communication transparency and data protection so that it can quickly identify internal risks in its remote work environment. Additionally, the company has created a work environment that fosters productivity and collaboration while still giving IT security staff peace of mind by enabling them to investigate anomalies before critical incidents occur rather than excessively relying on past log events after the fact.

title: Raiffeisen Bank Serbia revolutionizes risk management with low-code technology and data
executive_summary: Raiffeisen Bank International (RBI) is one of Europe’s leading financial organizations, committed to providing outstanding services across the CEE region using technology. As part of these efforts, the group’s Serbian entity is currently pioneering a journey of digital transformation aimed at optimizing everything from internal communications to data analytics and risk management processes. Driven by a long-standing partnership with Microsoft, the initiative is already transforming the way Raiffeisen Bank Serbia – as well as the rest of the group – operates, uses data, and empowers employees.

title: Repsol inspires a multinational community of citizen developers with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: Spanish multi-energy company Repsol is on a mission to empower its employees with the help of technology. As part of this goal, the organization has partnered with Microsoft and Kabel to create the Do It Yourself program – an initiative aimed at encouraging citizen development across its global workforce. Rolled out just 18 months ago, the project has already found outstanding success at Repsol, helping to build a new community of innovation-driven citizen developers and save millions in costs.

title: Georgian Ministry of Education leverages remote admin control for school laptops with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: The Ministry of Education, Science, Culture, and Sport of Georgia continues to follow its mission to create a modern and innovative educational environment. However, the ministry needed administrative solutions to remotely manage students’ laptops better after creating virtual classes and game-based learning with Microsoft 365 tools. The institution optimized its IT by implementing Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot, and Windows 11. With the new tools, laptops can be connected, cleaned, and repaired remotely. Robust cybersecurity policies also enable to protect children’s personal data when they’re browsing online from home.

title: Sigma Loyalty Group transforms business through future-proof infrastructure
executive_summary: Sigma Loyalty Group provides enhancement services and solutions across industries. As a provider of identity and information protection services, Sigma’s business has been in high demand and on a growth trajectory, but its inability to seamlessly scale and cost-effectively maintain its infrastructure and ecosystem slowed them down. Sigma needed to modernize its services, from on-premises servers to the cloud and from traditional applications to web apps. Azure-fueled digital transformation helped Sigma Group increase availability, improve infrastructure security and improve overall business performance.

title: HELLENiQ ENERGY optimized its document signing process with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Greece-based HELLENiQ ENERGY is one of Southeastern Europe’s leading energy groups, with a presence in six countries and activities spanning the energy value chain. To accelerate its digital transformation, the company needed to automate its vast Document Management processes. Together with Partner Team Candi, HELLENiQ ENERGY deployed a Microsoft Cloud-based system with DocuSign integration—shortening the document signing process from days to mere hours.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Power BI, SharePoint

title: Investment innovator Vontobel triples compute capacity using elastic Azure high-performance computing
executive_summary: When COVID-19 emerged in early 2020, global financial markets were hit with unprecedented turmoil and disruption. Vontobel, a global investment firm with Swiss roots that specializes in wealth management, active asset management, and investment solutions, felt the effects acutely. Creating and managing some of the company’s most important financial products requires significant technology resources, and the company’s capabilities were put to the test during the turmoil.

title: Leading IT infrastructure and services company NTT Ltd. achieves unified, global cloud transformation with Azure
executive_summary: NTT Ltd. is a global leader in IT infrastructure and services. The company provides a broad variety of business expertise in networks, security, managed services, and other areas, serving more than 75 percent of the top 100 companies on the Fortune Global 500 list. In digital terms, NTT is also enormous, with a diverse and often complex set of digital environments to run and maintain, comprising more than 25,000 servers and 2,200 applications hosted in more than 50 datacenters.

title: Liebherr-Components and Reycom deliver end to end RISE Security with Microsoft Defender for IoT for Linux and Windows IoT
executive_summary: A time of profound technological advances calls for equally innovative strategies to support that change. Liebherr-Components answered that challenge by joining forces with Reycom AG, a global player in the TV, smart living, and Internet of Things (IoT) sectors. Together, they provide a ready-to-use, highly secure, end-to-end IoT solution, RISE (Reycom Industrial Secure Edge platform), to external customers. The partners needed an IoT security solution to support their innovation, and they found it in Microsoft Defender for IoT and Device Update for Azure IoT Hub. The synergy between the companies points to a promising new era in connected IoT solutions for a smarter, safer world.
products: Azure, Azure IoT Hub

title: How Aker Solutions is using cloud technology to empower its disparate workforce
executive_summary: Global integrated energy services company Aker Solutions is determined to bring about sustainable change in the energy sector. With a strategic focus on low-carbon and renewable solutions, and an ambitious target of having net-zero carbon emissions by 2050, the company is prioritizing digitalization as a method to achieve its goals. The company’s transition to Azure Virtual Desktop (AVD) exemplifies this drive. Intended to address latency and workload issues, while empowering its remote offshore installation workers with the high-performance compute (HPC) capabilities they need to undertake their work, AVD is supporting Aker Solutions to keep its disparate workforce united as it leads from the front in the global energy transition.
products: Azure, Azure Virtual Desktop

title: ElliQ by Intuition Robotics gains an extra layer of empathy with Azure Text to Speech
executive_summary: Intuition Robotics is on a mission to help older adults live happier, healthier, and more connected lives. Its AI-powered companion robot, ElliQ, engages its users with activities and conversations and encourages them to stay mentally and physically sharp. The original voice of ElliQ was flat, monotonous, and could not convey the range of emotions needed to help users feel comfortable, stay interested, and build trust with their new digital companion. After a comprehensive search of different voices, Intuition Robotics selected the prebuilt Azure Text to Speech voice ‘Sara,’ which has improved ElliQ’s intonation, inflexion, and ultimately enhanced both empathy and overall sound quality.

title: Amrita University begins Zero Trust journey by protecting identities with Azure AD and other Microsoft enterprise solutions
executive_summary: If you think of humanity’s intellectual endeavors as some of its most valuable riches, you’d probably consider universities to be treasure houses. Their vast reserves of research materials and new ideas might hold the answers to some of the world’s pressing problems. This analogy illustrates why Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham, a leading Indian university, scrupulously manages identities. It trusts Azure Active Directory to verify that people who access its data are who they say they are. The university is also on the path to deploy Microsoft Defender suite to advance its security journey and pave the way to a Zero Trust infrastructure.

title: NHS makes data more discoverable using Azure Cognitive Search to save clinician’s time
executive_summary: “This problem is not unique to our Trust,” states Jonathon Artingstall, Associate Director Information & Performance at Cambridgeshire and Peterborough NHS Foundation Trust. “We’ve taken lots of data in all shapes and formats from different systems and put it into a cloud storage solution so it can be used today. Who knows what lies in those 23 years of data? Now we have the capability to explore that.”

title: Norway’s OBOS builds premier customer engagement model with Dynamics 365 Customer Insights and Marketing
executive_summary: Nothing is quite as personal as our homes. Jobs change, relationships happen, families grow. When the region’s largest housing developer is a member-owned cooperative, the personal nature of the business takes on a new meaning. Established in 1929, OBOS engages not only in the development and sale of homes and properties, but banking and financial solutions, property management, real estate brokerage, and other forms of service production in the housing and property sector. The Oslo-based organization is a cooperative owned by its approximately 550,000 members, and all post-tax profits are reinvested in the organization to achieve the goal of building quality homes for its members.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights - Data

title: Nagarro increases efficiency by integrating worldwide employees, systems, and data with Microsoft Cloud solutions
executive_summary: Nagarro is a global leader in digital product engineering. With its forward-thinking, agile, and caring mindset, it drives technology-led business breakthroughs and helps its clients transform, adapt, and build new ways into the future. The company delivers exceptional customer outcomes by leveraging its expertise across multiple industries and cutting-edge technology. Listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange, Nagarro is growing exponentially, with a team of over 18,000 employees across 33 countries.

title: DataPlatform with Microsoft Synapse and Databricks
executive_summary: Logisfashion, logistics operator specialized in the textile and fashion sector, started in 2012 the migration of all its data to the Microsoft Synapse cloud, concluding the project in 2017 with the creation of its Warehouse Management System LogisCore.
products: Azure Databricks, Power Apps, Power BI

title: From customer contact to accounting: Dynamics 365 Business Central helps RECARO Gaming manage data with ease
executive_summary: RECARO Gaming GmbH & Co. KG is an expert for high-quality gaming and eSport chairs. The former gaming start-up has now established itself internationally as a premium provider, which presents its corporate IT with certain challenges: getting each gaming chair to the customer involves different partners, systems, and interfaces, while the many process steps and the sheer amount of coordination required make for complex workflows. So, with a view to reducing tool discontinuities, increasing transparency in data and processes, and integrating new sales channels and markets, RECARO Gaming made Dynamics 365 Business Central the linchpin of its centralized ERP landscape.
products: Dynamics 365 Business Central

title: Lallemand ferments its digital evolution with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The act of fermentation is fundamentally about change. Microorganisms break down carbohydrates, producing a wide range of metabolites, such as enzymes or ethanol, that are crucial in the production of bread, wine, yogurt, pharmaceuticals, and biofuels. Family-owned since its founding, Montreal-based Lallemand has used this imperceptible process to become a global leader in yeast and bacteria production with 11 business units spanning 5 continents.

title: IPLAND helps top brands score in-store sales with Microsoft Azure AutoML
executive_summary: IPLAND helps major fast-moving consumer goods companies optimize their products’ on-shelf presence. Its Image Recognition (IR) service analyzes photos of store shelves, extracting and surfacing critical performance data to help fine-tune retail displays. When a rapidly growing customer base drove the company to find more scalable solutions, IPLAND updated its IR service to take advantage of Microsoft Azure Automated Machine Learning. This updated and refined solution has improved image recognition speed and data collection, creating a future-ready service that can scale up in a cost-effective manner.

title: Multinational insurance company motivates employees to return part time to offices with a smarter workplace solution
executive_summary: Employee empowerment is at the heart of flexible work. Giving workers the freedom to determine when, how, and where they work creates positive employee experiences and has been proven to affect retention rates. But opening the door to that kind of agency can be a challenge for employers. That’s why one global insurance company turned to Campana & Schott to think through ways in which digital technologies could help them power productivity across an expansive hybrid workforce. Campana & Schott and Microsoft worked together to design and deliver an intelligent workplace solution integrated with Microsoft Teams. Campana & Schott Smart Workspace has now been implemented across 10 different organizations with 7,500+ daily active users.

title: Customer Analytics develops high-performance system for seamless Data Routing and Aggregation (CADRA) from multiple systems using Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Customer Analytics is a software and services company that offers data analytics, business consulting, and software and IT infrastructure services to B2B businesses. It seeks to strike a balance between investments in digital technology and people as it builds robust, data-driven business solutions to empower its customers. For instance, the company uses a synergy of data, analytics, and technology to resolve business problems that often cannot be solved with out-of-the-box applications. Over the last two decades, Customer Analytics has grown from strength to strength, building expertise across domains, with proficiency in data science, analytics, IT services management, and emerging technology platforms. The company has offices in India and the US with a strength of over 500 team members.

title: Polish construction group Erbud optimizes processes across all its companies with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Erbud Group is the largest construction company in Poland, with subsidiaries in Germany, Belgium, France, and the Netherlands. Led by a profound commitment to its values—responsibility, innovation, security, and partnership—the organization decided that it needed to optimize its processes to successfully deliver better projects and services. To do that, Erbud Group made a bold move to adopt cloud solutions and simultaneously deployed Microsoft Dynamics 365 in all its six entities. Since this major effort, the company has gained 100 percent control over its building sites at all times and can manage projects faster at every stage of the construction process.
products: Dynamics 365 Finance, Dynamics 365 Project Operations

title: The Victorian Department of Premier and Cabinet embraces digital transformation with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: The Victorian Department of Premier and Cabinet (DPC) supports the ministerial portfolios of the Premier, Deputy Premier, Treaty and First Peoples, Government Services, and Industrial Relations, as well as providing support to the Victorian Cabinet. Each year in Victoria, Australia, upward of 7,000 briefings and 15,000 correspondence matters, ranging from critical situations to new budget initiatives and changes to legislation, are created and managed across the Victorian Department of Premier and Cabinet. Through their implementation and adoption of the Automated Briefing and Correspondence (ABC) system, an Azure-hosted web application built on top of Microsoft 365, DPC has transformed what was once a time-intensive, completely paper-based briefing process into a highly scalable, digital system accessible by all members of the department through the fully integrated Microsoft Teams app.

title: Atrium Underwriters ensures its future data estate with SQL Server 2022
executive_summary: While the financial services industry traditionally takes a conservative approach to new technology, London-based Atrium Underwriters considers it to be a key driver of its current success. “Whether it’s getting data, storing data, or analyzing data, technology helps us balance risk and create a profitable book of business,” explained Emma Walter, IT Delivery Manager at Atrium.

title: Kantar Group’s Media business accelerates insights, goes cloud-native with Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL
executive_summary: Technical Story

title: Viridor tears down silos and drives improvement with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: “The problems we face are so complex, we cannot afford to work in silos. We need to come together to think and deliver creatively,” states Edita Adamcikova, Head of ESG at Viridor. “We have a very ambitious strategy ‘to build a world where nothing goes to waste’ of which we are very proud. We now have the foundation, supported by technology, to deliver that and to be creative and innovative for the benefit of our company and our communities.”
products: Azure, Azure Data Lake Analytics, Azure Data Lake Storage, Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Finance, Power Apps

title: CHPK builds its dream hybrid cloud solution with Azure Stack HCI and Windows Server
executive_summary: If you own, build, or occupy property, CHPK Property and Construction Consultants is ready and equipped to help. The UK-based property and construction consultancy offers an innovative approach to multidisciplinary services such as building surveying, fire engineering, project management, and contract administration with the goal of improving the industry and protecting those within it. Using Microsoft Azure and hybrid cloud solutions like Azure Stack HCI and Azure Arc, CHPK is realizing its vision for the future and transforming into a confident, resilient, and cost-effective business, enabling employees to continue putting clients first.

title: KUKA manages its robot fleets in real time with a software platform based on Azure IoT
executive_summary: Industrial robots work quickly, precisely, and almost around the clock in many fields, not just the automotive industry or electronics manufacturing. For their robot systems, automation specialist KUKA and its subsidiary Device Insight have developed the iiQoT software platform based on Microsoft Azure IoT. The platform provides important condition data in real time and enables remote monitoring of entire robot fleets. This allows efficient control of facility management, including fault monitoring and maintenance. An internal KUKA lighthouse project in the German city of Augsburg has shown that in one year of production, the platform saved 25 hours of machine downtime and administrative work.

title: Orkide Oils increased productivity with Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: Orkide Oils, which has achieved sustainable growth since 1979 and stands out in the sector with a very rich product range in the categories of vegetable oil, olive oil, vegetable margarine, non-domestic consumption of pastry oils and industrial oils, which is not only Türkiye's largest vegetable oil producer, but also an important part of both household consumption throughout the country. Orkide exports products to nearly 100 countries with a wide export network.
customer: KUCUKBAY YAG VE DETERJAN SANAYI ANONIM SIRKETI
products: Azure, Microsoft 365 E3, Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Defender XDR, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager

title: Orkide Oils increased productivity with Microsoft Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: Orkide Oils, which has achieved sustainable growth since 1979 and stands out in the sector with a very rich product range in the categories of vegetable oil, olive oil, vegetable margarine, non-domestic consumption of pastry oils and industrial oils, which is not only Türkiye's largest vegetable oil producer, but also an important part of both household consumption throughout the country. Orkide exports products to nearly 100 countries with a wide export network.

title: Managing 10,000 renewable power plants with 20 employees instead of 60
executive_summary: The energy transition is in full swing: new technologies keep arriving on the market, renewables are becoming more and more important, and legal requirements are constantly being adapted. Energy companies such as EnBW Energie Baden-Württemberg AG have been adjusting to the increase in distributed power generation for several years. This makes it possible to collect green electricity from many small power plants operating on renewables, pool it, and make it available much more widely. To manage these processes, the company relies on its Virtual Power Plant solution—and on automation through Microsoft Azure. Some 20 employees are able to manage about 10,000 renewable power plants, ranging from companies both large and small with solar roofs to farmers with biogas facilities.
products: Azure, Azure API Management, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Event Grid, Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, Azure SQL Database, Exchange Online

title: Egyptian building pioneer revamps project budget management with Oracle on Azure IaaS
executive_summary: Alexandria Construction Company (ACC) is a pioneer in large-scale infrastructure and construction projects and a leading contributor to Egypt’s economy. The company began its digital transformation by deploying the region’s first Oracle on Azure IaaS project. The solution is currently in its pilot phase at Noor—a smart city project that will set the benchmark in Egypt’s developmental landscape. Despite being in the testing stage, ACC has already saved on capital costs and human resources since deployment.
products: Azure

title: Vietnamese bank builds the country’s first cloud-native mobile banking app on Azure
executive_summary: Vietnam International Joint Stock Commercial Bank (VIB) has a decades-long track record of providing innovative, customer-centric service in Vietnam. The bank was one of the first one in the region to move to digital banking, and in 2021, worked with Microsoft to deploy a multi-cloud ecosystem (the first in Vietnam’s banking sector). An Azure cloud now hosts many VIB applications, including MyVIB 2.0, Vietnam’s first cloud-native mobile banking application.
customer: Vietnam International Joint Stock Commercial Bank (VIB)
products: Azure, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Database for PostgreSQL

title: Helping Ingeus build actionable insights with Microsoft Power BI
executive_summary: Covid-19 caused havoc in the jobs market, as employees were made redundant, struggled with health issues, and disconnected from the working world. In the first quarter of 2022, there were almost 280,000 fewer people in employment in the UK compared to before the pandemic, with another 370,000 economically inactive - meaning they are not actively seeking work.

title: Jaguar Land Rover creates better company continuity with Power Platform app-building
executive_summary: Jaguar Land Rover is a UK-based luxury automotive company with 38,000 employees, 600,000 vehicles produced annually, and £22.98 billion in annual revenue. The company has adopted Microsoft Power Platform to transform operations to improve safety, efficiency, and productivity—and to help drive down costs. Leading the way for the company is citizen developer and power user Gareth Crompton, Senior Digital Engineer in Human Resources at Jaguar Land Rover. Crompton has now built more than 160 apps, providing numerous benefits to the company—from managing workspace capacity and contract tracing during a pandemic to streamlining the work-hazard reporting process and more.

title: Picanol Group finds flexibility and faster time to market with Azure Stack
executive_summary: The art of weaving tends to conjure up images of a slower, simpler time—of dedicated craftspeople using traditional techniques to make and trade textiles locally. But today, weaving is a thoroughly fast-paced and global business, with companies navigating shifting markets, using leading-edge technology, and scaling to meet worldwide demand. Picanol has been at the forefront of this business for the past 85 years. The Belgium-based weaving machine manufacturer delivers weaving technology to the textile industry and beyond. Additionally, Picanol Group offers engineered casting solutions within the company Proferro and the development and production of electronics at Psicontrol. To continue its tradition of transformation, the group launched its Factory 4.0 strategy and adopted the Azure Arc enabled infrastructure of Microsoft Azure Stack HCI to gain centralized management, flexibility, and faster time to market.

title: Laerdal Medical Uses Azure AI Text to Speech to Create Immersive Training Experience
executive_summary: Laerdal Medical is a world-leading healthcare provider of CPR (cardiopulmonary resuscitation) manikins and other lifesaving technology, medical training, and resources. The company is investing in artificial intelligence and machine learning, including Azure Text to Speech, to help save 1 million lives every year by 2030. Laerdal's 3D virtual training simulator for healthcare students and providers uses Azure AI Text to Speech to provide an immersive experience that simulates the real-life interactions between patients and providers.
products: Azure AI Speech

title: Austrade improves CRM, supports Australian economic strategies with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The Australian Trade and Investment Commission (Austrade) promotes economic prosperity by connecting Australian businesses to the world. Its previous CRM (customer relationship management) system was outdated and slow, leading the company to search for a solution that could manage new business processes, more effectively unify data, and provide more accurate and complete views of customers. Austrade was impressed by the capabilities of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales as a CRM tool, as well as with its connectivity to Dynamics 365 Customer Insights and Marketing. This, along with price, speed, and interoperability with the Microsoft stack and Azure, made Dynamics 365 Sales the clear choice for Austrade.

title: Up onto the roof and into the Azure Cloud: Enpal powers the energy transition with photovoltaic systems
executive_summary: Solar panels on every roof in Germany—that’s Enpal’s vision for the future. To make it a reality, the company relies on closely linked processes throughout its business model. That requires a platform capable of covering all these processes—with maximum flexibility, at low cost, and with as little IT effort as possible. Enpal is then free to focus on what really matters: driving the energy transition forward with renewable energy. In doing so, the company uses various Microsoft Azure services.
products: Azure, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Digital Twins, Azure IoT Hub, Azure SQL Database, Azure Service Fabric, SQL Server

title: Up onto the roof and into the Azure Cloud: Enpal powers the energy transition with photovoltaic systems
executive_summary: Solar panels on every roof in Germany—that’s Enpal’s vision for the future. To make it a reality, the company relies on closely linked processes throughout its business model. That requires a platform capable of covering all these processes—with maximum flexibility, at low cost, and with as little IT effort as possible. Enpal is then free to focus on what really matters: driving the energy transition forward with renewable energy. In doing so, the company uses various Microsoft Azure services.

title: Seguros SURA Latinoamérica to help businesses reduce strategic human resources risk with Microsoft Graph Data Connect
executive_summary: Seguros SURA Latinoamérica set out to address strategic human resources risk, which it defines as the deviations that companies experience in the attraction, engagement, and development of the human resources they need to adequately design and execute their strategies. Microsoft Graph Data Connect gives developers the power to copy specific Microsoft 365 datasets at scale into Azure data stores without having to worry about security. When used in tandem with in-person interviews, metrics from interoffice interactions in Microsoft 365 not only provided a more comprehensive picture of the company’s human resources but also created the basis for a predictive risk assessment model.

title: EVA Group transforms its processes with the transition to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: Working from a 40,000 square meter facility in Lekunberri, Spanish beverage manufacturer EVA Group’s staff of more than 65 rely on expertise gained during the company’s 100-year history. Its management board is committed to constant technological innovation applied to production and distribution processes for its ciders, carbonated juices, liqueurs, vinegars, and other apple- and grape-based beverages. Today, its sales portfolio boasts more than 150 high quality products, and customers in countries across five continents request tailor-made products as well.

title: Qore cracks the code to cost-effective, high-efficiency core banking by going cloud-native
executive_summary: Qore is working to make technology more accessible for all financial institutions across Africa. Co-founder Mudiaga Umukoro knew that the key to increasing the efficiency of Qore’s first-of-its-kind shared services banking platform while keeping costs low was to go cloud-native. Today, over 50 percent of Nigerian financial institutions in the Other Financial Institutions (OFIs) category use Qore' BankOne for its critical banking functions.

title: SPAR NL readies for the future of retail with Azure Integration Services
executive_summary: Technical Story
products: Azure Event Grid, Azure Files, Azure Functions, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Storage

title: Digital Manufacturing Platform: ZF plants are now more efficient thanks to the smart factory solution based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Full transparency for all data to create maximum plant efficiency: ZF Group applies this basic concept to ensure that all the steps in the manufacturing process work seamlessly together. To this end, the mobility and technology company uses its own Digital Manufacturing Platform (DMP) and follows a cloud strategy built on Microsoft Azure. Today, this data platform and its applications provide ZF with a consistent, data-driven overview of its manufacturing activities. As a result, the company can optimize work steps such as maintenance and repair, make better use of resources, and increase production flexibility. This marks the first step toward establishing a globally connected, digital manufacturing network.
products: Azure, Azure Data Explorer, Azure IoT Hub, Microsoft Entra ID, Power BI

title: Sapiens transforms the insurance and financial sectors and cuts time to market in half with Azure
executive_summary: Celebrating 40 years of innovation in the insurance and financial sectors, Sapiens blends its industry expertise with the latest technologies to create digitally driven software solutions for insurers of all sizes. As a world-renowned leader in insurtech, or the use of technology to drive innovation in the insurance industry, Sapiens is used to putting its customers first to help them adapt to evolving markets. Recently, Sapiens sought a solution of its own to refresh its core platform, strengthen its cloud foundation, and deliver services faster and more easily. Sapiens is now expanding and enhancing its business to continue supporting its customers, and it’s migrating to the cloud with Microsoft Azure services, including Azure Arc, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), and Azure Private Link.

title: BPiON expands its business and ensures data security for stakeholders with Azure solutions
executive_summary: BPiON is a technology-driven business process outsourcing (BPO) company in Central and Eastern Europe, offering digital solutions built on Microsoft Azure for accounting, human resources, and payroll administration. As BPiON started to expand rapidly, it needed to achieve faster business scalability while keeping rigorous data security. To do this, it expanded its Azure-based solutions to manage devices remotely and improve security. Now, BPiON has the flexibility to grow its business in new countries with a click of a button, while knowing its stakeholders’ data are always safe and secure.
products: Azure, Azure Virtual Network, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Intune

title: Legal and Tech transform work at Marks and Spencer using Power Apps
executive_summary: “When we started this journey five years ago, most of the legal team’s interactions with tech happened when something broke,” explains Sharon Peters, Head of Technical Programme Management at Marks and Spencer. “Now we’re being considered for the Alliance of the Year at the British Legal Technology Awards. It has been a transformative journey of collaboration and partnership.”
products: Microsoft 365, Forms, Microsoft Teams, Power Automate, Power Apps, SharePoint

title: ICTC drives digital equity to build a shared digital future for Canadians with Microsoft
executive_summary: The Information and Communications Technology Council (ICTC) is a Canadian nonprofit that conducts digital industry and market research, elaborates policy advice, delivers program-based digital guidance for Canadian businesses and industries, and provides training and development opportunities for Canadian talent. Recognizing the need to serve groups underrepresented in the digital space, including women, newcomers, Indigenous Peoples, and youth, ICTC launched its Digital Equity and Employment Pathways (DEEP) program to provide upskilling and development opportunities with Microsoft Learn resources. ICTC’s DEEP program has a 93 percent employment rate, with 70 percent of participants being women. Along with other key ICTC initiatives, it continues to equitably develop Canadian talent and drive Canadian innovation for years to come.

title: Maidenhead Bridge uses marketplace to magnify and scale worldwide
executive_summary: Maidenhead Bridge is a leader in the emerging category of multicloud network software providers. Its unique solution lets customers connect from any virtual platform and cloud with Cloud Security Connectors for Secure Service Edge (SSE) vendors. With help from the ISV Success program, it has successfully adopted the commercial marketplace as core to its go-to-market strategy—propelling Maidenhead Bridge to scale and reach global customers.

title: Kurita Water Industries accesses more data to better serve customers with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Kurita Water Industries provides environmentally friendly industrial waste treatment solutions to customers around the world. When its systems for customer information management proved lacking, Kurita saw an opportunity for digital transformation. Kurita used Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales, Teams, and Power BI to put its 70 years of experience, deep relationships, and understanding at its representatives’ fingertips. This is helping to catalyze more proactive solutions to problems and giving Kurita’s leadership access to accurate insights related to customer needs.

title: ISV Success program helps Akouo bring to market a simultaneous interpretation solution for Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Founded in 2021 and based in the United Kingdom, Akouo’s solution provides universal and simultaneous multilingual interpretation for meetings directly within Microsoft Teams. Users simply add Akouo to their Teams meeting and participants select their preferred language. By tapping into the resources of the ISV Success program, Akouo has moved from development in October of 2021 to a transaction-ready solution that will soon be published on the commercial marketplace.

title: The worldwide automotive aftermarket in the cloud: Global data services provider TecAlliance intensifies customer collaboration with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: TecAlliance deals in cumulative vehicle knowledge, making technical data usable for manufacturers, wholesalers, auto shops, and all other players in the global market for automotive spare parts. To work quickly, effectively, and close to its customers, TecAlliance is harmonizing its IT systems and processes. Arineo, a member of the Microsoft Partner Network, is providing support on the journey toward an integrated ERP, CRM, and HR system landscape based on Microsoft Dynamics 365—an example of efficient remote working during the COVID-19 health crisis.

title: GF Piping Systems tackles social and environmental challenges using Microsoft Azure services
executive_summary: Sustainability is at the heart of everything GF Piping Systems does. As the leading flow solutions provider, the organization has been giving leak-free piping to a range of end-market segments for many years. Recently, the organization realized it needed to reinvent its offering to expand its reach and better serve existing customers – so, it partnered with Microsoft to digitally transform its operations. Using cloud technology, it built a flexible, modular platform environment to help develop customized solutions that meet customers’ needs and help them to solve social and environmental challenges - ultimately enabling positive change for a better tomorrow.

title: Search is a vital skill: How Napier Boys’ High School uses Microsoft’s Search Coach to improve digital literacy and research
executive_summary: Situated in New Zealand, Napier Boys’ High School has been a leading secondary school for over 125 years, blending respect, honesty, and integrity with a 21st century approach to education. Napier’s faculty strives to prepare the boys to become informed and successful future citizens. Nowhere is this better exemplified than in classrooms where educators teach digital literacy and online research skills. However, prioritizing these skills has been difficult given the pressures of the pandemic and the unique rural student body Napier serves. When one of Napier’s technology leaders discovered Search Coach, a learning tool built into Microsoft Teams for Education, he was excited to use this tool to train students how to identify reliable resources and write more useful search queries—to figure out what online sources of information are credible, and to quickly improve their digital research skills.

title: United Kingdom, Department for Environment, Food, and Rural Affairs renews financial operations with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: In the United Kingdom, the Department for Environment, Food, and Rural Affairs (Defra) is charged with improving and protecting the environment, with a mission to enhance it for the next generation. They are responsible for policy and regulations that span a wide range of areas, including sustainable development, biodiversity, pollution control, animal health and welfare, and farming. With this broad remit, their work impacts the life of UK citizens each day.
products: Dynamics 365 Finance

title: vCreate & Microsoft Azure connects patients with their families and clinical teams
executive_summary: vCreate is an innovative business operating in the sphere of healthcare. It develops secure video technology that connects patients, families and clinical teams for improved diagnostic management and enhanced family-focused care.
products: Azure, Azure Web Application Firewall

title: Planning a digital journey for fruits and vegetables: IFCO optimizes its circular economy with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Avocados, ginger, potatoes, bananas—when supermarket shoppers select these or virtually any other fresh produce, they will invariably do so from reusable packaging containers made by IFCO SYSTEMS GmbH. Headquartered in Bavaria, the company is a world market leader in reusable packaging containers for the global food industry. A total of 1.9 billion times a year, these robust foldable containers complete their journey from IFCO to food producers to food retailer warehouses to point of sale and back to IFCO for cleaning before the whole cycle starts again. Ensuring that this loop works smoothly calls for a consistent data pool, fast and efficient reporting, and optimized processes for planning and logistics. Today, this is covered by numerous services belonging to the Microsoft Azure cloud computing platform.

title: Bayer builds crisis management dashboard for data-driven decisions using datamarts in Power BI
executive_summary: Bayer is a life science company and a global leader in healthcare and nutrition—and the organization’s work became even more critical during the COVID-19 pandemic. To keep its employees safe and business production on track, the Bayer crisis management team needed access to critical COVID information for the ASEAN country group. Using datamarts in Power BI, the organization built a dashboard that delivers insights in real time, enabling better decision making and enhancing cross-team collaboration for future crisis management needs.

title: BKW uses Windows 365 to build a reliable, secure and flexible virtual PC to enable hybrid working
executive_summary: The main priority for global service provider BKW is to find sustainable solutions for the production, distribution and consumption of energy. After a period of rapid growth, the Swiss-based energy and infrastructure company’s on-prem IT infrastructure began to buckle under the pressure of scaling, leading the organization to scope out a new solution. After searching the market, BKW decided to deploy Windows 365, quickly migrating its users to a new virtual desktop environment that proved reliable, secure and flexible. The solution has helped to drive growth, enabled hybrid working and, above all, has given BKW the digital backbone to focus on solutions for the sustainability challenges of tomorrow.

title: AKOLogic and VGI bring efficiency and sustainability to agriculture with Microsoft
executive_summary: One of the main environmental concerns in agriculture is the fact that the sector is a leading contributor to the rise of CO2 levels in the atmosphere. Traditional crop production practices often rely on artificial chemicals that can harm the environment, cause land degradation, and damage ecosystems. But the State of Israel, a world leader in agriculture and water management, is committed to making the industry more sustainable. By collaborating with the Microsoft Israeli Development Center, Israeli organizations like AKOLogic and VGI are bringing technological innovation and sustainability to farming.

title: Greek gaming leader optimizes its financial operations with S/4HANA on Azure
executive_summary: OPAP is the leading gaming company in Greece and one of the most renowned in its industry internationally. It is a sector leader in embedding global Responsible Gaming principles in its operations and supports Greek society in practice through an extensive corporate responsibility program focusing on health, sports and employment.

title: Dreaming big: how the Philippines is using Microsoft Reading Progress to build confidence and enhance future ready skills in a global economy
executive_summary: It is no secret among educators across the Philippines that students need confidence to feel comfortable speaking and participating in a classroom setting. Speaking in a second language can be all that much more difficult for students who are worried about judgement from their peers or teachers. To help, the educators and students across the Philippines highlight the power of Reading Progress to bolster the confidence of learners who were previously hesitant to participate in class conversations and to help them with their future careers.
products: Microsoft Teams, Reading Progress

title: TIBCO preserves personal banking in the digital world by using Azure
executive_summary: The challenge for ABN AMRO was a desire to use cloud technology to improve the customer experience, but the company wanted the personal part of banking to be preserved, digitally. Together, the combined capabilities of Azure and TIBCO Cloud Integration are helping ABN AMRO build modern applications and quickly respond to rapidly changing business needs. Banking transactions are now swifter and smoother. Customers receive credit cards in a couple of days, a process that used to take weeks. They can bank from their mobile devices anytime, anywhere. Loan processing is faster and smarter than ever, increasing company efficiency and improving client management.
products: Azure

title: Strabag SE builds a risk management solution to improve efficiency using Microsoft Intelligent Data Platform
executive_summary: As one of the oldest industries in the world, construction hasn’t always kept pace with the modernization that has swept across other industries, particularly when it comes to driving operational efficiencies with data. But one organization is determined to change that. Strabag SE, the global construction company, partnered with Microsoft to build a Data Science Hub to collect decentralized data and leverage it for insights. This enabled the organization to develop use cases to prove the value of data including its risk management project. The solution uses an algorithm to pinpoint at-risk construction projects, saving Strabag SE time and reducing financial losses. With data now at the helm, Strabag SE is cementing its future in a traditional industry on the path to digitalization.

title: Greek gaming leader optimizes its financial operations with S/4HANA on Azure
executive_summary: OPAP is the leading gaming company in Greece and one of the most renowned in its industry internationally. It is a sector leader in embedding global Responsible Gaming principles in its operations and supports Greek society in practice through an extensive corporate responsibility program focusing on health, sports and employment.

title: Leading innovation service provider sets new industry standard with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Azelis is the world’s foremost specialty chemicals and food ingredients innovation service provider, bringing high-quality products, technical expertise, and local service support to 15 specific global markets. With more than 60 laboratories and over 3,000 employees in 57 countries, the leading chemical distributor continues to develop the right formulations for success and growth.

title: Milton Keynes University Hospital simplifies endpoint management, elevates mobile clinical care efficiency with Microsoft Intune
executive_summary: Milton Keynes University Hospital is committed to providing the highest quality of care and adopting technology to boost operational efficiency and enhance patient care capabilities for its community. The hospital deployed Microsoft Intune to simplify endpoint management, improve configuration and control over its Zero Trust environment, and enhance the mobile device experience for hospital staff. Combining Intune with Azure Active Directory and Defender for Endpoint provides a comprehensive platform of software as a service solutions to manage and safeguard its environment across multiple devices, platforms, and operating systems. The hospital’s Digital Services staff can now deploy and update apps using dynamic grouping, set security policies and audit compliance, and remotely wipe devices. The result is streamlined core security and IT operations that help ensure clinicians and nurses can access the most up-to-date versions of the vital applications they use daily for patient care.
customer: Milton Keynes University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Windows 10, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Intune, Windows Autopilot

title: Aves prepares students for the challenges of tomorrow using Microsoft Education tools and Surface devices
executive_summary: Educational organization Aves has been championing innovation across its network of schools since its very early days. As part of this mission, the Dutch organization has been on a decade-long digital transformation program aimed at making digital literacy a core pillar of its curriculum. Started with an initial adoption of Surface devices and software, the initiative has since expanded to implement a new cloud-based platform allowing teachers to create unique, tailored curricula and more. All with the aim of helping prepare students for the digital challenges of tomorrow.

title: Pension Protection Fund chooses Microsoft Azure to drive efficiency and innovation
executive_summary: “Doing the right thing is very important to the PPF. That’s something we’re very passionate about,” states Simon Liste, Chief Information Technology Officer at the Pension Protection Fund (PPF). “And, I’m very passionate about using technology and digital services for the greater good.”

title: Carlsberg improves digital employee experience to reach 29,000 employees using Microsoft VIVA
executive_summary: Since 1847, Danish brewing company Carlsberg Group has been serving customers with great tasting beer to accompany great experiences. But being a truly global organization has its own set of challenges, particularly when it comes to growing its employee base and global presence through internal communications and fostering a culture of inclusion. To overcome these obstacles and unite its workforce, Carlsberg built a custom centralised platform using Microsoft VIVA Connections integrated with Microsoft Teams. The new intranet, CarlsNet, has improved internal reach and engagement, becoming a useful tool to find news and resources at the desk or on the go. Most of all, CarlsNet has connected teams from across the organisation’s three regions, and in every company function helping Carlsberg on its mission to create a great digital employee experience.

title: Snow Peak fully utilizes Azure and Microsoft 365! A close look at the aims of their digital strategies for enhancing user experience values
executive_summary: Snow Peak, a developer, manufacturer, and marketer of high-end outdoor products centered on auto-camping products, is working to strengthen connections with users through the use of digital technologies in order to realize its social mission of restoring humanity by connecting people to nature and people to people. They are leveraging Microsoft Azure to build up a data platform for collecting and utilizing digital data and linking core systems and community apps to improve the value of user experience. In some cases, increasing the customer loyalty resulted in a 10-fold increase in purchase price per unit. We asked them about the aims of their digital strategies, the roles played by Azure, and their vision for the future.

title: Koppert seeds transformation with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: For more than 50 years, the mission of Koppert has been to make agriculture and horticulture healthier, safer, more productive, and more sustainable, working in partnership with nature. Founded in 1967 by grower and visionary Jan Koppert, the company has helped farmers and growers around the world maximize yields while reducing their environmental impact. Koppert advocates using natural enemies to combat pests, bumblebees for pollination, and microbials and biostimulants that naturally strengthen and protect crops. Because Koppert products are alive, it is paramount that customers receive their products in peak condition.

title: Aygaz created a remote working environment with Microsoft Virtual Desktop and Azure
executive_summary: Established in 1961, one of Türkiye's largest energy companies, in the transition to remote and flexible working model accelerated during the pandemic period, offered the platform called AR-WE to its employees, using Microsoft Virtual Desktop and Azure components. In this way, Aygaz employees can continue to work independently of the place they are in and the device they use.

title: Koppert seeds transformation with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: For more than 50 years, the mission of Koppert has been to make agriculture and horticulture healthier, safer, more productive, and more sustainable, working in partnership with nature. Founded in 1967 by grower and visionary Jan Koppert, the company has helped farmers and growers around the world maximize yields while reducing their environmental impact. Koppert advocates using natural enemies to combat pests, bumblebees for pollination, and microbials and biostimulants that naturally strengthen and protect crops. Because Koppert products are alive, it is paramount that customers receive their products in peak condition.

title: Aygaz created a remote working environment with Microsoft Virtual Desktop and Azure
executive_summary: Established in 1961, one of Türkiye's largest energy companies, in the transition to remote and flexible working model accelerated during the pandemic period, offered the platform called AR-WE to its employees, using Microsoft Virtual Desktop and Azure components. In this way, Aygaz employees can continue to work independently of the place they are in and the device they use.

title: Dutch Financial Services Company, Rabobank, Creates Global Data Platform with Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI
executive_summary: Rabobank is a cooperative bank focused on serving clients ranging from consumers and retailers to global agriculture companies. Traditionally, each time there was a request for data, Rabobank’s data team would build a singular solution that couldn’t be reutilized for other needs or use cases. Rabobank is determined to change this process and create scalable data platforms ready for the development of new, user-friendly solutions that can be reused, optimized, and scaled. To meet these needs, the Global Data Platform (GDP) was created to build a single “platform of truth” and a place where users can work with data owners to quickly get access to data to build dynamic and scalable solutions. With GDP, Rabobank has been able to break down the walls of their siloed data and applications and make data significantly more accessible across the board. Singular data touch points—information factories-- have increased speed to insights tremendously; data that once took months or years to prioritize are now readily available.
products: Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, Microsoft Purview, Power BI

title: Snow Peak fully utilizes Azure and Microsoft 365! A close look at the aims of their digital strategies for enhancing user experience values
executive_summary: Snow Peak, a developer, manufacturer, and marketer of high-end outdoor products centered on auto-camping products, is working to strengthen connections with users through the use of digital technologies in order to realize its social mission of restoring humanity by connecting people to nature and people to people. They are leveraging Microsoft Azure to build up a data platform for collecting and utilizing digital data and linking core systems and community apps to improve the value of user experience. In some cases, increasing the customer loyalty resulted in a 10-fold increase in purchase price per unit. We asked them about the aims of their digital strategies, the roles played by Azure, and their vision for the future.

title: Coca-Cola Hellenic quenches its thirst for cloud transformation with Microsoft Azure and Intel
executive_summary: Coca-Cola Hellenic Bottling Company (HBC) strives to give customers across 29 exclusive markets the ultimate delight every day—access to their favorite beverages whenever and wherever they want them. As the company acquired more brands and customers, its rapid and sustained growth demanded a high level of agility and flexibility that it didn’t have with its on-premises environment.

title: Graphics power on demand: Plastic Omnium Lighting Systems designs innovative automotive lighting systems with Azure Virtual Desktop and reduces costs by 32 percent
executive_summary: Transform every drive into a unique lighting experience: with this aim in mind, the Lighting division of Plastic Omnium develops smart lighting solutions for the automotive industry. Starting from classic areas such as headlights, taillights, and interior lighting, Plastic Omnium Lighting Systems combines lighting technology with electronics and software—ensuring connected, safe, personalized, and sustainable future mobility. To achieve this, the company places a lot of importance on designing processes that are scalable—when it comes to development, complex CAD applications require considerable computing capacity. Switching to Azure Virtual Desktop has given the Lighting experts from Plastic Omnium the scalability they need to manage continuously fluctuating IT capacity with absolute precision.
products: Azure, Azure Virtual Desktop

title: BPW Aftermarket Group drives enterprise standardization with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: The BPW Aftermarket Group (BPW AMG) is the commercial vehicle (CV) spare parts network of the BPW Group. More than 1,500 employees at 170 branches throughout Europe ensure the reliable and fast supply of spare parts for trucks and trailers across the continent. BPW AMG supports CV shops and vehicle operators to repair and maintain vehicles quickly, safely, and efficiently, and at the same time in keeping with their values. In other words, BPW ensures that shops have the right number of the right spare parts for the right vehicles at the right time.

title: Global aquaculture feed producer uses Microsoft Project to gain efficiencies, improve collaboration
executive_summary: Global aquaculture company BioMar wanted a change. Three departments were using an aging application to manage its product development cycle. The system was inefficient and not flexible enough to fit BioMar’s growth and product development needs. The organization sought a robust project management solution that would support its scientists and product managers to better collaborate and communicate, work more efficiently, and minimize manual processes. Today, BioMar is implementing a Microsoft-based project management solution that incorporates Microsoft Project, Power Platform, and Microsoft Teams that the company anticipates to roll out in Q1 2023.

title: Microsoft Project helps Danish skylight manufacturer unify data systems and remote employees while improving processes
executive_summary: Roof window and skylight innovator VELUX was seeking a project portfolio management solution that would unify company data, create efficiencies, provide a robust yet easy-to-use interface, and allow for scalability. After careful consideration, the company selected Microsoft Project. Today, user satisfaction has risen dramatically—survey respondents report being satisfied and highly satisfied with the usability of the new system—and time to market has improved. VELUX has therefore decided on Project as the standard enterprise solution for PPM company-wide.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Power Automate, Project, Power BI

title: Global adhesive manufacturer strengthens customer relationships with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: MAPEI is a global leader in adhesive, sealant, and chemical product manufacturing. With 90 different customized CRM systems across 57 countries, the company wanted to consolidate into a single, centralized system. Over 12 months, MAPEI migrated its sales, customer service, and marketing solution from Microsoft Dynamics CRM on-premises to the cloud with Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Marketing, and Dynamics 365 Sales. The migration to Dynamics 365 helped MAPEI simplify internal processes for its employees, provide more proactive service to customers, and simplify the delivery of new solutions—saving both time and money, and ensuring that its CRM system is future-ready.

title: National Railway Company of Belgium takes a security-focused route with Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: The National Railway Company of Belgium answers the challenges of today’s transportation industry with a two-pronged approach. It prioritizes customer safety and travel experience along with cutting-edge technology that makes it easier for its employees to be proactive and efficient. And because cybersecurity is ever more important, it protects its digital assets with both built-in platform security and Microsoft Security solutions. The company deployed Microsoft Intune for mobile devices and the Microsoft Defender solution family to monitor its endpoints, cloud workloads, and Microsoft 365 apps. It oversees the entire estate with Microsoft Sentinel for proactive, efficient security.
products: Azure, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: TVA innovates with FastTrack for Azure to modernize its television analytics platform
executive_summary: In 2016, TVA was founded to fill a niche in the market by providing better audience measurement for TV and radio. Even though radio has been around for well over a century, and television was invented almost 100 years ago, measurement for both of these audiences has been stuck in the past. In an age of digital transformation and disruption, audience analytics had simply not caught up. TVA came into the market with a modern patented system to measure audience data that provides clarity and scale of measurement to broadcasters and advertisers while also protecting individuals’ privacy.

title: Deutsche Bahn manages Climate Protection Portfolio with Dynamics 365 Project Operations to contribute to transport and climate change
executive_summary: As the leader in German rail transportation, Deutsche Bahn plays a critical role in Germany’s commitment to investing in a cleaner transportation infrastructure. The federally funded €11 billion Climate Protection Package as a reinforcement program for additional capacity, robustness and service in the infrastructure is part of its corporate strategy "Strong Rail". The complexity and scale of this endeavor requires comprehensive project management, full transparency in KPI tracking, and data-driven reporting and analysis. With Microsoft Dynamics 365 Project Operations, Power BI, and Azure Maps, Deutsche Bahn can execute on its mission to build and improve the future of Germany’s transportation systems.

title: University of Debrecen delivers future-ready skills and knowledge with Microsoft
executive_summary: The University of Debrecen, one of the largest higher education institutions in Hungary, was looking to integrate more market-oriented, industry-relevant skills and certificates in its computer science programs. With the Microsoft Learn for Educators program (MSLE), the university introduced several courses in Azure technologies in its curricula and empowered its teachers and several dozen students to gain industry-recognized Microsoft Certifications for free, thereby enhancing their employability and university ranking.

title: Fending off cyberattacks: NORMA Group uses Microsoft Defender and Azure Sentinel to safeguard its global data
executive_summary: NORMA Group develops, manufactures, and sells joining technology for a range of industrial applications worldwide. Within an international network of locations, partners, and customers, the Group is responsible for the security of the data stored on its systems. To perform this important function, NORMA Group established its own security operations center, staffed by experts who monitor and process security alerts and, in emergencies, defend against cyberattacks.
