title: Bringing Blind Veterans UK together with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: “On 1 September 1997, I woke up in bed catapulted into a world of complete darkness. I was absolutely terrified,” says Billy Baxter. Billy was a soldier in the Royal Horse Artillery, but contracted a virus in Bosnia that robbed him of his eyesight. When he woke up that morning, his life changed completely. He soon became detached, isolated, and depressed. The army had been his whole life. But then he got in touch with Blind Veterans UK, a charity with centres in Sussex and North Wales that supports anyone who has served in the UK Armed Forces and who is now living with significant sight loss. Their support, rehabilitation and training helped Billy turn a corner. He knew he wasn’t alone anymore and that he could finally talk to people who understood what he was going through.

Whether it be digital advertising, marketing, or website creation, the sales teams run the show in terms of offering advice and expertise to the group's various clients. At the end of 2019, Solocal made the decision to move these vital teams to a virtual workspace so they could enjoy an increasingly modern and agile working environment. The group's Infrastructure and Operations Department and Technical Department set about testing this setup, unaware that just a few weeks later COVID-19 would force them to ramp up their efforts.

title: LUKS: simplifying hospital processes with low-code technology
executive_summary: Luzerner Kantonsspital (LUKS) is one of the largest hospitals in Switzerland, as well as a leading digital innovator. A forerunner of virtual consultations and digital patient management systems, LUKS believes in using technology to simplify processes and empower its staff. As part of this mission, the hospital has been exploring low-code apps and how they can help optimize operations and drive efficiencies. Their benefits were particularly clear during the pandemic, when LUKS used Microsoft PowerApps to create a solution that helped staff triage patients eligible for a COVID-19 antibody therapy. Built in just a few days, the app has helped clinicians save time and treat hundreds of patients at a crucial time of need.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Power BI

title: Yapı Kredi opts for "M365 E5 Information Protection" to safeguard its information
executive_summary: Yapı Kredi is one of Türkiye's major financial institutions, drawing strength from the 2006 merger of Yapı Kredi and Koçbank, two long-established Turkish  institutions in finance. Utilizing innovative technologies to lead the industry with distinctive services and applications, Yapı Kredi has now opted for the M365 E5 Information Protection solution in Data Security Management.
products: Microsoft 365 E5

title: Kingston Builds Cloud-Based BPM System with Microsoft Power Platform, Sees Soaring Business Agility
executive_summary: The impacts of the pandemic have made clear the need for businesses to find agility and flexibility in their operations to cope with the rapidly changing business environment. As such, business process optimization (BPO) has become a universal goal among enterprises around the globe. According to research from Gartner, it is estimated that by 2025, 70% of new enterprise applications will employ low-code solutions. Projects will be able to be completed faster than ever through the use of development tools with intuitive UI. Project staff—regardless of coding ability—can thus quickly turn their ideas into highly functional applications, easily overcoming a variety of challenges.

title: Taiwanese Leading Fastener Company Creates New Momentum Through Digital Transformation
executive_summary: Anchor Fasteners was founded in 1986. Anchor Fasteners’ digital transformation enables to deliver high quality fasteners and helps reduce downtime. The company takes advantage of Microsoft Azure IoT, Dynamics 365, AI and various data services to increase the overall OEE by 15%, the machine utilization rate by 12%, shorten the downtime by 17%, and improve the production efficiency and yield to win more orders.
products: Azure, Azure IoT Edge, Dynamics 365, Power Automate

title: Falck develops a salary management app for greater transparency and fairer pay
executive_summary: Providing people-centric services has been at the heart of healthcare company, Falck, for nearly a century. But while the Danish organization continues to care for its customers, recently it has been working to improve the day-to-day lives of its employees too. With a push to digitally transform internal operations, Falck is establishing a foundation for applications to be built using Microsoft Power Platform. Its most recent engineering success was its Merit app. It not only provides transparent, cost-effective and efficient management of the salary negotiation process, but its success has inspired Falck’s employees to innovate further with the powerful technology they now have in their back pocket.

title: Mada Center transforms education for persons with disabilities with Microsoft Education tools
executive_summary: Based in Qatar, the Mada Center optimizes technology to create digital accessibility for persons with disabilities. One of its main projects, the Mada Innovation Lab, showcases a model classroom in partnership with Microsoft. The creative space features Surface Go and Surface Pro devices combined with Microsoft 365 Education, Hacking STEM, and Minecraft Education programs. This state-of-the-art and fully inclusive classroom embraces assistive technology to create an equal and inclusive opportunity for all students to learn.

title: BWT Alpine F1 Team turns big data into faster track times with data science platform built on Azure and Azure NetApp Files
executive_summary: It goes without saying that things move quickly in the world of technology. Not as quickly, though, as in the world of Formula 1 racing, where every team is dedicated to the quickest lap times and helping their driver cross the line first. So, it comes as no surprise that BWT Alpine F1 Team would look for the fastest technology to help drive success on the track, since IT, too, must play its part in that team effort.
products: Azure, Azure Batch, Azure ExpressRoute, Azure NetApp Files, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Moroccan deep-sea fishing company streamlines operations with SAP on Azure Server
executive_summary: Morocco-based deep-sea fishing company CNFC Group has worked for more than 30 years in the North Atlantic, exporting gourmet seafood across Europe and Asia. The company needed a digital upgrade to create a more flexible, agile, and scalable IT landscape. Microsoft partner CBI deployed SAP HANA on the Azure server. The platform has enabled CNFC to streamline operations, simplify financial management and ensure clear traceability on products from inventory to sales.
products: Azure, SAP on Azure

title: Chungbuk Technopark increases its support to small and medium enterprises with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Chungbuk Technopark (CBTP), a non-profit government organization in South Korea, assists in local business incubation by supporting small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs). It proactively introduces and utilizes digital transformation technology to support the growth and development of local industries and companies. To provide companies in Chungbuk Province with new, trending services while addressing data sovereignty and latency, the technopark wanted to run various clusters in both on-premises data centers and public clouds. It moved to the Azure hybrid cloud and used Azure Arc to further secure and govern infrastructure and apps anywhere.

title: TM International Logistics leverages Azure to streamline business processes and gain real-time insights
executive_summary: Incorporated in 2002, TM International Logistics Limited (TMILL), a subsidiary of Tata Steel Limited, is an international logistics provider formed as a joint venture company of Tata Steel Limited, NYK Holding (Europe) BV, and IQ Martrade. Headquartered in Kolkata, TMILL offers a diverse portfolio of logistics services including railways, supply chain management (SCM), warehousing, port operations, ship agency, freight forwarding, custom house agency, inland logistics and shipping.

title: Nordic leader in fire protection gears up for growth with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Firesafe was lacking in digital maturity and therefore also lacking in operational scalability. The first part of the digital transformation would need to include the standardization of processes and data. Recognizing that Dynamics 365 and Microsoft Power Platform are well-suited for an accelerated, agile approach—with the ability to incrementally move processes and teams onto the platform—Firesafe decided to move forward with Dynamics 365. Even though Firesafe has just begun their Dynamics 365 customer engagement journey, efficiency and other customer service benefits were immediately realized.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Customer Voice, Dynamics 365 Finance, Dynamics 365 Sales, Microsoft Entra ID, Dataverse, Power Apps, Power Pages

title: FSA helps keep UK food supply safe with Microsoft Purview Records Management
executive_summary: The Food Standards Agency (FSA) fulfills the vital role of overseeing food safety in England, Northern Ireland, and Wales. Its onsite inspections and scientific tools needed backup—excellent records management to boost collaboration and security. Food safety is a timeless need, but the records management system used by the FSA was showing its age. The agency desired a more future-proof alternative to boost collaboration, productivity, and security. It found the solution it needed with Microsoft Purview Records Management.
products: Microsoft Purview, Microsoft Purview Records Management, Microsoft Purview eDiscovery

title: AB InBev GCC Uses Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI for E2E Automation and Increasing Efficiency
executive_summary: While AB InBev’s Command Center team was already using Power BI for all their visualization needs, they were sourcing data from numerous large excel files and the system was unable to handle high volumes of data. Since AB In-Bev was already using Power BI, choosing Azure Synapse to support their data platform made the most sense, as Synapse seamlessly integrates with Power BI and the rest of the Microsoft ecosystem. With an automated back end supported by Azure Synapse and Data visualization supported by Power BI, AB InBev has the powerful, competitive edge that empowers users to focus on decision making and react to the market even quicker.

title: Hultafors Group Implements A Scalable CRM Solution To Support Sustainable Growth
executive_summary: Both organically and through acquisitions, Hultafors Group had entered a period of sustained growth and reached a point where they wanted to take their existing CRM solution to the next level to meet the demands of their expanding business. So they did what any forward-thinking company would do, they sought out a partnership to join them on their journey going forward. It seemed natural and logical to invest in a strong and collaborative partnership that could help the business further embed Dynamics 365, bringing all their sales teams into one unified system. That’s when they brought CRM-Konsulterna (CRMK) onboard.

title: Creating a better digital experience for members: Nationwide Building Society chooses Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: As the world’s largest building society, Nationwide Building Society often leans on technology to help support and deliver financial services to its more than 16 million members across the United Kingdom. Twenty-five years ago, it established one of the first internet banks in the United Kingdom, mailing out compact discs to members and delivering services on dial-up connections. Today, Nationwide Building Society offers mortgages, loans, personal and business accounts, investments, home insurance and protection, credit cards, and other banking services through a variety of branch, digital, and multichannel mediums, including the web and mobile apps, for the benefit of its members and their communities.

title: Ferrovial paves a path forward with Microsoft Edge as default browser for all apps
executive_summary: The Spanish civil engineering firm Ferrovial has a strong legacy in construction and infrastructure, but its legacy web applications were holding back the IT department. The company wanted to adopt a modern browser with compatibility for those key Internet Explorer-based apps, which they found in Microsoft Edge. Diligent preparation by Ferrovial’s Workplace team and support from Microsoft FastTrack led to a successful deployment, an intuitive user experience on a single browser, and a smooth transition to using modern business apps.

title: Grupo Bimbo accelerates its sustainability journey with Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability
executive_summary: Sustainability has always been an essential part of everyday business at Grupo Bimbo, the Mexico-based international producer of baked goods and snack foods. To help the company achieve its ambitious sustainability goals, Grupo Bimbo is deploying Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability, which helps businesses collect, track, and analyze all the strategic metrics of their sustainability strategy. Grupo Bimbo has a comprehensive strategy encompassing nutrition, social impact, waste, and water, and the company is beginning with tracking emissions in Canada, Mexico, and the United States. Grupo Bimbo is rolling out Microsoft Cloud for Sustainability to all its global operations, and the company has appreciated its ease of use and its ability to connect to multiple data sources, including external repositories and Internet of Things sensors, to automate data collection.

title: Powering Speech-to-Text AI that iterates at the speed of business
executive_summary: Helping quality content reach the linguistically diverse global market is a challenge that Vitra.ai decided to solve using AI. Co-founder Satvik Jagannath saw that businesses often had great content—videos, images, podcasts, and text—but what they needed was more reach, a way to break into global markets, expand their presence and increase their revenue using content they already had, instead of reinventing the wheel.
products: Azure AI Services

title: ALTO and Quantum Security secure millions of financial transactions using Microsoft Sentinel
executive_summary: PT. ALTO Network is a financial services technology company that provides banking and payment solutions for all the major banks in Indonesia. The company’s goal is to provide seamless transactions through highly secure and innovative payment platforms. “We want to deliver 100 percent of our services without any security incidents or interruptions, and we want to protect our data,” says Alvin Christian, Information Security Engineer at PT. ALTO Network.
products: Azure, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Microsoft Sentinel strengthens Salford Councils cyber security and reduces corporate risk
executive_summary: For many public sector organisations, cyber security tops the corporate risk register. Salford City Council is one of the ten metropolitan borough councils in Greater Manchester. It serves 220,000 residents. The diverse city region includes some of the most deprived wards in the country as well as being a high-tech hub that includes MediaCityUK, home to 250+ creative and digital businesses. As part of a wider programme to develop digital skills across the city region, Salford City Council has created a commercial security operations centre built on a public-sector-operated platform and Microsoft Sentinel. As well as protecting the council and its residents, the SOC services will be offered across the North West – and, eventually, beyond – to make public sector and enterprise more secure.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft 365 E5, Power Apps, Power Automate, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Dreaming of making great strides as a global blockchain game company, Wemade is enjoying solid success in the global market as well as Korea

Wemade, loved by global fans for its great game services, is solidifying its status as a leading game company with the worldwide success of Mir 4, which was released in 2020.

title: The global mobile game developer and publisher, Mobirix, is achieving great success through Azure PlayFab.
executive_summary: Mobirix is a casual mobile game developer founded in 2004, and it has enjoyed continuous growth, reflected in its #3 ranking among most downloaded Korean publishers by App Annie in 2021. Mobirix achieved sales of KRW 44 billion and profits of KRW 12 billion in 2020, and with its listing in KOSDAQ in 2021, the company is entering its next stage for even greater growth.

title: Elvia builds a highly secure DevOps platform with Azure infrastructure and network security services

The company set out to build a secure, cloud-first DevOps platform that could meet Norway’s data residency and compliance requirements and scale to perform in a hybrid and multicloud environment. Elvia needed resilient, flexible components to deliver automated services that would help, not hinder, the company’s development of innovative grid network technology. Elvia realized its goal by enhancing its in-house development and data integration capabilities. Using Microsoft Azure DDoS Protection, Azure Web Application Firewall, Azure Bastion, Azure Active Directory (Azure AD), and Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) to help build and secure a development platform named Atlas.
products: Azure, Azure Application Gateway, Azure DDoS Protection, Azure Monitor, Azure Web Application Firewall, Microsoft Entra ID

title: Edenred UAE is the UAE's largest salary processing provider serving more than 6,000 companies, 2 million employees, over 10 banks and 35 financial institutions
executive_summary: Edenred UAE is the UAE's largest salary processing provider serving more than 6,000 companies, 2 million employees, over 10 banks and 35 financial institutions. Operating out of Dubai since 2008, Edenred simplifies WPS and non-WPS payroll, improves the quality of life for employees and helps companies take care of their hardworking people - pay them on time, securely and without effort. Edenred believes everyone should have equal access to essential financial services, regardless of how much they earn. That’s why we created C3Pay for their unbanked or underbanked employees, a mobile app where employees can manage their money instantly and conveniently.

title: Piramal Capital & Housing Finance leverages Microsoft solutions to cut turnaround times of loans by 30%
executive_summary: Piramal Capital & Housing Finance Limited (PCHFL), a wholly owned subsidiary of Piramal Enterprises Limited, is a housing finance company engaged in retail and wholesale lending. In retail lending, PCHFL is one of the leading players that addresses the diverse financing needs of the under-served and unserved market in India.

title: airBaltic's ground team gets off to a flying start with Microsoft Teams and Power Apps

The optimization has helped airBaltic save 1,000 printed report pages a month and reduced the time needed for data input from two days to 15 minutes.

executive_summary: The citizens of Greater Manchester, UK, have a multitude of transit options when looking to get to their destination. products: Azure, Azure Arc, Azure Backup, Azure Files, Azure Monitor, Azure Site Recovery, Azure Stack HCI

title: Condatis revolutionizes staff management with Microsoft Entra Verified ID
executive_summary: Condatis sees digital, verifiable employee credentials as the next wave in hybrid work. Using them gives organizations an easy but trusted way to protect and support employees and create a seamless hybrid work experience. Condatis used Microsoft Entra Verified ID to help keep track of its employees in the event of an emergency or drill, create a record of their skills and training history, facilitate visitor access to locations and services, and give people more power over their digital identities. Condatis and its customers are saving time and money, building trust, increasing transparency, and becoming better prepared for unexpected business disruptions.

title: Snoonu aims to become Qatar’s first unicorn. Microsoft Azure has been supporting them to achieve that goal
executive_summary: Snoonu, Qatar’s leading online food delivery app, harbours aspirations of becoming the first Qatari Super App and Unicorn. Snoonu’s exponential growth has thrown up challenges on the scalability and availability fronts. Their migration to Microsoft Azure solved these issues and even brought down operating costs. Today, they can scale horizontally and vertically using PaaS service of Azure.

title: Condatis revolutionizes staff management with Microsoft Entra Verified ID
executive_summary: Condatis sees digital, verifiable employee credentials as the next wave in hybrid work. executive_summary: Snoonu, Qatar’s leading online food delivery app, harbours aspirations of becoming the first Qatari Super App and Unicorn. title: Social services nonprofit Barnardo’s enhances client support through Microsoft technology
executive_summary: United Kingdom–based nonprofit Barnardo’s connects hundreds of thousands of families and children in need with valuable social services each year. To best make those connections, Barnardo’s must ensure that employees have the technology they need to work efficiently and accurately, and the organization also needs to show potential donors that its work has a concrete impact. By deploying Microsoft Cloud technologies and Microsoft Surface devices, Barnardo’s has helped employees be more effective in the field, and it has gained valuable reporting capabilities that have been essential in securing funding to meet the increased demand for services during COVID-19.

title: Julius Baer empowers software engineers to develop market-leading products with an Azure-based modern developer cloud Platform.
executive_summary: For over a century, Julius Baer has relied upon traditional processes when it came to software development. But after the Swiss wealth management organization saw rapid growth, it was clear that it needed to transform its operations to stay competitive and provide products tailored to its customer base. Due to the flexibility and scalability, Julius Baer chose to implement Microsoft Azure which allowed developers to create and collaborate securely. The cloud technology has proven to provide the level of automation and freedom needed for Julius Baer’s software engineers to build customer-centric products at pace.

title: Campari Group personalizes customer experiences and builds brand awareness with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Camparistas, the 4,000 passionate employees of Campari Group, share a common motto: toasting life together. Offering more than 50 premium and super premium spirits brands in 190 countries, the company honors tradition with a twist of innovation. Building exclusive, quality consumer relationships that last well beyond the first sip, the company accelerated its digital journey to rise to the challenge of portfolio expansion, industry fluctuations, and consumer consumption shifts.

title: Old Mutual Applied Intelligence team led with technology to achieve the ultimate customer experience
executive_summary: Old Mutual is a leading African financial services group with a comprehensive range of investment capabilities. They are the industry leader in retirement fund solutions, investments, asset management, group risk benefits, insurance, and multi-fund management. The best way to describe Old Mutual is to say it is a 177-year-old business that operates like a 24-month-old start-up. This approach has been the catalyst to it being an increasingly relevant financial partner to customers.

title: Kuwait University introduces the highest level of remote education with Microsoft solutions
executive_summary: Kuwait University is the only governmental university in its country, with 40,000 students and 1,600 faculty members. The university has built a unified, remote learning environment adopting Microsoft 365, Azure, and Surface devices. Through this change, Kuwait University enhanced the educational experience for all, gained valuable data, and improved communication between students and professors.

title: Forward-thinking energy company embraces Power Platform to increase process efficiency while cutting costs
executive_summary: Equinor is an international energy company with more than 21,000 employees and present in 30 countries worldwide. To optimize existing complex business processes in support of its transition to a broad energy company, it established a Microsoft Power Platform Center for Enablement to nurture greater innovation through low-code development.

title: Tenable FEC transforms connectivity and collaboration with Azure Virtual Desktop
executive_summary: Tenable Fire Engineering Consultancy (FEC) is a key player in the building industry, specializing in combining innovative fire engineering techniques with local codes and laws for optimized, cost-effective, and safe builds. With multiple locations and clients from across the globe, the company needed to create a secure and collaborative platform for smoother operations. Since deploying an Azure Virtual Desktop, employees can easily and securely access their desktops from anywhere, on any device.

title: Wayve’s AV2.0 builds a brighter future with Azure Machine Learning and PyTorch
executive_summary: Wayve wants to accelerate and scale autonomous vehicle (AV) development by using vision-based machine learning for rapid prototyping and quick iteration. So, it developed a platform that uses the open-source machine learning framework PyTorch with Microsoft Azure Machine Learning to gather, manage, and process millions of hours of driving data per year—petabytes of data—consisting of images, GPS data, and data from other sensors. Wayve now has the scalable capacity to build and iterate driving models for complex urban environments, adjust models more nimbly, and adapt to new environments more readily.
products: Azure, Azure Machine Learning

title: Northumbria Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust adopts the Responsible AI philosophy with Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: To help patients better understand surgical risks, Northumbria Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust surgeons Professor Mike Reed and Dr. Justin Green are leading a clinical team that is applying data science and machine learning to historical data on surgical outcomes to produce individualized patient risk profiles. Using Azure Machine Learning and the Responsible AI dashboard, the team works to produce results that are meaningful, fair, and easily explainable. Their work is helping patients make informed surgical decisions, and it’s helping the Trust place surgical candidates at appropriate facilities based on their risk factors.

title: Polish energy supplier dashes toward a green future with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary:
On track to making emission-free railways in Poland, PKP Energetyka blends the analytical capabilities of Power BI with Azure Machine Learning’s predictive forecasting models.
A solution developed in tandem with Microsoft partner Elitmind enabled real-time management of renewable sources to secure appropriate energy levels for powering rails. With this new system, the company stays on course to meet the goals of the Green Railway program, foreseeing the achievement of 85% of climate neutrality by the Polish rail sector by 2030.
products: Azure, Azure Machine Learning, Power BI

title: Derbyshire Constabulary's new, digital way of working with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Derbyshire Constabulary is one of the UK’s 43 regional police forces. With a staff of 3,500, the force covers an area of over 1,000 square miles with a population of just under one million. Like many UK police forces, Derbyshire Constabulary has engaged with the National Enabling Programmes to introduce a secure digital platform with national standards that enable new ways of working and collaborating with the ultimate goal of serving its communities in better ways and protecting the public. Analytics and digital collaboration based on Microsoft Azure, Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Teams are key elements of this programme. While Derbyshire Constabulary was forward-thinking in its adoption of these technologies, its teams were taken aback by the full extent of the potential use cases that evolved as their use of the digital tools progressed. Their learnings offer useful insights for other forces around the UK.

title: Mektebim Koleji facilitated the remote learning via Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Mektebim College adopted Teams to enhance an integrated training platform for its students allowing remote learning during the Pandemic, continuing exams in accordance with the academic calendar and finding an opportunity to work more effectively from anywhere in terms of location with also financial benefits in terms of cost saving. Mektebim Eğitim Kurumları Mektebim is an educational institution that offers its students the opportunity to become a world citizen with the Integrated Education Model and Innovative Education Programs by including the requirements of Industry 4.0 in the education system.

title: Polish energy supplier dashes toward a green future with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary:
On track to making emission-free railways in Poland, PKP Energetyka blends the analytical capabilities of Power BI with Azure Machine Learning’s predictive forecasting models.
A solution developed in tandem with Microsoft partner Elitmind enabled real-time management of renewable sources to secure appropriate energy levels for powering rails. With this new system, the company stays on course to meet the goals of the Green Railway program, foreseeing the achievement of 85% of climate neutrality by the Polish rail sector by 2030.

title: Naudodamiesi „Microsoft 365“ „Lietuvos geležinkeliai“ persikėlė į modernią bendradarbiavimo erdvę
executive_summary:
Lithuanian railways company Lietuvos Geležinkeliai (LTG) runs most of the railway networks in the country. To enable remote collaboration and streamlined workflows, it implemented a cloud-first strategy, starting with Microsoft 365. As a result, all office and frontline employees could start collaborating virtually with the new system in less than 12 months.
The company has successfully created a ‘#ModernTeam,’ where each member has a strong sense of accountability and contributes to company's mission.

title: Swiss Re Drives Deeper, Faster Insights with Azure Synapse Analytics and Power BI
executive_summary: Swiss Reinsurance Company Ltd, commonly known as Swiss Re, is all about big data. As the world's second-largest reinsurer, the company relies on a continuous stream of analysis to help its clients better understand risk, enhance operations, and lower claims-processing costs.

title: World-Leading Football League, LaLiga, Leads Decision Making with Power BI
executive_summary: The largest sport in the world, football, has an estimated 240 million players, and a global fandom size in the billions. Around the world, people are coming together every day to play the sport and root on their favourite football clubs.

title: Kontent by Kentico urychluje publikování obsahu díky cloudové službě Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Kontent by Kentico is a headless content management system (CMS) that helps companies improve their content operations. Built for the enterprise market, the platform enables large teams to create modern digital experiences. The CMS was developed by Kentico Software, a company that offers quality content management products to businesses around the globe. When building Kontent, the team turned to Azure, leveraging the power of the cloud in developing a product that answers the needs of top organizations.

title: Metro South Health embraces Azure VMware Solution to enable agility and responsiveness to health service needs
executive_summary: Metro South Health, a major provider of high-quality public health services, education, and research in the Brisbane Southside delivers integrated care to more than 23 percent of the Queensland, Australia, population. Metro South Health operates five major hospitals with more than 17,000 dedicated clinicians, administrators, and other healthcare professionals who serve patients in a large geographical area across several communities in and around Brisbane; it is also Australia’s largest digital health service. With the goal of improving the integration of hardware-based IT infrastructure within the overall healthcare ecosystem, Metro South Health wants to improve the way its services leverage this technology to engage with people in its communities.
products: Azure, Azure Migrate, Azure VMware Solution

title: Romanian bank upgrades employee experience with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Libra Internet Bank offers its customers one of Romania's most modern internet and mobile banking services. Even before the COVID-19 pandemic, the bank’s clients could already manage accounts without leaving their homes. However, at the beginning of the pandemic, Libra had yet to adjust effective remote working, aiming to expand communication between employees and to reach the next level of internal collaboration. To do this, the bank made online teamwork fully possible, by using Microsoft Teams and Microsoft 365. Within a month, nearly 1,000 employees had transitioned to the cloud. Now, they can all collaborate on the go, work on their mobiles, and have reduced email load.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, SharePoint

title: Rodeo FX finds the flexibility of scale with Microsoft Azure HPC + AI
executive_summary: Rodeo FX is a Montreal-based visual effects studio that provides animation and effects to some of the world’s largest film and TV productions. The studio has brought creative firepower to the likes of Shang-Chi and the Legend of the Ten Rings, Game of Thrones, Deadpool, Jumanji, Stranger Things, and the recent Oscar-winning and visually stunning Dune. A core part of its animation process is the compute-intensive act of rendering, which finalizes and compresses each of its frames, and is managed by dedicated on-premises servers operating at near capacity. Rodeo FX uses Microsoft Azure HPC + AI and Azure HPC Cache to extend the value of its on-premises asset by gaining added compute and scale during high-demand periods so it can get its productions through rendering on time.
products: Azure ExpressRoute, Azure HPC, Azure HPC Cache, Azure Virtual Desktop

title: RBL Bank uses Azure to maintain performance through 600% growth in transactions; achieves faster data processing

It currently services over 10.66 million customers through a network of 500 branches; 1,424 business correspondent branches (of which 274 banking outlets) and 407 ATMs spread across 28 Indian states and Union Territories. RBL Bank is listed on both NSE and BSE.

Swiss company Hawa is expanding its sliding door solutions business worldwide. To optimally support this growth, the company needed new IT solutions. By having all information accessible through a single tool, agents can engage more effectively with customers.
In ORBIS, Hawa found a partner who could optimally support its changeover project, in particular the migration to the cloud. Actively involving all those affected and working together to develop a solution helped to ensure that the project was a resounding success for both sides.

title: udaan accelerates its unicorn journey with Azure SQL Database, saves on infrastructure costs
executive_summary: The difficulties faced by micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) in India as they struggled to replenish their inventories inspired a wildly successful startup. When three former Flipkart engineers saw a win-win opportunity to make life easier and more profitable for both sellers and suppliers, they formed udaan. The company offers MSMEs a new path to success. But without a scalable technology to handle millions of transactions reliably, udaan couldn’t exist. It chose Microsoft Azure SQL Database and built a highly scalable and resilient platform that lifts the MSMEs of India every day.
products: Azure, Azure SQL Database

title: RBL Bank ushers in the new normal of work; collaborates more on Teams than pre-pandemic levels
executive_summary: RBL Bank is one of India’s leading private sector banks with an expanding presence across the country. The bank offers specialized services under five business verticals, namely: Corporate & Institutional Banking, Commercial Banking, Branch & Business Banking, Retail Assets and Treasury and Financial Markets Operations. It currently services over 10.66 million customers through a network of 500 branches; 1,424 business correspondent branches (of which 274 are banking outlets) and 407 ATMs spread across 28 Indian states and union territories. RBL Bank is listed on both NSE and BSE.

title: Microsoft Project helps Dutch indoor climate system provider streamline its processes, increase overall business
executive_summary: Dutch company Climate for Life is in the business of residential heating, cooling, and ventilation systems it sells as a subscription model off the typical energy grid. With demand increasing, the business wanted to streamline processes, minimize manual tasks, and find a project management tool flexible enough to manage changes and tackle resource planning and scheduling. Today, Climate for Life is using Microsoft Project to help automate work and meet demand. The business is handling 25 percent more projects and onsite standstill days have decreased 20 percent, leading to 15 percent overall growth.
products: Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Power Automate, Project, Power BI

title: Signly adopts Microsoft Azure removing communication barriers for Deaf people using sign language
executive_summary: For profoundly Deaf people in the UK, British Sign Language (BSL) is usually their first or preferred language. The capital ‘D’ is not a typing error – it is used to denote the pride that people have in their deafness. BSL has its own grammar and sentence structure and is not a signed equivalent of English. For many Deaf people in the UK, English is a second or third language. Content in written English can present a barrier. This is why Signly created their ground-breaking technology.
products: Azure, Azure App Service, Azure Cache for Redis, Azure Content Delivery Network, Azure Cosmos DB, Azure Database for PostgreSQL, Azure Front Door, Azure Storage

title: SimpliContract leverages Microsoft Azure to deploy its CLM platform
executive_summary: SimpliContract is a SaaS-based and AI-powered, end-to-end enterprise contract lifecycle management (CLM) platform. It democratizes contract authoring and establishes effective AI-driven post-signature contract management practices. The organization’s solutions help enterprises accelerate revenue, reduce risk and expenses, improve compliance and boost productivity. In addition, the platform supports users across the entire contract lifecycle and enables internal and external stakeholders' collaboration.

title: A Saudi family-owned group with a diversified business presence unifying legacy ERP systems, empowering and leading digital transformation.
executive_summary: Established in 1958, Ali Zaid Al Quraishi and Brothers Company (AZAQ) is a 100% family-owned group in the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia. Today, the group is a large diversified organisation with a presence in various sectors and a strong footprint across the nation. AZAQ has helped many multi-nationals enter the market including Fiat, Chrysler, United Biscuits, Red Bull and Microsoft. AZAQ takes pride in its Saudi roots and continues to build strategic business partnerships to contribute towards the Saudi Vision 2030. Their cumulative experience spanning over decades has enabled the group to have first-hand knowledge and experience across a range of sectors

title: Emirates Group creates digital, accessible workplace for employees
executive_summary: Using technology to improve its processes is not new to Emirates Group. The group includes the largest airline and flag carrier of the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and one of the world’s largest air services providers, dnata. Having Microsoft as a trusted partner for years, Emirates decided to take the next step in their digitalization journey and focus on productivity, collaboration and communication capabilities for its employees. It used Microsoft 365, the Power Platform, and Azure and established a powerful and productive digital workplace.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Power BI

title: Kidney Research UK gain round-the-clock security via Softwerx expertise
executive_summary: Kidney Research UK partnered with Microsoft security experts Softwerx to support the charity's cybersecurity aims whilst staying within budget. Softwerx advised them to adopt a Microsoft-first approach by adopting enhanced Microsoft security features and reducing spending on alternate third-party solutions. The charity had no capacity or desire to build their own internal security team, so they took advantage of Softwerx’s 24/7 Managed Detection and Response (MDR) offering via the Softwerx Security Operations Centre (SOC). Kidney Research UK now enjoy affordable, eyes-on, round-the-clock, enterprise-grade security support.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Windows 10, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Sentinel, Power Automate, Power BI

title: Keventer Agro business divisions bind together seamlessly with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Headquartered in Kolkata, Keventer Agro Limited is in the food processing business and offers products across food categories such as packaged food, dairy products, and fresh products. With both franchise and own brands across 90 SKUs, the company has pan-India operations.
products: Dynamics 365 Finance

title: Data is at the heart of FLO operations, while Azure Synapse runs the core of the data
executive_summary: Moving beyond retail with a multi-channel and multi-brand business model, FLO set precedent in scale by migrating its data warehouse to the cloud, opting for Azure Synapse.

title: Data is at the heart of FLO operations, while Azure Synapse runs the core of the data
executive_summary: Moving beyond retail with a multi-channel and multi-brand business model, FLO set precedent in scale by migrating its data warehouse to the cloud, opting for Azure Synapse.

title: Engineering firm in Bangladesh employs cloud solutions to streamline daily operations
executive_summary: As the largest engineering conglomerate in Bangladesh, Energypac covers a wide range of industries ranging from manufacturing of heavy machinery to power generation. As part of its goal to be a sustainable organization, Energypac puts great emphasis on digitalization and the optimization of resources. By implementing Microsoft Azure, the company has reduced costs and streamlined operations across its various departments, as well as opened up avenues for future growth.

title: Energy leader innogy drives sustainability by simplifying photo voltaic system customization with Power Apps
executive_summary: innogy is one of the Czech Republic’s leading energy supply companies, providing around 1,7 million of customers with electricity, natural gas, and green energy solutions. Needing an easier way to create detailed proposals for custom home photo voltaic system, innogy turned to Microsoft Power Apps. Today, the energy leader can generate quotes and unique system designs 25 percent quicker. The solution also improved insight and enabled innogy to service more customers more effectively, helping thousands of homeowners switch to a sustainable, eco-friendly future.

title: OPAP empowers its partners’ agencies with Power BI Embedded
executive_summary:
Founded in 1958, OPAP is the leading gaming company in Greece and one of the most renowned worldwide. As part of its vision, OPAP aspires to offer best-in-class entertainment, with customer-centricity and digitalization being key areas of focus.

In this framework, OPAP made sure its partners’ agencies have the necessary support to make data-driven business decisions, by implementing Power BI Embedded. Microsoft’s solution allows OPAP agents to see key information about their activities, such as targets, status reports, etc. It also helps them focus on improving their operations and pursuing growth.
products: Power BI Embedded

title: Hospital Jihlava frees six months of medical staff’s time, enhancing patient-centric care with Azure
executive_summary: Hospital Jihlava in the Czech Republic keeps pace with technological advances, delivering patient-centric services to more than 350,000 patients each year. It has adopted Microsoft 365 and Azure services to ensure business continuity, unburden physicians from manual tasks, and expedite care to patients. The implementation prepared the hospital to tackle the challenges of COVID-19 and ensure seamless operation during lockdowns. The facility has since saved thousands of hours for medical personnel, reduced emergency room waiting time, and empowered healthcare workers to save more lives.

title: Anglian Water creates the workplace of the future with Microsoft Surface
executive_summary: Anglian Water is a water company operating in the East of England. It serves more than six million customers with water and sewerage services. Like many businesses, it rapidly transitioned many office-based staff to working from home in response to COVID-19. After six months, when it became clear that working from home would be a long-term response, the management team at Anglian Water reached out to colleagues to see how the new arrangements were working and to ensure that they had everything they needed to work well.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Teams Rooms, Microsoft Intune

title: Cooperative Bank of Epirus transforms the user experience with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: The Cooperative Bank of Epirus is leading the social and economic development of the Epirus region, thanks to the greater efficiency and increased security of its financial services. With the help of Microsoft 365 solutions, it empowers its employees to commit to the development of local businesses and the prosperity of financial services customers.

title: dnata Travel Group delivers better booking experience with Azure Event Hub
executive_summary: dnata Travel Group is a travel services provider headquartered in Dubai, and part of the Emirates Group. It needed a simple, cost-effective way to integrate the complex flight systems of its partner airlines. Thanks to a forward thinking, open-source platform and the power of Azure, the company has significantly reduced new client onboarding times and now benefits from a seamlessly scalable, fully managed platform, which adapts instantly to peaks and troughs in booking demand.

title: IPSO Tarım A.Ş. turned the key to its complete application solution in less than 3 months thanks to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: IPSO Tarım A.Ş., agricultural machines distributor, was looking for a complete ERP and CRM solution that could be up and running in less than 3 months. Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central allowed them to migrate 20K item cards, vendors, customers, price lists (40k), and chart of accounts in just one working day, enabling remote working and connecting with clients across the region
products: Dynamics 365 Business Central

title: Speedy Services creates a platform for further improvement with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Speedy Hire Plc is the UK’s largest hire provider, with the widest range of tools, plant, and specialist equipment. It serves more than 46,000 businesses with safe, reliable hire equipment and services to enable the successful delivery of customer projects. With over 3,500 product lines, it offers everything from everyday tools and equipment – such as hammer drills, reciprocating saws – to specialist assets, such as for lifting or powered access. From over 200 locations, its team of 3,700 colleagues deliver excellent customer service, including an unmatched nationwide four-hour delivery promise. “That quality support is what our customers expect – and rely on,” states Speedy Chief Operating Officer, Dan Evans.

title: Two Qatari schools empower students and teachers with Reading Progress on Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Qatar is on a mission to establish itself as a self-sustainable society under its 2030 national vision. Education is key in empowering the younger generations with 21st-century skills that will translate into the workplace and in people’s lives. In line with the Ministry of Education and Higher Education’s mission, two schools launched Microsoft’s Reading Progress, which has helped transform how students learn and educators teach. The AI-powered solution helps students reach reading fluency independently with help in pronunciation, reading speed, accuracy, and instant analysis of reading assignments via Insights.
customer: Ministry of Education and Higher Education (MOEHE)
products: Microsoft Teams

title: City government powers customer-centric transformation with Microsoft Purview Records Management
executive_summary: Providing residents with government services generates a lot of information in the form of records. Conventional records management practices at City of Marion in South Australia needed an upgrade. Corporate Services General Manager Sorana Dinmore and Records and Information Management Team Leader Karlheins Sohl deployed Microsoft Purview Records Management (previously known as Records Management in Microsoft 365), a breakthrough technology that transforms record management practices with a more efficient and effective solution that works seamlessly with their Microsoft 365 communications and collaboration infrastructure.

title: Empowering underserved youth in South Africa by imparting foundational skills for the digital economy
executive_summary: One of South Africa’s most pressing and complex issues is youth unemployment. Tackling the problem requires a holistic, multi-partner approach, which is exactly what Microsoft, Afrika Tikkun, and Nedbank did. The three organizations launched an e-learning platform called DigiSkills, enabling youth to acquire in-demand digital and professional skills to become more employable. Based on Microsoft’s existing Community Training Platform, the solution provides five development pathways, ranging from project management to data analytics. The blended learning model was hosted in Nedbank’s facilities and delivered through nonprofit partner Afrika Tikkun.

title: Modern communication as it should be: fast and flexible with Teams
executive_summary: The Swiss Gymnastics Federation had a traditional IT infrastructure with email traffic and an on-premise server at its center. But the significant pressure of digitization demanded new, flexible solutions. A restructuring of the system was undertaken in collaboration with novaCapta. A new system for communication and data transfer was designed with Microsoft Teams at its center. The novaWorxx solution from novaCapta facilitated further customization and expansion. Conscious change management, supported by both sides, contributed significantly to the success of the project. Key users from the various departments ensured that this was not just an IT project, but one in which all stakeholders were consulted and involved. They are the multipliers who will continue to enthusiastically support the changes internally in the future.

title: From parking app to all-round mobility solution: Parkl drives sustainability with Azure
executive_summary: Parkl helps over 100,000 customers in Hungary quickly locate, find and pay for parking spaces, EV chargers, or other services through its mobile app. Having been supported by the Microsoft for Startups program from day one, Parkl decided to scale up its mobility solutions by migrating to Azure. The move enabled the company to connect 10 times more devices through the IoT Hub, enhancing service efficiency and user experience. With sustainability at its core, Parkl paves the way towards smart city initiatives and international expansion.

title: Telecom operator A1 Hrvatska builds sustainable work culture with Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: A1 Hrvatska, one of the leading telecom operators in Croatia, is determined to streamline its work processes and services through digital solutions. The company built no-code apps using Microsoft Power Platform solutions and is exploring Azure Machine Learning capabilities for employees across the company to save time with automation and gain greater process visibility. It reduced the time needed to manage employee onboarding by 85 percent, and helped the IT support team save more than 70 hours per month in the ticket assignment process.
products: Power Apps, Power BI, Azure Machine Learning

title: Yapı Kredi bolsters bank security with Edge deployment and Microsoft partnership
executive_summary: Yapı Kredi, one of Türkiye's largest publicly traded banks, needed a new standard browser to deliver superior security and compliance in the heavily regulated Turkish banking industry, while also gaining upgraded speed, manageability, and compatibility. After collaborating with Microsoft to modify certain features, the bank deployed the modern Microsoft Edge to meet its needs and received great user feedback, in addition to improved security and performance.

title: Identifying and eliminating time drains: Biotech pioneer Biogen streamlines processes with Power Platform
executive_summary: Biogen is committed to helping people with neurological disorders. The biotech company conducts innovative, scientific research in the field of neurology with the aim of defeating devastating diseases such as multiple sclerosis, Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s, and spinal muscular atrophy. To make sure employees can give customers their full attention without being distracted by internal procedural issues, Biogen relies on Microsoft Power Platform—a tool capable of simplifying all kinds of processes both today and in the future.
products: Power Apps, Power Automate, SharePoint

title: Modern workplace for USM: the successful switchover while employees worked from home
executive_summary: Migrating an international company to the cloud and modernizing its workplaces was a major project undertaking. The two teams from USM and Experts Inside proved with a lot of creativity and motivation how this could be done even in challenging times. While the employees were all working from home, the IT infrastructure was converted to Microsoft 365, the data was migrated to the cloud, and the various applications were successfully connected. Detailed and transparent information about the progress of the project was provided on the intranet through videos, FAQs, Quick Guides, planning boards, and various other tools. Employees are delighted at how fast and uncomplicated communication has become, and the newly gained flexibility makes everyday work much easier.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: Flexibility and freedom in a secure framework
executive_summary: With migration from on-premise to the cloud and device management via MS Intune, it was possible to rebuild the entire IT infrastructure at Rubble Master in a short period of time. Quite a lot has changed as a result. The data and infrastructure are more secure thanks to the cloud solution. Device management via MS Intune provides a secure framework for the use of mobile devices without restricting the freedom of employees too much. Various processes have been automated, significantly reducing the workload for IT. Collaboration with Axians is ongoing as there are further ideas and projects in the pipeline.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Intune

title: Avromed unifies data sources with Microsoft 365 and Azure
executive_summary: Avromed is Azerbaijan’s largest importer of pharmaceutical products, with headquarters in Baku. The company’s mission is to provide healthcare institutions and the population of Azerbaijan with high-quality essential pharmaceuticals. To scale up its distribution, Avromed needed to manage and process large amounts of data effectively. It built a new data ecosystem based on Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365 to centralize collaboration and communication while relying on secure cloud storage and analytics. The team now has greater visibility across the organization with live reporting and effective data management, helping it stock and deliver much-needed products to customers across the country.

title: Switch from analog to Teams telephony brings major gains
executive_summary: In the search for a more flexible telephony solution, Fernfachhochschule Schweiz turned to sipcall, who quickly impressed with its extensive experience in Voice over Internet and an attractive price model. Working together, they rapidly converted the entire communication system of FFHS from analog telephony to an Internet-based solution for MS Teams. The new solution has not only given FFHS the desired flexibility, but has also made it possible to significantly reduce costs while maintaining the same stable connection quality. The employees are enthusiastic and see great added value through the changeover. The new solution with Teams offers so many advantages that no one wants to return to analog telephony.
products: Microsoft Teams

title: QAED, School Education Department, Government of Punjab, supports remote training and collaboration with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Quaid-e-Azam Academy for Educational Development (QAED), under the School Education department, Government of Punjab, is a premier ISO certified teacher training institution that takes the lead in implementing the Single National Curriculum for Primary to Higher secondary schools. Backed by the Government, the Pakistan-based organization empowers 368,000 private and public teachers with future skills, preparing them for the new framework via Microsoft Teams. The tool helps QAED train more teachers faster and differentiate classes, which has improved the quality of instruction while reducing on-site training expenditures.

title: Housebuilder Taylor Wimpey improves productivity and information sharing with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Taylor Wimpey is one of the UK’s biggest house builders. It aims to deliver an excellent customer experience for all home seekers and purchasers. With 23 different business units across the UK, ensuring information is shared across plots, developments and regions is key to ensuring excellence and consistency of customer experience. To make this easier, Taylor Wimpey identified an overarching need to increase visibility throughout the customer journey – from marketing, through sales and on to customer service. To achieve this single ‘golden view’ of each customer, Taylor Wimpey chose Microsoft Dynamics 365 as its business platform. Today, the business is already benefitting from the improved information sharing and visibility. Most importantly, Taylor Wimpey teams are using the information to enhance the experience for customers.

title: Coca-Cola Bottling Shqipëria unifies operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Coca-Cola Bottling Shqipëria (CCBS) is the only official bottling partner in Albania, part of the Coca-Cola system. The company runs a complex business, serving thousands of points of sale and delivery locations with a range of refreshing drinks. Needing to move past manual processes and lengthy reporting cycles, CCBS chose to implement Dynamics 365 Finance and Supply Chain Management for its flexibility and ease of integration. Now, the company and its partners enjoy streamlined daily operations, as deeper, real-time connectivity between business areas helps bring people closer together.

title: A unique effort between Akbank and Microsoft Support Services as they join forces
executive_summary: A leading company in Türkiye's banking, finance, and insurance services, Akbank keeps up its strong roots with a forward-looking vision. A digital banking pioneer in Türkiye, it is working to provide customers personalized solutions for their financial needs along with a streamlined customer experience. For the past five years, Akbank has synergized with Microsoft Support Services to introduce the Unified Support, Support for Mission Critical (SfMC) Support System and technology integrations as well as cooperation between working teams under development and uninterrupted use within the scope of the Cash Management System Projects.

title: Oppimisen ja hyvinvoinnin tukeminen Helsingin kaupungissa datan ja tekoälyn avulla
executive_summary: “In Finland, we want every child to reach their full potential,” says Pasi Silander, Head of ICT Development Programs in the City of Helsinki Education Division. “Finland isn’t a country rich in oil or other natural resources, so we have to focus on human capital by building knowledge capital and providing excellent learning possibilities for every student.”

title: Motionlab creates personalized videos on Azure to engage shoppers and increase brand loyalty
executive_summary: Motionlab is a tech company based in the Czech Republic that also has a presence in the Western Europe, Middle East and East Asia. With a platform developed on the Azure cloud, the company enables brands and agencies to create personalized marketing videos. The platform offered Motionlab the scalability and data security it needed to service its clients well. The video creation platform is easily integrated with tools for emailing, messaging, as well as CRMs, allowing clients to craft videos based on real customer information and seamlessly deliver these to emails, mobiles, apps, etc. The results have led to high conversion rates and increased brand loyalty for its clients.

title: Ashok Leyland leverages Microsoft Teams for remote collaboration and business continuity
executive_summary: Founded in 1948, Ashok Leyland is an Indian multinational automotive manufacturer. The organization was looking for an effective remote collaboration platform and leveraged Microsoft Teams to ensure business continuity amid the pandemic.

title: INTRALOT ignites industry-leading innovation with Azure employee upskilling initiative
executive_summary: With a global workforce of more than 2,000 employees, a global lottery solutions leader INTRALOT is transforming players’ gaming experiences with flexible, intelligent and innovative high-tech solutions. To support an organization-wide migration to Microsoft cloud, INTRALOT partnered with Microsoft to receive Azure training and certification to upskill its people. The learning program received an overwhelmingly positive response from employees, enabling INTRALOT to extract maximum value from its cloud technology. Technical employees were enthusiastically engaged and remained on the cutting edge of their fields.

title: Cautious CIO turns evangelist after a successful migration to end to end Microsoft Security Solution
executive_summary: E-commerce presents a valuable target for cybercriminals, and global e-commerce company QNET recognized the need to adopt a more efficient and secure IT infrastructure. The company migrated on-premises infrastructure to Azure, and replaced its patchwork of security products and services with an end-to-end strategy built on Microsoft Security products and services. The team now has greater confidence from more complete and in-depth visibility into a previously opaque environment. A once-skeptical CIO recognizes increased productivity and transparency from a safer, more productive IT infrastructure and a boosted return on IT investments.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Dynamics 365 delivers an intelligence-led, predictive approach to service and operations for Wessex Water
executive_summary: The incumbent CRM system was aging, slow and difficult to use. It didn’t give a joined-up view of the customer or the operational realities that might affect the customer’s use of the service. The business began looking for a better system that could replace the tired, legacy solution. The water company chose to switch to Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service, including Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service Insights with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Customer Service Professional. The improved view of the customer and the ease of use are helping the Wessex Water team to enhance the service it delivers to customers.

title: BRF transforms data, democratizes AI to improve business outcomes with Azure Machine Learning
executive_summary: Based in Brazil, BRF helps create a better future by producing high-quality food. As the company became more data driven, it wanted to use AI to better predict manufacturing efficiencies and make sophisticated sales recommendations to its customers. BRF launched a Center of Excellence in advanced analytics, which spearheaded the adoption of Microsoft Azure Machine Learning with its machine learning operations and automated machine learning capabilities. Business users from across the company access the models and the results to make decisions that improve profitability, agility, efficiency, and customer satisfaction.
products: Azure, Azure Machine Learning

title: Memo Migrates Critical Call Center Systems To Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: When you’re providing call center support to critical business services, medical emergencies, healthcare professionals, pharmaceutical companies and alarm systems, any interruption to services can result in adverse outcomes for patients and often demanding customers. So as your company scales, how do you bring the IT systems alongside it without affecting customer service?

title: RMIT future-proofs the university-to-student connection with Microsoft Entra Verified ID
executive_summary: Widely regarded as a technology leader in the education space, the Royal Melbourne Institute of Technology (RMIT University) furthers cutting-edge technology through its IT programs. Its Blockchain Innovation Hub, which teams up with leading technology partners to perform projects for clients, offers innovation for internal projects as well. When RMIT wanted to create a convenient, groundbreaking student-credentialing system to keep alumni connected for life, the Blockchain Innovation Hub and project stakeholders unanimously chose to use Microsoft Entra Verified ID. The result: a pilot program that ingeniously solves three key use cases with one technology.

title: The knowledge from 1997 to the present goes to the cloud with the International Payment solution
executive_summary: Meet DePauli Systems, brought to life by e-commerce pioneer DePauli AG, founded by Renata DePauli.

title: Doğuş Teknoloji opts for Azure Virtual Desktop for its increasing workforce needs
executive_summary: One of the leading information technology companies in Türkiye, Doğuş Teknoloji fosters its innovation culture with creative solutions. In response to the expansion in workforce numbers, the challenges brought about by the pandemic and sectoral needs, Doğuş Teknoloji chose Azure Virtual Desktop Infrastructure solutions. Discover how Azure Virtual Desktop brings agility to business processes with features such as remote access, productivity, improved compatibility, and simplified IT management offered in a medium of robust security.
products: Azure Virtual Desktop

title: InMobi optimizes operations and expands opportunities with Azure Kubernetes Service
executive_summary: InMobi is a leading provider of marketing and monetization technologies. With deep expertise and unique reach in mobile, it is a trusted and transparent technology partner for marketers, content creators and businesses of all kinds. InMobi’s mission is to power its customers’ growth by helping them engage their audiences and build meaningful connections. Its affiliated businesses – Glance, an unconsolidated subsidiary that offers a lock screen-based content discovery platform and video platform Roposo – help InMobi create new content and commerce experiences in a world of connected devices. InMobi is headquartered in Singapore, maintains a large presence in San Francisco and Bangalore and has operations in New York, Chicago, Kansas City, Los Angeles, Delhi, Mumbai, Beijing, Shanghai, Jakarta, Manila, Kuala Lumpur, Sydney, Melbourne, Seoul, Tokyo, London and Dubai.
products: Azure Cache for Redis, Azure Cosmos DB, SQL Server

title: MYTILINEOS streamlines large-scale logistics with Azure Custom Vision
executive_summary: MYTILINEOS, a leading global industrial and energy company with a strong presence in all five continents, places inventiveness, effectiveness, and sustainability at the heart of its global operations. Needing a more efficient and accurate way to ensure the correct loading of products at port of Aluminium of Greece, MYTILINEOS turned to a cutting-edge solution with Azure Custom Vision. Today, the largest vertically integrated alumina and aluminium producer in the European Union is benefitting from almost zero error rates when loading final products and is unlocking ever more efficiencies along its massive logistics chain.

title: ADvTECH Digital Journey – The goal is uninterrupted learning
executive_summary: As we reflect over the last 2 years and the Covid-19 pandemic, it is surreal to see how far we have come and how resilient we have become. It is perhaps even stranger to suggest that the Covid-19 pandemic has become the catalyst to even better teacher and student engagement and innovation.
products: Microsoft 365, Forms, Microsoft Teams, Whiteboard, Microsoft Viva Insights, Sway

title: Direct Line adopts Microsoft Surface to enable new ways of working
executive_summary: Direct Line serves millions of customers around the UK, supporting them with more than 14 million insurance policies. In 2020, when COVID-19 struck, the business had to quickly decide how it could continue to support its customers and ensure there was no disruption to service or claims work – despite the disruption of lockdown. Luckily, Direct Line was already exploring how to support its staff with flexible working practices, so it was able to quickly accelerate its existing best practices – which leveraged Microsoft Surface Go 2 devices and a suite of Microsoft 365 tools, including Microsoft Teams.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: Bolloré Transport & Logistics unlocks localized, customized solutions with Power Platform
executive_summary: Simply put, Bolloré Logistics (one of Bolloré Transport & Logistics’ four business units: Bolloré Logistics, Bolloré Ports, Bolloré Energy, and Bolloré Railways) is a “travel agency for goods.”
products: Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Power BI

title: HEINEKEN taps the agility needed to become best-connected brewer with Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: HEINEKEN’s flagship product has never been just another beer. Not stopping at perfecting its signature brew, the company’s lofty goal is to become the best-connected brewer. In a world where the threat landscape constantly grows and evolves, more connections equal more risks. HEINEKEN is meeting the challenge with a shift from fragmented, siloed, and costly operations to seamless digital interaction across the entire value chain. And to protect all of that, it adopted Microsoft Security solutions for the blend of security and agility it needs to keep its premier product on tap around the globe.
products: Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Drive for digitization powered by Dynamics 365 Business Central keeps CURRAX fully focused on its winning ways
executive_summary: CURRAX leverages digitization to uniquely provide one-stop shopping on customized drive technology solutions as a partner to Siemens and Flender. The company, started in 2008, believes digitization drives the future—from a product and process standpoint, and from how to effectively run its business.

title: Retraining to gain the skills of the future with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: “Microsoft has just been in my life for as long as I can remember,” says Gemma Robson, former Northumbria University student and winner of this year’s National Azure Championship. “It’s very exciting. My life has completely changed.” It’s estimated that eighty-two percent of UK roles require digital skills. Microsoft accreditations and training programmes and initiatives like the Microsoft Azure Championship have an important role to play in efforts to meet the huge challenge to ensure the UK workforce has the skills it needs to drive national competitiveness.
products: Azure

title: DIGITAL TRANSFORMATION WITH SPEED
executive_summary: Change is probably the greatest hurdle people face on a day-to-day basis, but there is no denying that change in most circumstances is the catalyst to an improved environment or system. It has been said “don’t fear change. Yes, you may lose something good, but you may also gain something great.” What makes the AfroCentric Health digital story such an amazing story is its quick ability to change, adapt, and flourish in a short period of time.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365 Enterprise, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Purview Data Loss Prevention

title: Kensington Mortgages slashes mortgage performance modeling HPC runtimes from 20 hours to 25 minutes with Azure Batch service
executive_summary: Kensington Mortgages doesn’t fit the average mold for lenders when it comes to home loans. Many lenders focus on simple income and record of employment profiles to determine lending criteria for new customers. Instead of penalizing loan applicants who don’t meet all the traditional criteria, Kensington considers more complex income circumstances that mainstream lenders don’t typically accommodate.

title: Mixed reality helps GE Healthcare train engineers to service complex equipment
executive_summary: GE Healthcare manufactures many of its most complex medical equipment, such as CT and MRI scanners, in China. The maintenance of these sophisticated equipment requires that service engineers undergo an intensive training and certification process. Working with Microsoft MRPP partner Adjacentech Corporation, GE Healthcare developed a mixed-reality training system that uses HoloLens 2 to improve training efficiency and expedite knowledge retention.
products: Azure AI Services, Azure Object Anchors, Azure Remote Rendering, Azure Spatial Anchors

title: Hello Lamp Post builds on Microsoft Azure to smartly connect people and places
executive_summary: “We want to help every community in every corner of the world to bring people and places closer together,” enthuses Tiernan Mines, CEO and Co-Founder at Hello Lamp Post.

title: Hello Lamp Post builds on Microsoft Azure to smartly connect people and places
executive_summary: “We want to help every community in every corner of the world to bring people and places closer together,” enthuses Tiernan Mines, CEO and Co-Founder at Hello Lamp Post.

title: Innovative cloud technology consultancy LAB3 chooses Microsoft Security platform for itself and its customers
executive_summary: Trusted IT consultant and Microsoft Gold partner LAB3 specializes in cloud-forward IT solutions for enterprise and government clients. So it makes sense that its own infrastructure can serve as an example for customers looking for their own state of the art security and compliance solution. LAB3 chose technology from Microsoft Security, protecting its internal production and development networks with Microsoft Defender extended detection and response tools, and including orchestrated organization-wide security information and event management (SIEM) from Microsoft Sentinel.

title: THE GREAT MIGRATION TO THE CLOUD
executive_summary: What makes the Royal Eswatini Sugar Corporation (RES) an amazing organization is they have decided to be the agents of change on the African continent. They are an organization that puts people first. They have built over 7 schools in Eswatini, support 160 000 government schools in Africa, and provide their employees and their dependents with housing and infrastructure. This is a company making a world of difference.

title: Mukuru Shared Services(Pty) Ltd (as part of the Mukuru Group) migrates to Microsoft 365 to scale securely and intelligently.
executive_summary: The Mukuru Group of Companies (“Mukuru”) is one of the largest money transfer providers in Africa and a leading Next Gen Financial Services Platform that offers affordable and reliable financial services to the emerging consumer.

title: Enabling Remote Learning During the Pandemic
executive_summary: Established in 2009, IGA is a Tunisia-based software company that specializes in insurance solutions. Its existing IT infrastructure was not giving the results and performance it was looking for, impacting its customers’ business. The company upgraded and modernized its solutions by moving its applications to the Azure cloud. With the switch to Microsoft, IGA ensured the scalability of applications, making it affordable for all. It also minimized downtime for its customers.

title: A1: Creating a digital space for collaboration
executive_summary: When the pandemic hit in early 2020, many saw the interruption to face-to-face working as an impediment to collaboration. This wasn’t the case for Austrian telecommunications giant A1, which took a different approach to remote working. They saw it as an opportunity to reimagine the workplace, using the switch to digital communication tools to enhance teamwork and co-operation across the entire organisation. Relying solely on the Microsoft environment, they embarked on perhaps the greatest test of their new way of working – a virtual festival focussed on the topic of collaboration and co-creation.

title: Inclusion Scotland shows that disabled people can do so much more with Microsoft
executive_summary: “Microsoft technology makes sure that disabled people do not feel they’re a burden,” says Raj Jeyaraj, Head of Operations at Inclusion Scotland.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Word, Surface Book, Surface Go

title: Global agribusiness company reduces operational technology risk with Microsoft Defender for IoT and Microsoft Sentinel
executive_summary: Global agriculture supply chain company COFCO International wanted to increase visibility into operational technology (OT) risk within its specialized industrial plants around the world. It chose to deploy Microsoft Defender for IoT, an agentless solution which offers the local monitoring and control that plant personnel require, along with global visibility for the security operations team. Paired with Microsoft Sentinel as COFCO International’s cloud-based SIEM/SOAR solution, the solution has already proven effective in proactively securing the company’s production environment.
products: Windows 10, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Leading investment group in the insurance and reinsurance fields gets ahead of business challenges using Microsoft Power Apps
executive_summary: Financial holding company Chedid Capital is a leading investment group in the insurance and reinsurance fields. The group operates across Europe, the Middle East, Africa and South Asia.
