To keep pace with its dynamic expansion, the company has built internal business applications to help streamline workflows using Microsoft Power Apps. A key example is a performance appraisal system that currently provides 600 employees in 15 global entities with transparency and consistency throughout the appraisal process. The same app has the potential to expand coverage to 1400 employees across 61 entities once all subsidiaries—including the recently acquired Ascoma group—are onboarded to the system. Another app for customer relationship management improves data visibility, leading to higher efficiency and performance of sales teams. The result is easier coordination and faster processing of data, which leads to greater productivity.

title: Mailmodo relies on Azure to bolster its email marketing platform
executive_summary: Mailmodo is an email marketing platform that helps businesses create and send interactive emails, embedding forms and widgets such as calendars, shopping carts, NPS surveys within them. It is bringing Web 2.0-like features to emails, so that users can interact within the email itself, without going through numerous redirections. This reduces attrition and increases conversion, benefitting marketers.

title: AXA UK sets the pace on insurance quotes with Azure Machine Learning and managed endpoints
executive_summary: AXA UK provides competitive car insurance quotes for customers via online aggregator sites, and the company needs the agility to respond to market conditions and quickly change its pricing algorithms. So, it’s moving to a Microsoft Azure platform as a service (PaaS) cloud environment that uses managed endpoints in Azure Machine Learning to automate deployment of new pricing models. AXA looks forward to staying ahead of the market, innovating, and delivering more value to its customers.

title: NextBillion AI enables seamless location data services with Azure
executive_summary: NextBillion AI (NextBillion) is an industry-leading spatial data and AI platform that helps enterprises build, scale, and manage their own mapping ecosystem. The company enables enterprises to tackle highly complex location problems with the help of tailored location and navigation technology solutions. It offers location tools and APIs such as last-mile delivery, telematics, logistics, transport, food delivery, automotive, and ride-hailing/ride-sharing.
products: Azure, Azure Marketplace, Azure Storage

title: Gjensidige builds on GitHub and Azure to put security front-and-center in new application platform
executive_summary: Gjensidige, the largest insurance company in Norway, must do all that it can to keep customer data secure. To achieve this, the company built on the combined capabilities of GitHub Enterprise and Microsoft Azure to deliver a modern ‘DevSecOps’ environment that puts security front-and-center at all times. Developer-first security tooling integrates seamlessly into existing development workflows, helping developers to write more secure code, embrace security best practices, and respond quickly to software supply chain vulnerabilities. All stakeholders can collaborate on security as a shared responsibility, enabled by policy automation and deep, real-time visibility into the company’s security posture.

title: Rabobank selects Power Platform as its default development platform for internal process automation
executive_summary: Rabobank is the second-largest bank in the Netherlands, with more than 40,000 employees in 38 countries. As part of a broad digitization strategy, Rabobank adopted Power Platform to streamline internal processes and today runs more than 2,500 Power Apps and Power Automate solutions. Power Platform was recently chosen as the default platform for all internal application and business process automation development.
products: Azure, Dataverse, Power Apps, Power Automate

title: KFC Pakistan becomes world’s first fast food retailer to adopt Dynamics 365 for back office and front office operations
executive_summary: The country’s biggest food retailer, KFC Pakistan, has been growing aggressively in the past years. With this growth in value and volume came a new set of challenges—the company was quickly outgrowing its legacy systems. The quick-serve restaurant (QSR) implemented Microsoft Dynamics 365 to catalyze its growth. This adoption provided the speed, flexibility, and customization that other Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) platforms couldn’t deliver. The results were immediate and impressive—KFC Pakistan significantly improved efficiencies and saw a sharp drop in wastages, continuing its legacy of growth.
products: Dynamics 365, Microsoft 365

title: Sustainable jeans and sneakers manufacturer chooses Microsoft 365 to stay one step ahead
executive_summary: When you wear a pair of 1083 jeans or sneakers, you know exactly where the fabric was dyed, where the seams were sewn, and where the shoelaces were made. The goal of 1083 is to create clothing that looks great and contributes to a circular economy, an approach that prioritizes recycling and reusing materials to combat waste, all while creating new jobs by supporting the textile industry close to home. “1083 is the distance between the two most distant cities in France,” explains Thomas Huriez, President of 1083. “Our mission is to manufacture jeans and sneakers at a distance of less than 1,083 kilometers from our customers.”

title: Dynamics 365 improves collaboration and user experience at global bank, HSBC
executive_summary: “The pace is fast in terms of trying to keep up with the latest technologies, but also to keep up with our competitors,” emphasises Harsha Goodlad, CIO Frontline Effectiveness, Marketing & Sustainability, Wholesale Banking, at HSBC.

title: Microsoft Synapse technology, takes Multichoice analytics to the next level
executive_summary: As Africa’s leading entertainment company, MultiChoice delivers Direct To Home (DTH), Digital Terrestrial Television (DTT) and online video entertainment services through its entertainment platforms – DStv, GOtv, Showmax and DStv Now – to approximately 20 million subscribers across 50 countries in Africa. MultiChoice Group is the parent company of MultiChoice South Africa (including SuperSport, M-Net and DStv Media Sales), MultiChoice Africa Holdings, Showmax Africa and Irdeto.

title: Colin’s till application scores a modernization story in retail digitalization
executive_summary: Colin's, part of Eroğlu Holding, is a Jean-focused fashion retailer operating at 600 points of sale in 38 countries. A prominent name in business since its establishment in 1983, it has proved itself as a popular brand: In Russia, where it has 190 stores, one of every two jeans sold has Colin’s tag on it. Colin's long-established cooperation with Microsoft is going to new heights recently with the onboarding of a pioneering project set off in 2021. Have a look at the specifics of this one-of-a-kind thinking and explore what Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)`s centralized and scalable solutions can offer for fashion retail going forward.

title: Microsoft Azure fuels a new solution to make flying greener for Satavia
executive_summary: “What we’re showing you can do here is – across all operators – be able to avoid contrail formation and that we can really reduce a huge amount of climate impact from the aviation industry,” emphasises Elliott Bussell, Head of Data Science at Satavia. Contrails heighten the effect of global warming, accounting for almost two-thirds of the entire climate impact of aviation. Now, Satavia, a UK start-up based in Cambridge, hopes to eliminate 60% of aviation’s climate impact through its innovative AI-powered tech solution.

title: The Red Sea Development Company boosts performance reporting utilizing Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: The Red Sea Development Company (TRSDC) is developing the 28,000 km2 Red Sea Project as a key part of Saudi Arabia’s transformation into a global tourism hub. TRSDC has planned and is building every aspect of the destination to ensure it fulfills its ambitions to be the world’s most ambitious regenerative tourism project. To manage hundreds of key performance indicators (KPIs) across multiple departments, the company deployed Microsoft SharePoint and Power Platform. With it, TRSDC accelerated KPI reporting and team collaboration, keeping the company firmly on track towards achieving its ambitious goals.

title: ANDRITZ: Offering next generation service through a cost-saving, mixed reality solution
executive_summary: Like any global manufacturer, the reputation of ANDRITZ GROUP relies on the quality of the equipment it produces. From production to installation, service and maintenance, engineers and product experts spend a lot of time travelling between factories and customer sites. However in 2019, ANDRITZ started implementing a more sustainable and efficient solution to give customers hands-on support from anywhere in the world. An impressive digitalization for this international plant engineering group, which provided essential remote-working capabilities during the travel restrictions in 2020 and far beyond.
products: Dynamics 365 Remote Assist, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: Qatari ministry leveraged the Microsoft Teams platform to streamline communication with 60,000 public employees
executive_summary: More than 60,000 government employees in Qatar use the Mawared platform to manage their work-related resources. Traditional channels were insufficient to communicate effectively with such a large user base. Qatar's Civil Service & Governmental Development Bureau (CGB) created a broadcasting app on Microsoft Teams to streamline messaging and an automated workflow to manage change requests. Moving communications to the Teams platform resulted in improved agility, transparency and user engagement.

title: Phihong scales out its fast-growing operations with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Phihong has been making the environment greener for 50 years with its world-class energy solutions including power adaptors, power over ethernet, electronic vehicle chargers, and worksite radio for various industries. Still growing, Phihong needs innovative technology solutions that can help to meet its strong demand growth and help the company deliver on its promise of excellent customer service. Phihong is moving to Microsoft 365, Power BI and Microsoft Dynamic 365 to gain actionable, AI-powered predictive insights into its operations and customers services capabilities across multiple data sources. This is preparing the company for the future, with a flexible and resilient operational process that can expand and adapt as the business grows and responds to changes in the global marketplace.

title: Indus Towers fuels data-led, scalable decision-making with Microsoft Power BI
executive_summary: Indus Towers Limited is India's largest passive telecom infrastructure company. It deploys, owns, and manages telecom towers and communication structures for various mobile operators.
products: Azure Databricks, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: VuNet Systems leverages Azure to provide observability and AI-driven insights to customers
executive_summary: VuNet Systems (VuNet) has an integrated platform which uniquely combines Big Data, Domain-Centric ML Models and MLOps to accelerate digital transformation at organizations. Its AI-led business observability platform vuSmartMaps™, connects business, operations, and user experience at scale through an intelligent unified view of business journeys for digital enterprises.

title: UK health and social care services provider streamlines its clinical model with Power Platform
executive_summary: Surrey and Borders Partnership (SABP) NHS Foundation Trust provides health and social care services for people in Surrey, England, and surrounding counties in the United Kingdom. To deliver applications customized to specific health and care needs, SABP has deployed more than 30 solutions using Microsoft Power Platform.
products: Microsoft 365 E5, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI

title: SOS Children’s Villages builds an always-on AI friend for caregivers with Azure Cognitive Services
executive_summary: SOS Children’s Villages helps children in more than 130 countries and offers childcare training to parents and caregivers. When the nonprofit needed to expand training beyond the classroom, it used Microsoft Azure Bot Service and Azure Cognitive Services to build a multilingual digital care assistant. Parents and caregivers now have constant access to instant support, and non-IT staff can easily maintain FAQ content. The nonprofit is scaling the bot to support more languages and communities to help even more parents deliver the healthy, loving care children need.
products: Azure, Azure AI Bot Service, Azure AI Services, Azure AI Language

title: Menzies Aviation empowers frontline staff with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Menzies Aviation delivers time critical aviation services to customers around the globe, including ground services, fuelling services and air cargo services. The company was established in 1833 in Edinburgh and is still headquartered in the city. Today, Menzies is an international business employing more than 25,000 people in 37 countries. While office staff enjoyed all the benefits of Microsoft 365, its frontline workers lacked a corporate digital identity – making communication difficult. The Menzies Aviation team spotted an opportunity to use Microsoft Teams to improve communication and engagement with frontline workers. In doing so, they delivered some extra, unexpected benefits. Their achievement of delivering throughout the pandemic offers an optimistic vision of what can be achieved through passion and innovation – even with a small team.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: Polish environment fund joins forces with Microsoft to help citizens save energy and reduce air pollution
executive_summary: The National Fund for Environmental Protection and Water Management powers a greener future for Poland. Its environmental grant programs allow citizens to obtain funding for air pollution prevention and energy efficiency home improvements. To speed up the process, it developed an online application portal based on Azure. The entire grant submission and verification process has been considerably simplified.
customer: National Fund for Environmental Protection and Water Management
products: Azure

title: Business Finland: boosting innovation with intelligent data insights
executive_summary: Business Finland works to support Finnish companies to grow their businesses through innovation at home and abroad. This is a well-oiled machine and at its core is a CRM system built on Microsoft Dynamics 365. Greater data insights have helped it support thousands of Finnish companies through the COVID-19 pandemic, increasing their export sales by 20%, and allowing the Finnish government to fund topics and initiatives that align with its strategic goals. It is a platform that sets a global standard for business support mechanisms the world over.
products: Dynamics 365, Dynamics 365 Customer Insights - Data

title: Emaar partners with Microsoft to deliver a five-star loyalty experience using Azure Cognitive Services
executive_summary: Each year, the Dubai Mall draws more than 80 million visitors through its doors. To enrich their shopping experience, the world's most-visited lifestyle destination offers a unique rewards program based on advanced technology. A dedicated mobile app provides customers with a wealth of information on the mall’s 1,500 stores at their fingertips. Customers can also earn points on their purchases and redeem them against luxury shopping, travel, and leisure experiences across Dubai. The loyalty program based on submitted receipts uses Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services that have achieved 92 percent reading accuracy.

title: SwiftAnt transforms Insurtech at Zero CAPEX with Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: SwiftAnt provides insurance technology solutions aimed at fostering digital transformation of insurers using advanced automation and artificial intelligence tools. The company has a presence in India, US, UAE, and Kenya.

title: Slovakian banking leader Slovenská sporiteľňa empowers staff and clients with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: With roots dating back to the 19th century, Slovenská sporiteľňa is the largest commercial bank in Slovakia. Needing to ensure effective remote collaboration at the start of the COVID-19 pandemic, the banking leader accelerated its switch to Microsoft Teams. Thanks to educational programs and the work of the bank’s digital champions trained by SoftwareONE, Slovenská sporiteľňa’s digital transformation program with Microsoft 365 has grown. Employees are enjoying more efficient and effective hybrid work, while clients benefit from seamless Microsoft Teams-based virtual conferencing with their personal bankers from anywhere.

title: Dynamics 365 brings amazing customer experience to NatWest
executive_summary: NatWest is one of the largest banks in the UK and its business banking team supports over one million business customers. The banking group has a strong heritage: it can trace its roots back to the 1640s. Its commitment to its customers remains front and centre and, as part of this, the bank is keen to digitalise to meet the demands of twenty-first century retail and business customers while remaining true to its customers and its heritage.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Service

title: India’s leading food ordering and delivery platform, Swiggy, uses Power BI for a low-cost powerful data solution
executive_summary: Founded in 2014, Swiggy is India's leading hyperlocal food ordering and delivery platform. The company processes millions of customer orders each month while operating in 500+ cities with 120,000+ restaurants on its platform. One of the key goals for the organization is to build a data-driven culture by enabling democratization of insights throughout the organization. A robust BI platform was one of the first goals for Swiggy.
products: Microsoft Entra ID, Power BI

title: Singapore-based renewable energy company Sembcorp digitalizes to create synergetic employee experiences
executive_summary: As one of the largest energy players in Singapore, Sembcorp Industries (Sembcorp) has a balanced energy portfolio with substantial renewable energy capacity across the world. Sembcorp seeks to meet the rising global demand for sustainable solutions while ensuring a safe and flexible workspace during the COVID-19 pandemic. The company has set up its modern workplace by accelerating deployment and adoption of Microsoft 365, particularly Microsoft Teams, for connectivity and collaboration.

title: Anima Mentis: leading mental health prevention with a data-driven approach
executive_summary: Austrian mental health provider Anima Mentis has developed a ground-breaking solution that uses data and AI to prevent and treat mental illnesses. The idea is that by studying how a person reacts to different events and occasions, it’s possible to anticipate how they’ll react to similar events in the future – and therefore prepare them for any circumstance. Anima Mentis is doing this by collecting a broad range of biometric, medical and contextual data both at and outside its center. With the help of innovation service provider Zühlke Austria, the organization is realizing a cloud-based AI platform that analyzes information to produce tailored recommendations for patients, who can use them to avoid burnout and train their mental strength.

title: Decathlon rewards Romanian shoppers with Azure-hosted loyalty program built on ASP.NET
executive_summary: Decathlon is the largest sporting goods retailer in the world, active in 57 countries with more than 1,600 stores. In Romania, the sports retailer is present since 2009, having more than 28 physical stores plus the online platform, and reaching 1500 employees in 2021. Needing a more effective way to engage, retain, and reward its thousands of Romanian customers, the company turned to Azure and ASP.NET as the foundations for its loyalty program. Thanks to instant data available Decathlon is tapping into the key insights it needs to provide industry-leading service that keeps customers coming back.
products: .NET, Azure, Azure App Service, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL Database

title: Varde Municipality has significantly increased its security and compliance by implementing microsoft 365 E5.
executive_summary:
The threat from cybercriminals has never been greater. And the new challenges require that security and compliance are thought through from the start. Therefore, the Microsoft 365 E5 license has given Varde Municipality a range of security tools. In Varde Municipality, the cloud-based digital solution with Microsoft 365 E5 provides employees and users with a secure framework to work under while ensuring that public security and infrastructure requirements are pre-thought in and continuously updated. Varde has thus got a solution that brings everything together on a platform, ensures compliance with GDPR and strengthens IT security.

In this video, you can hear more about Varde Municipality view and experiences using Microsoft 365 E5.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Service

title: Saudi Arabia's Sakani program speeds up customer service with Microsoft Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Sakani, a program under the National Housing Company (NHC) of Saudi Arabia, is a real estate initiative designed to support and enable Saudi citizens to own their home. Sakani is transforming its online services to improve the experience and satisfaction of Saudi citizens. Its new Customer Relationship Management (CRM) platform aims to reduce the time taken to resolve Sakani’s customer service inquiries. Powered by Dynamics 365 Customer Service and Sales, the platform enabled ticket resolution in three hours, from a previous average of 15 days.
products: Dynamics 365 Customer Service, Dynamics 365 Sales, Power Apps

title: Dubai Airports enables hybrid work and remotely carries out major facility maintenance and improvements despite pandemic
executive_summary: Dubai Airports, operator of Dubai International (DXB), the busiest international airport in the world is a key contributor to Dubai’s GDP. When COVID-19 hit, it had to shut down all passenger operations and enable employees to work from home. Within 48 hours the airport rolled out Microsoft Teams for more than 2,000 staff members to continue working remotely. Dubai Airports also used this time new technology for a major overhaul of its train systems and to perform maintenance work on the airfield and buildings, minimizing disruption for passengers.
products: Microsoft Teams

title: Jotun modernizes key business apps to run on Azure
executive_summary: The Jotun Group is a global supplier of decorative paints and marine, protective, and powder coatings. As part of its strategy to migrate on-premises applications to the cloud, the company recently modernized nine key business apps to run in a platform as a service environment on Microsoft Azure. Jotun completed the project in less than a year with help from the Azure Migration and Modernization Program and development partner Infosys—from project kickoff and landing zone build-out through modernization and deployment of all nine apps. Today, those apps perform better, experience less downtime, and cost less to operate. Software releases have accelerated from two to three per year to every two to three weeks, and a single team now owns each application end to end—with deeper insights and new tools for optimizing application performance, security, and costs.

title: Organica Water optimizes wastewater treatment processes while driving sustainability with Azure and Power BI
executive_summary: Organica facilities appear far more like beautiful botanical gardens than wastewater treatment plants. By enabling customers around the world to build and operate space- and energy-efficient biological water treatment facilities, Organica Water is helping address the challenge of urban water scarcity. With more than 120 treatment plants, it’s important to have an efficient way to remotely monitor and actively manage water quality, Organica turned to Microsoft Azure and Power BI for a solution. Today, the bio-centric company is better equipped to ensure only the purest water is made available for re-use, while advancing in their sustainability goals by reducing travel, manual work and energy use.
products: Azure, Azure IoT Hub, Azure SQL Database, Azure Stream Analytics, Microsoft Teams, Power BI

title: Invitalia implements secure cloud-first strategy with Check Point and Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Invitalia is Italy’s national agency responsible for inward investment and economic development across the country. To effectively support its growth and emerging infrastructure needs, Invitalia implemented Microsoft Azure and tapped Check Point Software Technologies to secure the cloud environment. This enabled Invitalia to expand as quickly as needed, especially during Italy’s COVID-19 peak, and enhanced infrastructure protection from Check Point CloudGuard Network Security allowed Invitalia to adopt additional cloud resources with confidence.

title: Fineksus was one of the first to adopt Windows 11 as part of its continued approach of innovative technology
executive_summary: An expert in financial messaging and anti money-laundering solutions, Fineksus, continues its growth since inception in 2002, through its Microsoft powered software and service offering. The company recently transitioned to Windows 11 as part of its technology pioneering culture.

title: Cognito Abacus turns to Microsoft Teams to overcome online learning challenges
executive_summary: Cognito Abacus is an India-based educational group that focuses on enhancing cognitive skills in children aged 6 to 13 years. The company imparts both regular and online learning programs across India.

title: The Association of Waterworks in Denmark creates a safe hybrid workplace with iGlobe's Office2SharePoint for Outlook and Microsoft 365
executive_summary: Most waterworks in Denmark are organized as cooperatives. Danske Vandværker (DVV) is the Association of Waterworks in Denmark, and its members deliver 40 percent of the total amount of water abstraction across Denmark. DVV’s purpose is to promote the views and interests of water cooperatives to the public, the authorities, and the politicians.
products: Microsoft 365

title: Everseen and NVIDIA create seamless shopping experience that benefits the bottom line
executive_summary: Shrinkage, or inventory loss, is a major problem that large retailers and grocers deal with every day. According to the National Retail Federation (NRF), the retail industry is losing more than $61 billion a year in North America alone. And it’s only getting worse—more than 23 percent of retailers have seen their shrink rate increase from 1.8 to 2 percent. So, if you have a $20 billion grocery retailer, with the industry shrink rate average, the company’s US business would have lost more than $4 billion a year to theft and other related losses.

title: Rabobank grows a safer global IT landscape with Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: With agricultural and food industry clients around the world, Rabobank has a widespread IT estate to protect. The bank’s mission of “Growing a better world together” hinges on a blend of innovation and strong ethical principles. For the Rabobank Cyber Defense Center, that means securing a vast and disparate hybrid, multicloud environment. Not content to merely keep up, Rabobank rolled out Microsoft Security solutions to implement proactive, effective security and compliance—all while optimizing cost and security team productivity.

title: TRL Krosaki leverages Microsoft Dynamics 365 to improve customer experience
executive_summary: TRL Krosaki is an Integrated Management Systems certified company and is the foremost among refractory manufacturing companies in India. It manufactures a wide range of products such as Basic, Dolomite, High Alumina, Monolithics, Silica, Taphole Clay and RH Snorkel Refractories. The company also provides technical services to customers in the form of Refractories Management Services, Refractories Engineering Services and Technical Support Services. The organization wanted to automate its sales and marketing processes and create a central data repository to make customer-related operations more efficient and effective, and selected Microsoft Dynamics 365 for this purpose. Intech Systems, a Microsoft Gold-Certified partner, helped implement the solution in the organization’s operations.

title: Heineken partners with Microsoft to become the best-connected brewer
executive_summary: “Heineken wants to become the best-connected brewer and actually that's based on our history. We have strong connections with our consumers and have known them for 157 years,” says Ronald den Elzen, CEO, Heineken.

title: Czech bank, Česká spořitelna, reshapes customer experience with Azure-based solution
executive_summary: Česká spořitelna is more than a bank—it educates people on how to better manage their finances in order to achieve personal prosperity. By enabling its customers to achieve more, the company empowers individuals to contribute to the growth of the Czech Republic as a whole. To bring its services to new levels, the company implemented Quadient Inspire Flex—a customer communications management solution from Microsoft partner Quadient—to improve customer communications. Based on Microsoft Azure cloud, Inspire is highly scalable, enables cost optimization, and enhances security, so that the bank can offer the best experience to its customers.

title: Hisar Schools Include Artificial Intelligence in Education with Microsoft!
executive_summary: Hisar Schools, which has been raising researchers, self-confident and high-aware individuals for 25 years, reflects its modern and future-oriented vision to all its students.
products: Azure Stack Edge

title: Delhi University's School of Open Learning embraces virtual classes with Teams
executive_summary: University of Delhi’s School of Open Learning is a pioneer institution in the field of Distance Education in India. Established in 1962, the college offers programs in humanities, social sciences, and commerce. When the country found itself facing the COVID-19 pandemic in early 2020 and went into lockdown, the college decided to move to virtual classrooms supported by Microsoft Teams to ensure learning continuity for its students.

title: Centrica leverages Power Apps to ensure its solutions are futureproof
executive_summary: The international energy  services and solutions company serves millions of UK consumers and businesses with the supply of electricity and gas, services and solutions through leading energy brands, including British Gas and Bord Gáis. Headquartered in Windsor, Berkshire, Centrica has pledged to support the transition to a net zero economy and has ambitions to become a truly digital business. As part of this, it implemented the Microsoft Power Platform to give staff the digital tools they need to drive transformation and value for customers. Following early success, Centrica invested further in Microsoft Dataverse to accelerate its ambitions using Microsoft Power Platform tools.

title: Quorum bases its Cyber One solution on Microsoft Sentinel, easing and lifting security for customers like CountPlus
executive_summary: Managed security service provider Quorum Systems gets the crunch its small- and medium-sized business (SMB) customers face: competing with enterprise companies means finding enterprise-level tools on a small business budget, and their emphasis needs to be on supporting a company vision, not IT security. Case in point is leading Australian accounting network CountPlus, which needed outside experts to handle cyber security. That’s why Quorum created its Cyber One portal, a streamlined way for its SMB customers to stay on top of security affordably. Based on Microsoft Sentinel, the solution also uses Microsoft security intelligence to make supporting those customers easier—a win for everyone.

title: Nivy Watch gains unmatched scale and simplicity with Azure Cosmos DB
executive_summary: Nivy Watch is a leading maker of smartwatches designed for professional use. Originally used primarily as personal fitness trackers, smartwatches are quickly gaining a foothold in the business world by offering crucial insight into employee and process efficiency. Using specialized sensors, antennas, and software, Nivy watches can calculate how long it takes an employee to perform a task, along with the distance they traveled—allowing businesses to make on-the-fly adjustments that streamline workflows. When Nivy Watch’s existing database struggled to keep up with increasing demands, it turned to Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB to gain the speed, scale, and simplicity the 10-person team needed to win customers and drive growth.
products: Azure Cosmos DB, Azure IoT Hub, Azure SQL Database, Power BI

title: Siemens Healthineers uses Anomaly Detector to identify anomalies in X-ray tube production
executive_summary: With a huge number of installed systems worldwide, Siemens Healthineers is one of the biggest manufacturers of X-ray tube assemblies used for medical applications. To detect and respond to anomalies within the production process as early as possible, Siemens Healthineers is developing AI-based solutions for analyzing vast amounts of production data. One specific application involves monitoring the performance of liquid metal bearings by screening multivariate time series for anomalies. To streamline the processes, Siemens Healthineers follows the MLOps methodology. Siemens Healthineers partnered with Microsoft to rapidly build a prototype on Azure, including services for IoT connectivity, data storage, and machine learning lifecycle management. Siemens Healthineers applied Anomaly Detector—a multivariate anomaly detector capability within Microsoft Azure—within the use-case scenario. Anomaly Detector not only uses a state-of-the-art machine learning model architecture, but also provides explanations about the algorithm’s conclusions.
products: Azure

title: The Met Office partners with Microsoft Azure to chart the UK’s path to a Net Zero future
executive_summary: Charting the path to net zero and establishing what the weather is going to look like as the climate changes is a highly data-intensive task. Given these huge technological demands, The Met Office selected Microsoft as its partner using Microsoft Azure, Azure Data Lake and Cognitive Services (AI) to help it deliver the innovation and the compute resources needed to achieve its ambitious goals.
products: Azure, Azure AI Services

title: New Zealand moves to a cloud-based identity solution for its 4.9 million residents
executive_summary: The New Zealand Department of Internal Affairs partnered with UNIFY Solutions to migrate the country’s RealMe identity service—more than 6 million sign-ins and authentications spanning 163 government services and 56 agencies—to Microsoft Azure Active Directory B2C, part of Microsoft Entra.
customer: New Zealand Department of Internal Affairs/RealMe
products: Azure, Dynamics 365, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Sentinel

title: Finance House offers much needed support to small & medium sized businesses with cloud-based app
executive_summary: Many communities across the UAE lack access to affordable financial products and services. Finance House (FH) acts as an economic engine for these unserved or underserved communities, facilitating an environment for them to thrive. While smaller financial service companies often find it challenging to compete against mega financial corporations with large reach, Finance House is an exception. Driven by a goal to provide exceptional service to its customers, FH is on its way to provide services as advanced as those offered by larger financial institutions—competing in the same market space through quality service and affordable pricing. Its soon-to-launch fully digital financial services will provide apps for corporate and consumer banking clients on Microsoft Azure.
products: Azure, Power Apps

title: Zero Friction delivers frustration-free metering and billing to the energy sector with Azure Cosmos DB
executive_summary: Zero Friction takes a unique software as a service (SaaS)-based approach to metering and billing for heat suppliers, solving major challenges posed by on-premises solutions: implementation can take years, and scaling is costly. Using Microsoft Azure Cosmos DB and other Azure services, Zero Friction created a platform that offers predictability, performance, and limitless scale with two apps: one that helps heat suppliers convert meter data into invoices, and another that helps end customers understand their energy consumption and make payments.

title: Kuwait’s Central Agency for Information Technology partners with Microsoft to spur digital transformation
executive_summary: Kuwait’s Central Agency for Information Technology (CAIT) was founded in 2006 to supervise the implementation of e-government plans and projects in collaboration with ministries and government entities across the gulf nation. Today, it works with Microsoft on an IT assessment initiative named Tamkeen. Focusing on cybersecurity, infrastructure, and application modernization, the project is laying the groundwork for a more integrated and secure future—both for Kuwait’s government entities and its citizens. Its key goal is to identify gaps in technology and empower entities to lead the coming waves of change.
products: Azure

title: Zensar creates Brand Center for its workforce integrating Viva Connections with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Zensar Technologies Ltd is an Indian multinational software and services company. It has offices in 33 global locations and 10,000+ employees.
products: Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Viva

title: Shree Digvijay Cement leverages Microsoft Dynamics 365 to modernize its sales operations
executive_summary: Shree Digvijay Cement is a pioneer in cement manufacturing with a legacy of eight decades. It markets cement under the trade name ‘Kamal Cement’ in various districts across Gujarat and also exports its specialty cement to many countries in the world.
products: Dynamics 365

title: Kantar uses Azure Machine Learning to help streaming services drive market growth
executive_summary: Kantar Group works with some of the biggest media companies in the world to improve brand awareness, attract more customers, and sustain financial success. Entertainment on Demand, a business unit within Kantar’s Worldpanel Division, wanted to help its marquee entertainment clients better anticipate customer behavior and better understand the propensity of customers to abandon a streaming service. Kantar trained models with Microsoft Azure Machine Learning and its automated machine learning capabilities to analyze behavioral data and profile customers. With new AI-driven insights, Kantar’s clients can make better decisions for the future to boost customer loyalty and increase their revenue.
products: Azure AI Services, Azure Analysis Services, Azure Blob Storage, Azure Data Factory, Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Machine Learning, Azure SQL Database, Power BI

title: Windows Pro-powered Acer laptops enable Kent RO Systems to drive productivity and business continuity amidst hybrid normal
executive_summary: KENT RO Systems is India’s largest and most trusted water purifier brand.  As India’s leader in water purification technologies, KENT has over 50 million customers.  Our ability to transform lab research into innovative products makes KENT the most trusted water purifier brand in India.

title: Scandinavian Airlines speeds app development, lowers costs with Azure Database for PostgreSQL
executive_summary: Technical Story
products: Azure Database for PostgreSQL, Azure Virtual Machines

title: Live Tech Games gains efficiency through its use of Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: The live tournament game concept has a unique scale challenge. As such, the business needed a platform for its games that could scale up and down flexibly in line with the huge bursts of demand that a tournament requires. Its choice of Microsoft Azure as the platform for its games development and play has also helped to deliver further efficiencies for the business. The team’s use of Microsoft Azure’s native tooling helps to ensure tight integration of technologies while streamlining work.
products: Azure, Azure API Management, Azure App Service, Azure Application Insights, Azure SQL Database, Azure Virtual Machines, Azure Virtual Network, Microsoft Entra ID

title: Japanese trading house takes advantage of SAP S/4HANA conversion to move to Azure
executive_summary: Inabata & Co., Ltd. updated its SAP enterprise resource planning solution, engaging IT partner Mitsui Knowledge Industry (MKI) to standardize on SAP Business Suite 4 SAP HANA across the global organization. Inabata also switched from the SAP cloud to Microsoft Azure for its interoperability and reliability and deployed Azure Site Recovery to keep its apps running during planned and unplanned outages. MKI migrated Inabata’s systems with minimal downtime, sparking a new business performing similar migrations.
products: Azure, Azure Site Recovery

title: Doğuş Group outsmarts cyberthreats with Microsoft Enterprise Mobility + Security and Microsoft Defender
executive_summary: With a workforce of 19,000 and more than 300 diverse companies in its portfolio, Doğuş Group is one of Türkiye’s largest conglomerates. Drawing the technology vision of the group is Doğuş Teknoloji, which undertakes the task of meeting the needs of the group in this direction. Witnessing a rise in cyberthreats, Doğuş Teknoloji realized it needed to better secure its highly sensitive datasets and improve security for staff working remotely. To improve its threat detection and resolution, it turned to the Enterprise Mobility + Security platform of Microsoft 365, Defender for Endpoint and Defender for Office 365. The Turkish group now maintains enhanced work security for its data and staff, while cutting down the time needed to investigate security incidents.
products: Microsoft 365 E5, Microsoft Defender for Endpoint, Microsoft Defender for Identity, Microsoft Defender XDR

title: Bodega Doña Felisa migrates ERP to TIPSA VinoTEC suite for Microsoft Dynamics 365 and simplifies quarter-end closing from days to hours
executive_summary: Bodega Doña Felisa S.L., a family-owned business dedicated to producing and selling select wines, required extensive, lengthy reporting to regional, national, and wine authorities. The young and dynamic board of directors engaged TIPSA S.L., a Microsoft gold partner providing business expertise for the wine, food, and beverage industries. TIPSA recommended migrating Bodega Doña Felisa to VinoTEC, a cloud-hosted, subscription-based winery management solution developed by TIPSA on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central and natively integrated with Microsoft 365. The modern, collaborative, and secure workspace enabled the winery to grow operations and reduced quarterly reporting from days to hours.

title: DenizBank supports data scientists with its pioneering Data Warehouse Project
executive_summary: Since its foundation in 1997, DenizBank has invested heavily in technology, R&D, and innovation. The bank, which had founded Türkiye's first Digital Generation Banking Department in 2012, was multiple times acclaimed as the "World's Most Innovative Bank" in the United States and Europe. Integrating all physical and digital touchpoints with the customer through a "phygital" strategy, the organization has blazed a new trail in Türkiye with Microsoft and its affiliate Intertech, which offers information technology services with finance industry-focused solutions. Denizbank launched a Private Cloud Project, paving the way for innovation in data science with the strength of Azure.

title: ERA Arqueologia manages projects, clients, and sales via the Microsoft cloud
executive_summary: N/A

title: Standard Bank of South Africa was well-positioned to transition to work from home using Microsoft identity and access management
executive_summary: The cybersecurity team at Standard Bank of South Africa thrives on pioneering security work. Based in Johannesburg, South Africa, the bank has a strong presence across 20 countries in Africa. It adopted Azure Active Directory and Microsoft Intune, now part of Microsoft Endpoint Manager, to manage and monitor user access. This helped Standard Bank transition smoothly to a 75 percent work-from-home workforce. It also earned a Microsoft Secure Score of 82 percent, which is 43 percent higher than similar organizations’ average.

title: Mindtree leverages Microsoft solutions to transform its security architecture for the new normal
executive_summary: Mindtree is an Indian multinational information technology and outsourcing company, headquartered in Bangalore, India and New Jersey, USA. Founded in 1999, it became a part of the Larsen & Toubro group in 2019. The company provides data, enterprise IT transformation and automation, cloud and consulting services to clients across the globe. The organization was facing a sizeable challenge of changing its security infrastructure in response to the remote-work environment effected by the pandemic. It deployed a range of Microsoft security solutions to create a flexible, integrated, hybrid-relevant architecture.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft 365 Enterprise, Microsoft Sentinel

title: All marketing materials in one central location: Beiersdorf relies on a digital asset management system based on Microsoft Azure
executive_summary: Photos, videos, animations, and graphics: marketing departments have to manage a large number of promotional materials. And that number grows with every new product, with every new campaign, and with every new market. Storing this volume of data locally is unthinkable—especially for companies with global operations. That’s why Beiersdorf uses a digital asset management (DAM) system called Sharedien. Hosted in Azure, it ensures that marketing teams and all participating agencies worldwide have fast access. It eliminates the laborious search for materials—saving valuable time for everyone involved.
products: Azure, Azure Blob Storage

title: Grant Thornton gives customers secure access to personalized finance insights with Azure Active Directory B2C and Power BI embedded analytics
executive_summary: Professional services firm Grant Thornton knew that finance insights from Microsoft Power BI could prove valuable to its customers. The question was how to give them secure access to its customer portal and also make sure those insights were tailored to a client’s sector and particular interests. The firm implemented Azure Active Directory B2C, part of Microsoft Entra, and wrote user policies that enabled it to offer that secure access. In the process, the firm gave employees beyond the IT team the ability to administer client access.

title: Pheasey Park Farm Primary School brings learning to life with Microsoft Teams
executive_summary: Pheasey Park Farm Primary School in Great Barr, Birmingham, seeks to inspire its pupils to “believe and achieve”. Part of the Elston Hall Learning Trust group of schools, the school was recently selected by the UK Department for Education to be an EdTech demonstrator school.
products: Microsoft Teams, Surface Go

title: "Rewriting the rulebook on Student Record Systems at TEDI-London"
executive_summary: TEDI-London is a new higher education provider for future engineers, co-founded by Arizona State University, King's College London and UNSW Sydney. It will accept its first student cohort in September 2021, welcoming them to a newly built campus in London’s Canada Water. To enable this, the TEDI-London team worked with ANS Group and Microsoft to build a modern, end-to-end student record system from the ground up, using the power of Microsoft Dynamics 365 and the Microsoft Higher Education Accelerator. Choosing these tools enabled the TEDI-London team to create and deploy the solution they needed within nine months.
products: Dynamics 365, Power Apps

title: Siemens readies for the future, takes a Zero Trust strategy supported by Microsoft Security solutions
executive_summary: When one of the world’s largest companies maps out a future-ready security plan, it needs a scalable, flexible solution to fit its complex environment. Multinational conglomerate Siemens is a perfect example. Even as it contended with the complexity of multiple non-standard systems typical of a company that continually acquires other entities, it aspired to an elevated security posture built on Zero Trust principles. It found what it needed with Microsoft Security solutions.
products: Microsoft Entra ID, Microsoft Endpoint Configuration Manager, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Purview Customer Lockbox, Microsoft Purview Information Protection

title: Ingage streamlines digital marketing reporting with Azure Synapse Analytics
executive_summary: Headquartered in Istanbul, Türkiye, Ingage was founded by Koç Holding and WPP in 2018. Its vision is to provide one-stop-shop digital marketing services to clients. Needing to replace its manual reporting processes with a modern data warehouse and self-service BI platform, Ingage turned to Microsoft Azure for a comprehensive, scalable solution. Now, Ingage has streamlined its own internal reporting and can provide comprehensive, industry-leading data insights to clients at the touch of a button.
products: Azure, Azure Data Factory, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: Power Apps: Creating an exceptional customer experience for William Russell
executive_summary: Customers increasingly want self-service options and interactive digital information. To enhance the customer experience, William Russell began by automating online quotations for its customers, using Power Apps to create a solution quickly and easily. Furthermore, it delivers tight integration with the company’s core customer records system, Microsoft Dynamics 365 Sales. The process of requesting a quote online and progressing to a sale has been eased considerably – both for the customer and for the William Russell team.

title: Vega de Yuco cuts through business information silos in a few clicks with TIPSA VinoTEC suite for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: At the beginning of 2020, prior to the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic, an entrepreneurial generation of winemakers and business managers at Bodegas Vega de Yuco S.A.T. sought to embrace digitization toward their goals of expanding productivity, enabling a secure hybrid workspace, enhancing collaboration, and increasing the confidence and agility of their decision-making. The board of directors engaged TIPSA S.L., a Microsoft gold partner with expertise in automating food and beverage production, to solve specific winemaking business needs for finance, supply chain management, sales, and customer services. After a two-hour TIPSA briefing on Microsoft technology for SMBs, Vega de Yuco undertook a strategic transformation to implement VinoTEC, a cloud-hosted, subscription-based winery management solution that integrates natively with Microsoft 365. Thanks to the modern business management ecosystem built on Microsoft Dynamics 365 and the Microsoft Power Platform, Vega de Yuco saves costs, protects its business from cyberattacks, and easily performs daily operations with a few clicks.

title: ODE Yalıtım enters a new era with its Dynamics 365 upgrade across all business units
executive_summary: A major name in insulation materials industry with large scale investments and innovative R&D and exports of more than 4,000 products to 6 continents, ODE Yalıtım enjoys the benefits of the Dynamics 365 upgrade undertaken in a very short time during the pandemics. Dynamics 365 offers the company the chance to ensure operations are efficient, up to speed and streamlined.
products: Azure, Dynamics 365, Microsoft Teams, Office 365, Power BI

title: Yapı Kredi enhances its data assisted management culture by capitalizing on business intelligence across all units via Power BI
executive_summary: Yapı Kredi, the leading name of Turkish finance sector, enhances its data assisted management culture by capitalizing on business intelligence across all units via Power BI.
products: Power BI

title: Ensuring true sustainability in renewable energy production
executive_summary: SSE Renewables is a leading developer and operator of renewable energy across the UK and Ireland. With a portfolio of around 4GW of onshore wind, offshore wind and hydro, the company has a key role in helping the UK reach its sustainability and net zero carbon goals.

title: Kuwait’s National Aviation Services (NAS) powers a safe return to air travel with Azure
executive_summary: Present in numerous airports from Morocco to India, Kuwaiti National Aviation Services (NAS) is committed to enabling air travel that is both safe and stress-free. To help power the resumption of key flights amid the pandemic, NAS pioneered a forward-thinking mobile platform on Azure through its airport technology arm ICT.aero that specializes in the sourcing and development of solutions. Not only does the platform ensure strict COVID-19 testing compliance and identity verification, it also keeps travelers informed of all government requirements. So far, more than eight hundred thousand travelers have taken advantage of the mobile solution for a safe and seamless journey.
products: Azure

title: Coca-Cola bottler SLMG Beverages adopts Dynamics 365 for business integration and operational efficiencies
executive_summary: SLMG Beverages Pvt. Ltd (SLMG) was formed in the year 2017 and is one of the premier companies of the LADHANI GROUP. The main objective behind the formation of SLMG was to combine their four legacy beverages units operations with the new business (new territory) acquired from Hindustan Coca-Cola Beverages Pvt Ltd (HCCBPL) as a single company towards managing their bottling and beverages operations in a more efficient manner.

title: Morgan Sindall drives customer engagement across eight businesses with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: Morgan Sindall Group PLC is a leading construction and regeneration company working across multiple sectors in the United Kingdom with a small operation based in Switzerland. At the heart of its operations is a focus on good customer service and putting the client first. To ensure it could continue to meet the needs of its customers, the company used Microsoft Dynamics 365 to create a centralized platform for customer service, sales, and field-service management. The company now has complete visibility into customer journeys, can resolve issues and develop solutions faster, and has improved employee efficiency and satisfaction with modern tools and automation.

title: La Pontezuela launches transformation of olive oil business in two hours with Tipsa OliTEC suite for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: Since 1974, La Pontezuela has manufactured Spanish extra virgin olive oil and offered an innovative approach for consumers to experience olive oil culture through quality gastronomy and leisure in Toledo, Spain. Seeking guidance for business modernization, La Pontezuela’s board of directors engaged Tipsa S.L., a Microsoft gold partner with decades of experience in automating food and beverage production. Tipsa quickly assessed La Pontezuela’s requirements and presented a cloud-based solution built on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central and powered by industry-specific apps. Today, La Pontezuela benefits from an accurate digital ecosystem that streamlines internal collaboration, simplifies production processes, eases online transactions through an e-commerce platform connected to CRM, and uses intuitive, real-time data analysis to make decisions with confidence, all built on Microsoft technologies.

title: SoftBank Corp. cuts monthly processing time in half after smooth transition to SAP on Azure
executive_summary: Enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems handle information that is mission critical and highly confidential. At one time, it was thought unsuited to public clouds. Now, however, as familiarity with cloud services dramatically increases, users take advantage of real-time data processing and analysis to respond flexibly to a dramatically and relentlessly changing business environment. SoftBank Corp. (“SoftBank”) has long pursued innovation. In 2020, it migrated its SAP ERP environment to SAP on Microsoft Azure. SoftBank gained a platform that can respond more flexibly to sharp increases in data as the company grows.
products: Azure, SAP on Azure

title: Canadian Tech Talent Accelerator program helps Canadian talent skill up for digital careers
executive_summary: Between vacancies in IT jobs and workplace changes due to COVID-19, equipping young people for digital careers has become more relevant than ever. The Canadian Tech Talent Accelerator program brings together Microsoft, NPower Canada, Blueprint, and Canada’s Digital Technology Supercluster with the goal of training 3,900 underserved youth for digital careers. The program helps close the skills gap through hands-on learning, industry mentoring, and professional development. By supporting youth to confidently enter technology careers, the program bolsters Canada’s drive to become a digital leader.

title: bp uses digital twins in its transition to Net Zero
executive_summary: bp’s purpose is to reimagine energy for people and our planet. At the same time, it is fully committed to sustainability goals including making the transition to net zero carbon by 2050 or sooner. Patricia Rangal, VP Intelligent Operations at bp, says, “Artificial intelligence will provide key insights into our operations to help us become a safer and more efficient business. This will be a key enabler in our transition from an international oil company to an integrated energy company.”

title: Alışan Grup leads the way with its comprehensive digital transformation vision
executive_summary: A top-500 Turkish business name with an uninterrupted 7-year place on the  Fortune list, Alışan Grup employs 1500 people and operates in a variety of sectors from construction to insurance. The flagship company of the group, Alışan Lojistik A.Ş., is a market maker for the Turkish logistics business. Continuing its digital journey through 5  transition routes, Alışan Grup enjoys the benefits of cloud thanks to Microsoft Azure.

title: Government of Nunavut comes back stronger after ransomware attack with Microsoft security solutions
executive_summary: When a ransomware attack shut down computer systems at the Government of Nunavut, Canada’s largest and northernmost territory, the IT team responded with a well-coordinated strategy. But its isolation and the challenges of a harsh climate complicated technology environments, and the team wanted a coordinated toolset. It worked with Microsoft’s elite cybersecurity DART team to rebuild its network and 5,500 devices while also rolling out security solutions—including Microsoft Sentinel and Microsoft Defender for Cloud Apps—all in just weeks during an Arctic winter.

title: PROTORIA modernizes its IT infrastructure with Microsoft Azure and the guidance of Cloud Services
executive_summary: PROTORIA, the retail service provider for Samsung in Ukraine, wanted to update its long-term strategy with cloud adoption plans. Cloud Services served as PROTORIA’s trusted advisor and migration partner in this endeavor. What began with a workshop grew to a three-year collaboration involving migrating PROTORIA’s infrastructure to Microsoft Azure. Now PROTORIA uses Azure, Office 365, and Microsoft Power BI every day and saves about 20 percent each year on costs.
products: Azure, Azure Synapse Analytics, Power BI

title: RHI Magnesita: How a Synapse Analytics data platform is transforming the refractory industry
executive_summary: For more than 100 years, refractory products have played an essential role in the manufacturing of everyday materials such as glass and steel. As the world leader in refractories, RHI Magnesita wanted to expand their digital services to customers. An aspect of this involved offering not just a managed installation of their refractory products, but also continuously monitoring and identifying when these products need replacing – helping raise efficiency and avoid production having to shut down unnecessarily. Developing this kind of predictive analytics required RHI Magnesita to undertake a significant digital transformation and rebuild their entire IT infrastructure on Azure.

title: FortisAlberta prioritizes worker safety on Power Platform, boosting productivity and earning key tech award
executive_summary: FortisAlberta delivers safe and reliable electricity service to more than a half-million residential, farm, and business customers across central and southern Alberta, Canada. Operating in 240 communities across 124,000 kilometers (7,700 miles) of power lines, FortisAlberta’s team comprises more than 1,100 employees, including 350 first-line workers who need to be kept safe from preventable injuries.

title: H&M Group strikes an effective balance of Power Platform development and security
executive_summary: H&M Group is a Swedish multinational clothing-retail company with more than 5,000 stores in 78 countries and more than 53 online markets. A growing community of citizen developers has created thousands of Power Platform solutions across the company. To support development and maintain security and governance, H&M Group set up a Center of Excellence (CoE) using the Microsoft Power Platform Center of Excellence Starter Kit.

title: Retailer Sonae accelerates productivity and streamlines HR processes with Power Automate
executive_summary: Sonae is a multinational corporation headquartered in Porto, Portugal, with a diversified portfolio of companies spanning 62 countries. In a continuous focus on “improving life,” Sonae brands and companies are always looking to innovate, increase sustainability, and have a greater impact on a wider population. Sonae is leveraging Microsoft Power Automate as part of their digital transformation initiative to accelerate productivity, increase quality, and work-life enhancing solutions.
products: Microsoft 365, Excel, Power Apps, Power Automate, SharePoint

title: Conde de Benalúa transforms harvests with Tipsa and Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central, cutting finance processes from days to minutes
executive_summary: Founded in 1954, Conde de Benalúa is a Spanish cooperative whose members produce extra virgin olive oil. Its 50 employees manage the 1500-member annual harvest of 34 million kilograms of olives that are pressed, packaged, and shipped around the world. In 2015, the board of directors decided to modernize operations and chose Tipsa, a Microsoft gold partner with extensive experience in automating food and beverage production. Tipsa guided Conde de Benalúa through a migration of accounting processes onto a solution that combined apps built on Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central and Microsoft Power BI. Conde de Benalúa gained a synchronized, end-to-end solution that provides real-time visual data, enabling faster responses to partners and customers.
products: Dynamics 365 Business Central

title: Greek Ministry of Migration and Asylum streamlines migration process with Microsoft 365
executive_summary: With around 100,000 asylum applicants each year, Greece’s government established a new Ministry of Migration and Asylum in 2020. Its aim was to streamline administrative backlogs and speed up procedures for migrants and asylum seekers. However, its legacy, on-premises technology was curbing effective internal collaboration. The Ministry, in collaboration with the Ministry of Digital Governance, opted to switch to Microsoft 365 to address these challenges. Thanks to swift adoption, staff can access critical documents and collaborate securely from anywhere, clarifying workflows for everyone and accelerating the entire migration process.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, OneDrive for Business

title: Pearson empowers language students to learn faster in a natural way with Azure AI capabilities
executive_summary: Pearson helps people around the globe learn foreign languages so that they can advance in academics and careers. When primary school students learn English, they often need more practice and feedback from teachers and parents than they can get. Pearson worked closely with Microsoft to help address this need, providing input on Microsoft Azure Cognitive Services capabilities in development such as pronunciation assessment. Pearson then added multiple AI-based services to its Longman Welcome to English program, offering interactive instruction for students, support for teachers, affordability for parents, and a digital learning option during COVID-19.

title: Microsoft Azure: Transferring military skills for tech skills and a new career at Microsoft
executive_summary: When men and women retire from the British Armed Forces, they may have many years of productive working life ahead of them – and their skills and competencies are a great fit for the UK tech sector. In this series of videos, we meet some of the men and women who trained in the British Armed Forces and who have successfully transferred their hard-won skills to enjoy new careers at Microsoft.
products: Azure, Azure AI Services, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft Entra ID

title: TD Securities builds on its Microsoft 365 Communication Compliance infrastructure with a highly secure, compliant global Microsoft Teams deployment
executive_summary: IT specialists at TD Securities were focused on providing a highly secure and compliant environment built around Microsoft 365 Communication Compliance. That infrastructure would enable and underpin subsequent adoption of the latest technologies for enhanced communication and collaboration across all business units in the broader TD Bank organization. Key to that effort has been migration from an earlier environment that includes Skype, SharePoint, and third-party applications to a consolidated deployment featuring Microsoft Teams—a process accelerated by COVID-19.

title: Empowering a community of low-code, no-code developers to enhance fire service operations
executive_summary: Each of the 50 or so fire services in the UK has its own specialist skills and competencies tailored to the communities and geographies it serves. As a result, there isn’t a full suite of off-the-shelf solutions that can meet the varied needs of a service like Hampshire & Isle of Wight. The fire service began to look for low-code and no-code solutions that might allow it to achieve these quick wins rapidly. Initially, it tested Microsoft PowerApps by using what was available through the service’s existing Microsoft 365 licencing. It streamlined numerous documents and manual processes into a single app with clear reporting.
customer: Hampshire & Isle of Wight Fire & Rescue Service
products: Dataverse for Teams, Microsoft Teams, Power Apps, Power BI

title: Microsoft Azure helps business harness the power of AI for social impact
executive_summary: The partnership of Social Tech Trust and Microsoft for Startups seeks to realise some of the opportunities presented by using AI to solve some of the world’s biggest challenges. Kathy Marcham, Portfolio Manager Social Tech Trust, explains: “We created a programme that enables these purposeful founders to not only create world-class technology but to also develop their commercial skills and their social business acumen.”

title: Moneysworth & Best works smarter, drives agility with Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: For almost 40 years, Moneysworth & Best Quality Shoe Care has developed and distributed shoe care and foot care products to retailers across North America, offering the largest and most comprehensive shoe care assortment in the industry, worldwide. Owners at the family-run business wanted to streamline business processes, optimize operations, and provide better work-life balance for company leadership and employees, so Moneysworth & Best replaced an on-premises enterprise resource planning solution with Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central. As a result, the company now uses cloud-based tools to react quickly to changing markets, work smarter, and perform better with real-time business insights.

title: Sustainable digital transformation at Rolls-Royce
executive_summary: As the world transitions to a net zero carbon future, the industries in which iconic British brand Rolls-Royce operates are some of the most critical – but they are also some of the hardest to abate.
products: Azure, Azure Databricks, Azure Machine Learning, Power BI

title: AIA Hong Kong & Macau connects customers to a world of secure and trusted digital experiences using Microsoft Azure Active Directory B2C
executive_summary: Smooth, seamless, reliable, and secure are critical features for a superior customer experience in today’s demanding digital landscape. Across the board in insurance and all businesses, accelerated digital transformation in the last 12 months is driving an unprecedented urgency to provide an all-digital service. But the challenge AIA Hong Kong & Macau faced when the business opened itself and its customers to a new world of digital opportunity, was the huge responsibility to ensure this world could be trusted and secure.
products: Azure, Azure SQL Database, Microsoft Entra ID

title: Advancing women in tech with Microsoft Azure Fundamentals
executive_summary: The University of Bath is a leading British research university in the south-west of England, established by Royal Charter in 1966. Ranked by Times Higher Education as one of the top 250 research-intensive global universities, students come from every corner of the globe to study at Bath.

title: WWF Italia makes preserving the planet easier with Dynamics 365 Business Central
executive_summary: WWF Italia supports conservation work not just in Italy, but in other nations where its parent organization, World Wildlife Fund, works to save endangered species and conserve wild lands. After years of struggling with disjointed on-premises systems to track and report on funding, the nonprofit opted for Microsoft Dynamics 365 Business Central online. Now the nonprofit is making valuable staff time go farther, while also providing critically important reporting to donors, government agencies, and internal groups with Power BI. For WWF Italia, getting the greatest value out of its funds is about something much more than profit—it’s about preserving the most precious places and creatures on earth.

title: Leading digital innovation in the NHS
executive_summary: Milton Keynes University Hospital is seen as one of the most innovative in the NHS. The medium-sized district hospital provides a full range of acute hospital services and an increasing number of specialist services to the growing population of Milton Keynes and the surrounding areas.
customer: Milton Keynes General Hospital NHS Trust
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Power BI

title: ASOS implements cost optimization to fashion innovation for the future
executive_summary: Born digital, the British fashion and cosmetics retailer ASOS has always been paving the way online. With no brick-and-mortar stores to limit its capacity, ASOS has continued to grow to fulfill increasing demand, becoming a giant of the online retail space. The website sells over 850 brands, as well as its own range of clothing and accessories, and ships to 196 countries from fulfillment centers in the United Kingdom, United States, and Europe.

title: Nokia Mobile Networks builds its Digital Care Management Platform on Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: Nokia Mobile Networks is a division of Nokia, a global telecommunications and electronics company based in Finland. Technical Support Service (TSS) provides technical support for Mobile Networks customers around the world. Microsoft Power Platform has been used to digitize and automate Care Program Management (CAPM)–related processes and tasks.
products: Microsoft 365 E5, Power Apps, Power Automate, Excel, Outlook, Power BI

title: L’Oréal Americas streamlines operations and boosts sustainability by moving to SAP on Azure
executive_summary: With an annual revenue of 29.8 billion euros, L’Oréal is the number one cosmetics brand in the world. The company uses SAP applications for many business-critical workloads and wanted to increase scalability while paying only for the resources it needed. L’Oréal decided to run SAP on Azure and methodically migrated its environments beginning in Latin America. The company improved performance, lowered costs, and decreased its resource footprint, supporting its commitment to sustainability.

title: A dynamic platform for social housing
executive_summary: Clarion Housing Association is the UK’s largest housing association, serving more than 360,000 residents in more than 125,000 properties across the UK.

title: Swiss Re Magnum AI and cloud solution ready to enable data-driven underwriting and empower your automated ecosystem
executive_summary: Swiss Re is a risk knowledge company driven by the vision to make the world more resilient. Since 1863, Swiss Re has helped clients manage risk through insurance, reinsurance, and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer. Technology-enabled innovation has been at the heart of Swiss Re’s growth history. The creation of Magnum, the company’s underwriting automation tool, is one such example. Leveraging Swiss Re’s tech competences and its over 150 years of underwriting expertise, Magnum brought to the market a new way to process insurance applications, reducing turnaround time from days to minutes. To create a next-generation offering that easily accesses new data sources, leverages AI to deliver customer insights, and delivers on its fast-paced ambitions, Swiss Re decided to offer Magnum as a software as a service (SaaS) solution that brings together the power of cutting-edge risk assessment, deep analytics, and intelligent automation. The company has adopted the Microsoft Azure cloud platform, and it uses Azure Synapse Analytics and Azure App Service to deliver a fully managed solution for its clients.

title: Keeping Local Without Sacrificing Innovation
executive_summary: If you happen to live in a Norwegian community, chances are high that your digital everyday banking experiences are powered by Eika, one of the largest financial service providers in the country. Eika differs from its competitors in its truly unique value proposition. Composed of 66 independent, competing local banks, Eika brings together the best of two worlds: the unmatched experience of a local bank committed to the community where customers live , and the ability to enable secure, modern, and comprehensive financial services based on a state-of-the-art banking platform and infrastructure.

title: Improving working life in the UK
executive_summary: The Advisory, Conciliation and Arbitration Service (ACAS) is an independent public body that receives funding from the UK government. It works with millions of employers and employees every year to improve workplace relationships.
products: Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams, Windows 10

title: Syngenta Group legal team creates companywide impact using Microsoft Power Platform
executive_summary: The people who work at agricultural and technology innovator Syngenta Group prize the company’s “can-do” culture, which makes it easy to make great ideas happen. But the information and business process professionals at Syngenta Group met with a range of blockers when helping the legal team tackle productivity-dampening issues. They found that they could solve a host of routine business challenges by creating simple solutions with Microsoft Power Apps, Power Virtual Agents, and the rest of Microsoft Power Platform, putting fast improvements within reach of their colleagues without needing advanced coding skills.
products: Azure SQL Database, Power Apps, Power Automate, Power BI, Microsoft Copilot Studio

title: Britax Römer creates a unified e-commerce solution to help get car seats in more hands and protect children
executive_summary: Britax Römer prides itself on producing some of the world’s safest and most comfortable child mobility solutions, including car seats and strollers. In Europe, the company works with a wide range of retail customers who increasingly expect comprehensive, real-time digital selling solutions. To provide more robust experiences and discoverability for retailers and streamline the customer’s buying journey, Britax Römer is deploying the AI-powered business-to-business (B2B) e-commerce capabilities in Microsoft Dynamics 365 Commerce. With all product and customer journey information in a single location and the ability to provide experiences for both traditional and emerging channels, Britax Römer retailer partners can focus on delivering exceptional service to consumers and get more car seats into the hands of parents to help protect more children on the road every day.
products: Dynamics 365 Commerce

title: ABN AMRO embraces an Azure-first data strategy to drive better business decisions
executive_summary: ABN AMRO is the third-largest bank in the Netherlands, with 100 branch offices and more than 30,000 employees. Its mission statement, “Banking for better, for generations to come,” is embodied by the way it uses digital services and data to support customers during key life moments. When ABN AMRO needed a more efficient way to access and act upon data, it embraced a data mesh architecture on Microsoft Azure and Azure Data Lake Storage to unlock data insights and drive business decisions.

title: Closing the digital divide for people with disabilities
executive_summary: Founded in 1799, SeeAbility is a charity that provides ambitious support for people with sight loss, learning disabilities and autism.
products: Microsoft 365, Microsoft Teams

title: Telia simplifies processes, streamlines POS, and improves customer experience with Dynamics 365
executive_summary: As the largest telecommunications company in Sweden, Telia wanted to streamline its inventory and sales processes and create a trusted experience for customers. It considered how to connect Microsoft Dynamics 365 with its existing SAP systems while reducing the number of total systems and simplifying day-to-day tasks for staff. Telia adopted several Dynamics 365 business applications—Commerce, Supply Chain Management, and Finance—along with Microsoft Power BI. As a result, the company cut its number of disparate systems in half, gained the ability to tightly track inventory, improved its sales, and created a faster, more personalized shopping experience for its customers.

title: Dynamics solutions bring resilience for an international law firm
executive_summary: Fieldfisher is an international law firm headquartered in London. With 22 offices in eleven countries, it focuses on four key sectors: energy and natural resources, financial markets, technology and life sciences.
